author: {'steamid': '76561198065033101', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1620896243}
review: Леди и Джентльмены,  приобрести игру стоит.  По сравнению с предшественником,  очень даже нечего!  В роли темного властелина вы уничтожает добро. Присутствие рассказчика не раздражает,  а даже вызывает местами улыбки его шутки и отсылки!  Кроме случаев бесконечного напоминания о миссии компании.  Юнитов для порабощения поверхности не так много,  но присутствует вариативность в эволюции. Заклинания тоже достаточно не по плохи,  да и обустройство базы ловушками,  весьма увлекательно.  На мой взгляд стоит приобрести,  не за fullprice, конечно!

review:
虽然我通关了，但是这个游戏整体体验是真的不行。教程很粗糙，新玩家上手很容易在某个地方不知道干啥，无论是战斗和建造经营内容都乏善可陈，关键是游戏还是个慢节奏的游戏。
能算的上勉强有趣的，大概只有剧情里的那一堆烂梗了。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198308938485', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1626144907}
review:
EXELENTE HACIA MUCHO QUE NO ME ENTRETENIA TANTO. LLEVA BASTANTE TIEMPO CADA PARTIDA DE LA CAMPAÑA VOY 18 HS Y NO LA TERMINE TODAVIA. ENCIMA SI ESTA EN OFERTA """UN REGALO """ . SEGURAMENTE IRE POR EL 3. 
TE RECOMIENDO QUE HAGAS LO MISMO COMPRES EL DOS QUE NO VALE NADA Y LUEGO EL 3 ( QUE NO VALE MAS DE 100 PESOS EN OFERTAS O REBAJAS). DE TODAS MANERAS SINO ESTA EN REBAJA PODES COMPRARLOS AMBOS. PORQUE SON MUY BUENOS Y ENTRETENIDOS.

(EXELENTE LA NARRACIÓN DE LA HISTORIA, UNA RISA DE A RATOS, MUY BUEN HUMOR)

author: {'steamid': '76561198078215464', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2510, 'last_played': 1626283160}
review:
Die Dungeons Serie ist für alte Anhänger der Dungeon-Keeper Spiele und Freunde von RTS-Games welche sich gern mal auf die Seite des Bösen schlagen, genau das Richtige. Ausflüge zur Oberwelt runden das ganze noch weiter ab und Dungeons 2 bietet eine sehr unterhaltsame Kampagne, Gefechte und Mehrspieler-Optionen.

ACHTUNG: lasst ihr euch beim Dungeonaufbau zu lange zeit, dann wird euch der Erzähler schon bald auf die Nerven gehen :P

review:
Uz ani neviem, po kolku krat tuto hru hram, ale stale ma este neomrzela :).
Skutocne WarCraft stretol DungeonKeeper-a! Kazdy si tu najde ten svoj styl hrania, ci uz je to hromadny utok co najvacsieho mnozstva potvor, alebo pomale a prijemne zabijanie hrdinov v bludisku plnom nastrah a la tower defence :D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086614317', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1625406645}
review:
Narrazione a dir poco fantastica, un tocca sana per il mio humor.
Gameplay semplice e storia mista tra il buffo e il "SI DEVE LAVORARE SODO".
Personalmente ho apprezzato molto le citazioni lasciate in giro tra una missione della campagna e l'altra, ma anche le prese in giro del narratore al nostro amato Male Assoluto

[b] Consiglio il gioco? Assolutamente si, per quanto mi riguarda Dungeons 3 è il prossimo acquisto. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064823969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1623868334}
review:
Неплохой "клон" Dungeon Keeper с хорошей русской озвучкой и кучей подколов над другими играми и фильмами, особенно по "Игре Престолов". Так что если вы любитель "серьёзных" игр, то вам точно не сюда. Из ощутимых минусов только весьма неудобное управление и недоработанная система перехода между верхним миром и подземельем.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198167675013', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1710091230}
review: Если абстрагироваться от эталона в лице Dungeon Keeper 2, то игра хорошая. Легкая, мультяшная, казуальная. Так, скорее всего, и задумывалось. Но это не зло. Не чувствуешь, что играешь за злого хранителя. Нет напряжения от исследования подземелья и нет необходимости в укреплении стен. Актуальность ловушек сведена к минимуму, т.к. все гости легко выносятся юнитами. 2 актуальных заклинания - флаг и возврат. Хорошая, но одноразовая игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148682705', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1505, 'last_played': 1620989658}
review: Очень приятная игра про нелёгкую жизнь побеждающего зла. Сюжет классный, механики понятные, рассказчик - любовь. Подойдёт и любителям сложных стратегий, и более казуальным игрокам.

review: Be an evil overlord and show those goody twoshoes who's boss! The narrator makes this game. For those who like dungeon management, an absolute must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381472774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1622244597}
review:
Pretty much just a Dungeon Keeper remake with nicer graphics.   Not many improvements to the gameplay over games that came out in the  late 90's.   The rts portions in the overland were not great, controls felt stiff and not as responsive as an rts should be.   The dungeon building is very mechanical, build this room then that room then this one on each level.   Bunch of upgrades, some of which take a long time.   By the time the upgrades are all done you just steamroll the enemy.   There is never really a reason to actually build a well thought out dungeon because the heroes only come in small groups of 6 or so and you can just drop some orcs on em to wipe them out.
The humor is largely just references to movies, a few bits gave me a chuckle but disappointing overall.   
The story is unfinished, I thought the game was just getting going and next thing I'm watching the ending.   Basically a cliffhanger for the DLC and possibly the sequel.   

Can't recommend it unless you are desperate for more dungeon keeper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055377297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 3107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3107, 'last_played': 1461867478}
review:
Un superbe jeu de gestion de Donjon , ou vous incarnez le mal et devez vaincre des héros. 
Le gros point fort du jeu est le narrateur  qui au cours des chapitres va bien vous faire sourire ou rire. 
Après le jeu ressemble pour ceux qui connaisse a "Dungeon Keeper" mais en plus coloré et gaie sinon pour ceux ne connaissant pas cette formidable licence, ça arrive c'est pas grave, sachez que dans ce jeu il vous faudra construire des salles, lever une armée et anéantir le bien sur votre chemin afin d'établir votre règne.

Je vous recommande ce jeu si vous aimez les jeu de gestion et de contrôler mais surout si vous voulez ou aimez incarner le méchant car dans ce jeu c'est ce que vous êtes.

review: Habe das spiel mal als CD geschenkt bekommen, und sehr gerne gespielt. Hab es mir vor kurzem mal auf steam geholt, da ich die cd verloren habe, und seit dem letzten mal spielen sind bestimmt schon 1-2 Jahre vergangen. Aber was soll ich sagen? Es ist einfach grandios. Die story ist zwar nicht gerade groß aber dafür sehr unterhaltsam. Gameplay teschnisch echt top, ein dungeon aufbau game wie es im buche steht ^^. Kaufempfehlung für alle die nach einem coolen Strategie spiel mit etwas story und gutem multiplayer suchen.

review:
Concerning just the gameplay I would have liked to recommend the game. Taking into account the recurrent crashes, i have to discourage you from buying this game. Out of nowhere I find myself sent back to desktop in a <0,5h-interval, often even too short for the 15-minute-autosave to backup my progress. 
If this issue should ever be solved, I'd give a full recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994111006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 5908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5906, 'last_played': 1622767961}
review:
Dungeons 2 is a clear change over the dungeons 1. But it’s really just replaced a few things and extended things to the “over world”. 
You still have to create dungeons underground and defend it an against onslaught of heroes. But the exploratory basis is dumbed down a bit. The world seems less mysterious and quite rudimentary.  
They’ve replaced the odd creature spawning sites and you now have to train creatures and keep them happy similar to dungeon keeper.
And they’ve introduced the over world a world similar to design or Warcraft 3, but with an interesting sector control element so the world changes as you explore it and destroy encampments.
Here are my pros and cons (some my opinion) 
Pros
-	Dungeon exploration and management is quite fun as you try and making a functional dungeon to train creatures to attack the overworld
-	The over world is quite graphical and interesting
-	The variation of evils is quite fun as they have very different strengths
-	The game can get quite addictive. Dungeon management is greatly improved in this game and you can also alter paths and cave in areas which is an amazing feature.
-	The dlcs are fun introducing a new campaign and several skirmish maps which are really just scenario missions where you can alter some settings.
-	The game of winter introduces a whole new playable faction that really improve the game a lot more and the added campaign is a lot better than the main campaign
Cons
-	The dungeon exploration seems a lot more limited and can quickly get quite repetitive. There isn’t much wild change and variation in the underground world. Dungeons 1 had a more developed underworld.
-	Much like dungeons 1, and an element to the game that really annoyed me is, the hero entrances or “entrances to the over world” always seem to be instantly connected to your dungeon from the beginning introducing an odd difficulty. So there was an instant path to heroes which you usually didn’t want. 
And because of this the heroes would just eventually come regardless of how ready you. Not because they noticed you or your expansion alerted them but what always seemed like a random in game timer.
-	The heroes themselves seem slightly simpler and invade your dungeon… for nothing special. They don’t go for gold and they rush straight to your dungeon throne room. They just seem like cannon fodder to test your defences.
-	Loss of the upgradable champion character that was quite fun in Dungeons 1. You do get a champion in the game of winter campaign but that’s it.
-	The main campaign tends to seem like a long tutorial campaign and I wish they extended it. The DLC really made the game a lot more fun.
-	There are no real skirmishes as they are all just missions without any campaign narration and some adjustable settings. 
-	No real dungeon vs dungeon element and when there added to the campaign they play really weird and mysteriously. They tend to just play like another hero group. It’s really quite weird.
-	The over world though graphically interesting is actually quite simple. There isn’t much you can do there and the rts element is extremely simplified. It’s very much move and attack. 
There are no rewards in the over world besides evilness, so besides progressing the storyline and destroying the annoying hero encampments there’s no real reason to be out there. The mini dungeons really add nothing to the game in my opinion and tend to be quite annoying. 
-	The over world can become laggy if you were moving a lot of units. This was a bit frustrating especially seeing that the graphics wasn’t that amazing.

All in all it’s not a bad game and I did enjoy it quite a lot but the game can be too simple at times and as another review says it tries to do everything but not very well and the overworld laggyness can get quite annoying.
I would suggest buying the game only if its discounted

author: {'steamid': '76561198243922492', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1632069911}
review:
Esperaba jugar por todo lo bueno y bonito de este mundo, pero no fue asi. Encarnamos a el "Mal absoluto" que busca vengarse de los que lo confinaron en el inframundo.
Prepararemos nuestra base "mazmorra" bajo tierra, en la cual cada criatura cumple una función (esta caracteristica me gusta mucho) y, cuando reunamos el valor suficiente (o te aburras), podremos subir a la superficie para combatir contra los humanos y todo aquel que intente plantar cara al mal absoluto.
Junto con los comentarios humoristicos del narrador, y todas las referencias que menciona, este juego se hace agradable y llevadero, tiene un nivel de dificultad normal encaminado a lo fácil si jugaste titulos similares. 
Recomiendo el juego si te gustan los juegos de estrategias y quieres distraerte un rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010136397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1538165743}
review:
Dungeons 2
Género: Rol, Acción RPG

Compañía: Realmforge Studios

Idioma : Textos Español & Voces Español

Nota: 8.7/10

Argumento: El jugador deberá defender su mazmorra de todo tipo de héroes molestos e intentar conquistar la superficie de los hombres con un ejército de criaturas temibles en su poder.

Jugabilidad El título mezcla jugabilidad clásica del género, en inframundo, y estrategia en tiempo real en el mundo exterior. Contará con dos nuevas facciones, la opción de tomar el control directo de nuestros esbirros, así como la posibilidad de subir a la superficie para acabar allí con los humanos.

Multijugador: Multijugador competitivo para cuatro jugadores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135063354', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1681204916}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056897995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1627918748}
review:
The narration is my favourite part, 10 out of 10.

In Dungeons II you play as 'The Evil' - usually the Ultimate Evil. Gameplay consists of a kind of base building underground and a simplistic overworld RTS. I've never played Dungeon Keeper, but many compare it to a simple Dungeon Keeper.
To be honest, gameplay can be called lacklustre, but for me it strikes the perfect level of simplicity and doing something, perfect as a 'winding down' game. You can bulldoze with just macro, but some simple micro is still rewarded.
I've never played multiplayer, so I can't really say anything about multiplayer gameplay.

Where the game truly shines, for me, is the narration. I enjoy the self aware humour, the references, the sarcasm and the way things are flipped - the 'bad guys' are seen positively and the 'good guys' are seen negatively. The narrator captures it all perfectly; the tone, style, diction and accent. For me, the humour is perfectly delivered and is my favourite part by far.

My recommendation; The gameplay [i]might[/i] hold something for you - but if you are not fond of the narration and humour, perhaps give this game a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138978610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1617722239}
review: As someone who enjoyed Dungeon Keeper way back in the day, I can say this game is nowhere near it. There's less rooms, less units, less stages and overall is less fun to explore, the spells mostly suck, and I'm not a huge fan of the overworld, that being said... the dungeon parts are quite fun, I like upgrading stuff and finding hidden stuff while digging.. some of the dialogues are fun too, I've had a few chuckles here and there, but yep, it's an overall decent little game, give it a try if you're missing Dungeon Keeper, but do keep your expectations low.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128149785', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1617636343}
review: Приветствую всех, только что закончил основную кампанию игры dungeons 2. Хочу сказать такое, мне было приятно вернуться в дни когда играл в dungeon keeper 2, геймплей остался неизменным и интересным. В остальном же в игре сюжет для детей, атмосфера того страшного подземелья напрочь отсутствует, ни тебе стонущих врагов, ни жуткого леденящего старого злобного подземелья, где блуждают суккубы, демоны, и тд, дизайн мультяшный, а отсылки и шутки в таком ключе кажутся просто смехотворными. Для тех кому хотелось бы просто строить и развивать подземелье игра топ, для тех кто ждет каких-то улучшений в других вышеперечисленных аспектах игры боюсь вас ждет разочарование. Не смотря на все минусы советую игру, геймплей старой игры(dk2) все таки затягивает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097487686', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1617628192}

review: 第一次玩了1小时闪退，第二次半小时不到开始闪退，到了第三次就给我看个进入的加载页面直接退。你们也差不多点吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198097610240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3372, 'last_played': 1617516156}
review: Прикольная игра. Старый добрый ДК под соусом вар крафт. Но специфика выхода к технологиям второго и третьего уровня сделана плохо. Затянуто. В итоге в кампанию играть интересно, а дополнения нет, потому что 1-2 часа тратишь на то, что бы по крупицам копить апгрейд технологий, без которых на поверхность никак. Короче кампанию прошел с удовольствием. Дополнительные карты не берите. Там усложнение ради усложнения.

author: {'steamid': '76561199153568363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1616602175}
review:
Alright. I've completed the campaign and plan to play the 'A Game Of Winter' expansion after this, since it appears to be the only DLC with content, outside of skirmish maps, worth purchasing. I won't buy the others as I feel it's a waste of money, honestly, unless you love this game so much you want to play dozens of multiplayer maps with friends that also adore the game. To be honest, I chose to play this game as a build up to Dungeons 3, since I had played a small bit of this game a long time ago and, now, since it's finished, I can give my review on it. 

The game reminds me of Dungeon Keeper, which is what I love about this kind of genre, combining underground base building with slaughtering the good guys while also making a few silly jokes along the way. I will try not to prattle on for too long and sum up some of the things I enjoyed about the game and things I felt lacking or disappointing. Please note that I understand some of these issues I'm about to mention may have been fixed in Dungeons 3 but I'm going to point them out all the same and see how Dungeons 3 compares later. I'll also leave a review on the A Game Of Winter DLC for this game. 

Pros:
- The design of the characters, dungeon rooms and, overall, environment are well done for a game of its year. 
- The story is intriguing but not enough to fully immerse yourself in. 
- I encountered little to no bugs while playing through the game.
- The way to play the game is rather simplistic and it's easy for most people to follow along by paying a small amount of attention to what's being explained through each level. 
- Almost every creature has two different things they may be evolved into. 
- There are different types of races to play as such as 'The Horde' and 'The Demons' and 'The Unde-Unlock this in the DLC'. 
- The ragdoll physics of some of the creatures, when dropped, is, occasionally, funny. 

Cons:
- The narrator is often times amusing to have around and he does add 'personality' to what's happening, however, a lot of the jokes he makes feel dry and tasteless as if he's trying to make jokes about pretty much anything, on the spot. 
- The campaign is very small. When I previously had a taste of this game, I thought I had a lot of cool levels to explore but surprisingly the 'adventure' came to an end rather quickly. 
- Some levels drag on longer than they need to as if the developers were simply trying to stretch out the time as much as they could.
- The 'Demon' faction has a serious issue with motivation. When you 'motivate' a creature in your dungeon, you do some minor damage to them, regardless of the two factions. In the Horde, the creature will typically begin to work faster but, a lot of the time, demons will stop doing their work entirely and leave to go get healing, effectively rendering your 'motivation' useless. 
- The progression of the short campaign is awkward, with switching between the Demon and Horde races not being done very smoothly. You're more so thrown straight into the driver's seat with the Demons, although, you may have had no experience with them until then. 
- The game feels too leaning towards a multiplayer experience rather than a singleplayer experience, which explains the short campaign and DLCs mostly focused around skirmish elements. 

Overall, i would recommend the game but you must keep in mind that there isn't much if you're looking for a single-player experience. The entire game could easily be completed within a day. I racked up under 20 hours of game-play and that was solely because I was trying to get some of the achievements, otherwise, there is fun to be had here, you simply need to make sure you understand what you're paying for, when you decide to 'embrace' that fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052214710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1617238221}
review:
The first few maps are nice, but then the horror sets in.

- You'll quickly get sick and tired of the narrator's "funny" comments, unless you're 12 years old or younger. Thank god, there's an option to shut him up.

- You do the exact thing on every map - dig, build base, expand, ugrade, recruit, etc.

- The overworld quickly gets annoying as hell. For those who don't know, you build an army (or rather, team/squadron) underground, and take it to the overworld to complete objectives. At map #6 the annoyances starts for real. You will have to bring the correct units, or you're screwed, so if you don't check a walkthrough beforehand, don't be surprised if you're wasting you whole army because you ran through a whole maze and didn't bring the right unit(s).

- Upgrades are annoying as hell. Some takes an eternity, and they don't disappear or changes in the meny - you'll have to mouse-over the icons to see if you have done it or not.

- Also on map #6: I dug into an area and was told to come back when told, not before. it has enemies that are invincible unless you're on the correct quest, which is EXTREMELY annoying considering your military units will enter that room to strengthen non-dig'able walls.

TL;DR:
Starts out ok, and looks a lot like Dungeon Keeper, but gets annoying and boring quickly. Can't recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999546614', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1616691391}
review:
It's just kind of ok. The narrator is sort of funny, but gets stale with their jokes before the tutorial is even over (there is a setting to shut them up, that helped a lot). His entire brand of humor is "lol, this is a game" and "pop culture, Sam, Frodo, Warcraft, lol." It's rather tiring and poorly done (not to mention excessive).

The RTS fighting is very rudimentary and sloppy, despite being half of the gameplay. The base building is slow, and feels unrewarding since you have to setup a whole new base every single level.

The game is just kinda playable, but not worth much time or money in my opinion. If you are missing Dungeon Keeper, play Dungeon Keeper. This isn't really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120297650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1615931883}
review:
Dungeons 2 ist ein gutes, aber nicht perfektes Spiel, was sehr an das legendäre Dungeon Keepers erinnert.

Es hat sowohl viele gute Ansätze und eine Menge schöne Details, jedoch noch auch einige klassische Fehler, die das Gesamt-Ergebnis etwas runterziehen. 

Positives: 
-Sehr gute Performance und kaum vorhandene Bugs
-Witziger und sehr angenehmer Kommentator mit einigen geilen Easter Eggs
-Generell gutes Management über seinen eigenen Dungeon & die eigenen Truppen
-Viele gute Elemente für den Kampf, die für reichlich Abwechslung sorgen
-Entspanntes Spielen perfekt, gut geeignet für Zwischendurch
-Einfache Verständlichkeit des Spiels
-Grafisch sehr schön und mit viel Liebe zum Detail gestaltet

Negatives:
-Solide Story, jedoch sehr kurze, größtenteils (zu) einfache und auch abwechslungsschwache Kampange. Es geht meistens nur darum, die gegnerische Basis zu besetzen und bis dahin sämtliche Helden des Guten zu besiegen.
-Erfahrene Spieler haben es generell sehr leicht und vermissen etwas die Herausforderung
-Großes Balancing-Problem bei den Dämonen(Schwächere Fallen, stark unterschiedlich vom Nutzfaktor)
-Viel Grind für spätere Erforschungen und generelles Vorankommen bzw. "Stärkung der eignen Armee" im Spiel.
-Für Ungeduldige eher ungeeignet, da der Dungeon-Bau meist etwas mehr Zeit braucht :P

Generell ist Dungeons 2 ein sehr spaßiges und unterhaltsames Spiel, was Dungeon Keeper in fast nichts nachsteht. Die Kampagne ist wie schon geschrieben etwas zu einfach gehalten, doch dafür überzeugt der Rest fast komplett. 
Es hat mir unglaublich viel Spaß gemacht, die Fallen und Gänge der Dungeons zu designen und die Monster durch den Dreck zu jagen :D

Für zwischendurch ist dieses Game ein auf jeden Fall empfehlenswertes Strategie-Spiel!^^
Die 45€ sind es auf jeden Fall wert finde ich. 
Wenn man also mal zwischendurch aus ist, als das Ultimative Böse die Welt zu unterjochen und seine Monster herumzukommandieren, ist hier genau richtig!

Klare Empfehlung trotz einiger kleiner Schwächen also ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198437306388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1615197903}
review:
Largo, diferente, y divertido. Tres características que resume perfectamente.
Dungeons 2 es un juego donde tú serás el villano encargado de combatir contra los héroes de la Alianza, pero está adaptado de forma que se vea todo bastante simpático sin perder la compostura de la destrucción total. De hecho, tenemos a nuestro propio narrador que va contando la historia a la vez que se dedicará a soltar sarcasmos, burlas hacia ti y hasta parodiar otros géneros de temática similar (por ejemplo: El Señor de los Anillos).
Combina un sistema de gestión de mazmorra con ligeros toques de rol para mover a nuestros esbirros a la batalla. La gestión permite construir determinadas salas para investigar nuevas habilidades, entrenar o evolucionar a esos esbirros, trampas para evitar que los enemigos nos ataquen, o incluso agilizar las propias salas. Y con todo ello, requiere del oro que lo podemos encontrar en las propias paredes o en vetas que tienen una duración bastante larga (aunque limitada en cierta medida). 
En cuanto al sistema de rol, pues es básicamente mover a nuestras tropas a un sitio poco a poco para así avanzar la fase. La pega que yo le pondría en ésta parte es que casi todo consiste en ir a un objetivo y destruirlo, ya que carece de zonas secretas que valgan la pena investigar por ser simplemente pociones, o escondites de los héroes que deben ser destruidos para evitar la invasión de la mazmorra.
Quitando eso, y siendo casi uno de los primeros juegos de gestión que he jugado, los tutoriales están muy bien explicados, y con el paso de la historia te irá dando nuevos detalles poco a poco en vez de darte todo lo que tiene de golpe.
Y hablando de la historia, el juego contiene 11 fases de la historia principal, y 8 en la expansión A Game of Winter. Pero la mayoría de éstas fases están adaptados para tener una duración de más de 1 hora y media, ya que con cada fase tienes que ir gestionando a las tropas y las defensas poco a poco, y no ir siempre a lo bruto.
Para terminar, aclarar que en el juego principal manejamos a las tropas de los Orcos. Pero también tenemos la ocasión de manejar a las tropas de los Diablos, o en la propia expansión tenemos a los Muertos Vivientes con un ``Titán´´ a nuestro lado. Todas éstos grupos están muy bien distribuidos con sus ventajas e inconvenientes, y ésto hace que sus formas de jugar sea bastante diferente.

En conclusión: Dungeons 2 es un juegazo con una cantidad de horas muy buenas para echarte unas risas, y bien adaptado para los principiantes de esa clase de géneros de construcción. Yo lo recomiendo encarecidamente, sin importar que hayas jugado al primero. Y si te ha gustado mucho la historia, te animo a probar también A Game of Winter que es más desafiante e igual de largo en cuanto a la duración del mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094235398', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1636, 'last_played': 1672362271}

review: 作为一个先玩了3再来玩2的人来说，地下城2相对于地下城3来说，不论是画面还是操作都差很多，最主要的是这游戏有时候会闪退。

author: {'steamid': '76561198275922575', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 7550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1701201774}
review:
This is a fun, but profoundly dumb game.
The creators chose to make it extremely silly and a parody of various fantasy pop culture. I can't help but think that it would have been a better game if they had taken it even a little bit more serious.
But one of the worst parts is how short the campaign is, and how much it simply feels like a tutorial.
I think most will likely want to get the DLC to make it feel more like a complete game, as far as the single player campaign anyway.
A bit of a time suck as well, as you spend the majority of the game simply directing you minions to mine gold, which runs out on pretty much every map if you don't hurry.with the mission, while the narrator keeps nagging you.
While I like the premise, I would have much preferred a more serious game, with better level design.
There's also quite a few bugs. It crashes for me multiple times per day, and there's some weird bug where the units just walk in place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068317257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1615140866}
review: Fun game, especially the sarcastic narrator

author: {'steamid': '76561198092299848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2912, 'last_played': 1614033620}
review:
Ich finde das Spiel ist perfekt um es zwischendurch mal zu spielen. Es ist allerdings auch gut geeignet um viele Stunden am Stück zu investieren. 
Das Spiel nimmt sich selbst nicht zu ernst und gerade durch den Sprecher werden allerlei flache Witze erzählt die durchaus amüsant sind. Wer hier ein ernstes Spiel erwartet ist definitiv falsch. Wer jedoch kein Problem oder sogar Bock auf den Humor hat, dem empfehle ich es definitiv weiter. 
Die Story ist nicht gerade super spannend, aber eben witzig erzählt. Das ist aber auch kein großer Kritikpunkt, da das Game keine extrem interessante Story benötigt, der Witz und das Gameplay reichen da schon aus und somit wäre eine tolle Story in meinen Augen ein netter Zusatz.
Gameplay ist einfach zu verstehen und in meinen Augen gut designed. Man baut sich seinen eigenen Dungeon mit Fallen und verschiedensten Räumen zum forschen, heilen, betrinken (Bier ist echt wichtig xD) usw. Die Kampagne ist recht einfach und fordert einen nur wenig, was etwas schade ist. Dennoch macht sie viel Spaß und man schaltet mit der Zeit immer mehr Räume und Entwicklungen frei.
An der Stelle kann ich nur das DLC Game of winter weiterempfehlen. Hier kann man eine neue Fraktion spielen, die Untoten, mit haufenweise Anspielungen auf Game of Thrones. Das DLC hat eine eigene Kampagne die nochmal genauso lang ist wie die des Spiels selbst. Diese Kampagne ist diesmal jedoch durchaus an der ein oder anderen Stelle echt fordernd und damit sogar noch besser als die des Hauptspiels. Die neue Fraktion macht auch super viel Spaß und erzählt die Hauptstory etwas weiter (möchte jetzt mal nicht spoilern).
Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung für Dungeons 2 und besonders das DLC Game of winter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048347273', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 390, 'playtime_forever': 2264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2264, 'last_played': 1614036319}
review:
[quote] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/]Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimin olduğu küratör sayfamı takip edin.[/url] [/quote]

Dungeons 2 ile ilk oyun arasında çok radikal değişimler var. İyi yönde tabii ki.

[h1] Artık zindanın dışına çıkabiliyoruz [/h1]

Hikayeye göre Üstün Kötülük (bir birey bu) zindanına girilip onun hazinesinden bir şeyler çalmaya çalışan yeryüzüne ait canlılardan artık sıkılıyor. İşleri kendi eline alıp ordusuyla beraber yüzeye çıkıyor ve yüzeydekilere karşı destansı bir savaş veriyor. Tam savaşı kazanacakken son savunma olan kahramanlar toplanarak özel bir büyüyle Üstün Kötülük'ü zindanına geri yolluyor ve onu uykuya sokuyorlar. Uzun zaman sonra tekrar uyanıyor fakat gücünü toplaması için ve dağılan birliklerini birleştirmesi için yapması gerekenler var.

Hikaye boyunca Kevan Brighting'in seslendirdiği anlatıcı bize eşlik ediyor. Aslında o ne yapacağımızı ve sonucunu anlatıyor biz de "hee böyle yapacağım yani" diyerek oynuyoruz. Kendisi gerçekten çok güzel iş çıkarmış. Gerek diğer oyunlara veya gerçek hayata yaptığı göndermeler olsun gerek yaptığı espriler olsun oyunu daha eğlenceli kılıyor. İngilizce biliyorsanız anlatımından gerçekten zevk alırsınız.

[h1] Grafikler göze hoş geliyor [/h1]

Grafikler aslına bakarsanız World of Warcraft havası veriyor. Strateji oyunlarını oynayanlar varsa eminim onlar da benzetirler. Üst düzey grafik kalitesine sahip olmak yerine oynanış ve hikayeye uygun olacak şekilde daha ilgi çekici bir grafik tasarımı yapılmış. Mağaza ekranında gördüklerinizle birebir aynı, fakat uzaktan baktığınız için ufak kusurları görmeniz daha zor.

[h1] Oynanış geniş bir alana yayılmış [/h1]

Oynanış artık ilk oyundakinden çok daha farklı. İlk oyunda bir zindanın içerisinde farklı zindan lordlarıyla çarpışıyordunuz, bu sırada ise yüzeyden gelen maceracılar zindanınıza giriyorlardı ve siz de onların ruh enerjilerini çalıyordunuz. Burada ise çok daha farklı. Kahramanlar yüzeyden gelirken macera aramak için gelmiyorlar, sizi yok etmek için geliyorlar. Gelen kahramanları askerlerinize öldürterek onların tecrübe kazanmasını sağlayabiliyorsunuz. Yeterli güce ulaşınca da yüzeye çıkış kahramanların üssüne saldırıyorsunuz. Kendi zindanınızda en üstün varlık sizsiniz, kaosun elini kullanarak askerlerinizin kolundan tutup düşmanların üzerine atabiliyorsunuz, fakat kaosun eli sadece sizin zindanınızda kullanılabiliyor. Her birimin ise savaş haricinde iş yapabilme yeteneği var. Bazı askerler çeşitli laboratuvarlarda çalışırken bazıları ortada gezip diğerlerinin daha sıkı çalışmasını sağlıyorlar. İşin en güzel yanı ise işi biten birimler boş boş gezmiyorlar. Zindanı düzenleyip güzelleştiriyorlar. Etrafı yıka yıka kazdığınız duvarlara güzelce tuğlalar diziyorlar ve bu sayede o odanın verimliliğini artırıyorlar. 

Dungeons 2 ilk oyuna göre radikal fakat güzel bir değişime uğramış. Zindan yönetimi ve strateji oyunu severlere öneririm. İlginç bir tecrübe gerçekten. 78SP

author: {'steamid': '76561198079872854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1633048876}
review:
It's been fun enough so far, it's not Dungeon Keeper but it's ok. I find the interface clunky. The tutorial sometimes forgets things, so it'll be micromanaging but then forget to tell you where a button actually is. The David Attenborrough style narrator is hilarious, no complaints there. I would like a slow-mo mode for when combat occurs.
Part of the difficulty of gameplay might just be an older computer. But I switched between using a mouse and a tablet, and found that this really made no difference in ease of play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182684947', 'num_games_owned': 3774, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1569607078}
review: I didn't play the first part, but I liked the game for its humor, even though the graphics are at the level of Warcraft 3. The narrator, aka the questgiver, will not let you go astray. If you are stupid , he will call you stupid, if you do something earlier than he orders , he will pozhurit) It is annoying that each unit must be pulled out separately, you can not create some static group and bring it to the surface with one click, as is the case in classic RTS. In general, the game is fun and does not require any mental effort to play it, the most suitable for free evenings, if any. 9 brats out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133310012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1639832719}
review:
WOW... EXCELENTE.
História simples e intuitiva, ambiente de jogo muito melhorado e mais atrativo, em comparação ao anterior que tem cores mais escuras e 'mortas'. O narrador foi o melhor investimento que alguma vez fizeram a este jogo, engraçado... sempre, sarcástico e objetivo (quando tem de ser). A jogabilidade simples, diversidade em 'minions', inimigos, missões e construções.
Bom para jogadores iniciantes e desafiadores.

review: muito massa esse game! eu recomendo somente para quem curte esse estilo de game, pois me lembrou muito um que tinha para PSP acredito que o nome e ...... lembrei! no hero allowed, muito bom e ainda tem a mesma pegada do Dangeons 2 :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198098325894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1612667473}
review:
Your minions are so adamant about not having any beer that they would rather stand there and die than defend themselves. Trouble is, my little snots want to do anything else but make beer...

There are only a handful of levels, but because of the ridiculously slow-moving pace of the game, and the 13 objectives in each one, most levels take well over an hour. I especially love the one that has you wait 5 minutes for a group to show up so you can quickly kill them, then repeat this process about 10 more times.

But at least every level they start you out with some semblance of a dungeon and with some units or whatever. But the last 2 levels are unplayable. You start with nothing, and all you do is sit there for hours waiting for gold and beer, until you just can't stand it anymore. 

But wait! When you finally get enough gold to do anything with, payday hits! This means all your minions gather up all your hard-earned gold and keep it for themselves. Yep, you birth them, you beer them, you provide literally everything for them, and they still take all your money. What a dumb idea. It's just one more way to make you wait more and clearly the developers are trying to trick you into a playing a game far, far longer than necessary.

Yawn. Very boring, but the narrator is always entertaining enough. The overworld fights are fun(ish), These are like a classic RTS fighting system, but that is the very minimum of what you are doing. You'll be in the underworld, waiting around most of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094556751', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1611952859}
review:
Après avoir essoré le CD-rom de Dungeon Keeper (il y a 20 ans, bon sang que je suis vieux), j'attendais tellement de ce Dungeons 2 pour retrouver autant de plaisir que dans ma jeunesse. J'ai abandonné au bout d'une heure trente : le narrateur est assez pénible, le gameplay est d'une lenteur, c'est mal foutu avec cette main énorme, et compliqué à prendre en main.
J'ai souvenir de qqch de plus nerveux et plus fun sur Dungeon Keeper.
Mais si vous n'avez jamais joué à Dungeon Keeper, ce jeu aura le mérite de vous faire découvrir un genre de jeu culte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077823980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1627243980}
review: This game is similar to Dungeon Keeper 2 and Stanley Parable. It feels like good old Dungeon Keeper, but it is quite different in many aspects. I would say this game is inspired by Dungeon Keeper and something like warcraft. I appreciate how user friendly this game is. Complicated hidden mechanics seems not present here, everything is pretty obvious and straightforward. Visuals are really eye pleasing and made with lots of tiny details. The game is not punishing, but encourages you to make rather stupid decisions to hear the commentary and potentially increase the difficulty. That's actually a lot of fun. One of those games where you get emotionally rewarded for loosing the tutorial level. They did a really good work thinking this game through and filling with dialogues. There are lots of corner cases in this game, which are appropriately filled with content. Being the absolute evil and one-hitting everything with 666 AoE DMG makes perfect sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040982954', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1610891183}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel gerne gespielt als Nostalgie für Dungeon Keeper und es ist wirklich sehr gut gemacht.
Es gibt 4 Grund-Monsterarten, die man dann upgraden kann zu 2 verschiedenen Spezifikationen.
Die Missionen sind leider wirklich sehr einfach und ist für Strategie Spieler nix besonderes. Es gibt im Gegensatz zu Dungeons 3 auch keine "heroische" Variante, die das Spiel schwerer macht.

Ich würde 4 von 5 Sternen geben.

Pro: 
Einfache Verständlichkeit des Spiels
Nicht überladen mit Grafikanimationen
Man kommt leicht ins Spiel rein
Jedes Monster hat seine Vor- und Nachteile
Lustige Witze vom Erzähler, meistens eine Anspielung auf World of Warcraft, Warcraft 3, Herr der Ringe oder Game of Thrones

Contra:
Sehr einfach für erfahrene Spieler
Erfolgsspieler müssen Grinden - sehr nervig (alleine der Erfolg: Die Macht ist mit dir - bedeutet, ca. 4-6 Std. je nach Schnelligkeit nur Mana grinden - unnötig...)
Grafik nicht mehr das neuste (verständlich, ist ja auch kein neues Game)

Fazit:
Für 5-10 Euro würde ich es empfehlen - weiter drüber ist es leider nicht wert meiner Meinung nach.

review:
Polecam z czystym sumieniem. 
Grę przeszdłem dwa razy i teraz zakupiłem, ponieważ warto wesprzeć takich twórców. Na rozluźnienie można sobie zagrać, motyw budowania pod ziemią i podboje armią, są ciekawie przedstawione i godne uwagi.
Jeśli ktoś lubi gry pokroju DOW, twierdza, czy supreme commander, to powinien dodać do kolekcji i tą grę. 

Polecam serdecznie!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041495121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3398, 'last_played': 1612221348}
review: Ваще агонь игра! Сидишь размеренно изучаешь кнопочки, побеждаешь понемногу. Нет этой гонки на время, когда надо быстрее прожимать миссию за миссией, и половину технологий даже не успеваешь увидеть, не то что прочитать для чего оно или попробовать в действии. Нет тут именно есть время посидеть, расковырять всё свое подземелье, установить комнаты как нравится, оптимизировать экономику и монстров. Вообщем, всё как я люблю!

author: {'steamid': '76561199112071956', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1609189925}
review:
Most people coming here were fans of Dungeon Keeper (1997) and Dungeon Keeper 2 (1999). 

The clone did not hit the mark in several areas, even if reviewed with the DK Universe completely out of mind.

The "Narrator" who tells you exactly what to do is too bossy at times, making it extremely obvious and sort of taking away your independence. After playing 6 missions, it's obvious you are following precise pre-scripted dialogue, where you win not through strategy but following instructions precisely. 

Underground, you are an Overlord using "Snouts" to dig passages, explore, and collect gold. Once areas have been dug out, you may build rooms. Rooms have different purposes but many do not operate properly until you have built "Equipment" in the room. You receive creatures by "buying" them in your main room. You can train, research spells, build traps and doors with specific creatures but it costs a large degree of micro-management for something that is simply automated in DK Universe. 

Once your army is large enough, you can lead them to the Upper World with the goal of killing all "happy, living beings". Here you can control your creatures as in typical RTS games (select, command attack, command move, etc.). 

This all becomes very stale and old. Graphics are too cartoony, Narrator is sometimes funny, sometimes annoying. Missions too straight-forward. Unit control is strange and non-optimal. Rooms are a bit too complicated. Cap on creature number is too low. 

This could be a good game for pre-teen boys, with the cartoony graphics and constant hand-holding.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983332794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2266, 'last_played': 1697353515}
review:
Dungeons II: Where Evil Gets a Facelift!

If you've ever dreamed of being the ultimate evil overlord, but you also appreciate a good makeover, then Dungeons II is the game for you! This game takes the concept of being a dark and sinister mastermind and adds a touch of glamour and humor that even Dracula would approve of.

First of all, forget about those dreary dungeons filled with cobwebs and outdated traps. In Dungeons II, your underground lair is more luxurious than a five-star hotel in Hell! You can decorate your dungeon with the finest demonic furniture, and there's even a decorator demon on hand to offer design tips. Who knew that evil could be so chic?

But it's not just about redecorating – it's about unleashing your inner evil genius. You'll lead your horde of minions, and trust me, these guys are the most incompetent bunch of evil lackeys you'll ever meet. It's like they went to the "Villain School for the Clueless" and got straight A's. Watching them bumble around and fail spectacularly is worth the price of admission alone.

Now, let's talk about the narrator. He's like the voice inside your head, if that voice were sarcastic and had a PhD in snark. He'll guide you through the game with the driest wit you've ever encountered. I swear, his one-liners are so sharp they could cut through adamantium. Just be prepared to laugh so hard that your evil cackle will echo through the caverns.

And speaking of evil cackles, you'll have plenty of opportunities to practice yours. The game lets you unleash all kinds of diabolical spells and creatures upon unsuspecting heroes. It's like a twisted game of "Whack-a-Hero," and it's ridiculously satisfying.

In Dungeons II, the goal is simple: conquer the world and spread your evil influence. But be warned, you might find yourself too busy redecorating and laughing maniacally to actually get around to world domination.

In conclusion, Dungeons II is the perfect game for anyone who wants to be evil but also appreciates a good laugh and some interior decorating tips from the depths of darkness. It's like playing evil while sipping tea with your pinky up. So, put on your best sinister grin and dive into the wickedly hilarious world of Dungeons II!

review:
Take the story aspects of Overlord, mashed up with the humor and soundtrack of Fable, add in Plants vs Zombies and youve got yourself the Dungeons series. 
You'll be completely done with the game within 30 hours, but those first 20 will feel great, especially if this is your first introduction to the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026361937', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1609172596}
review:
Played on Linux native version.

A fun combination of strategy and dungeon management with a wonderful and hilarious story-telling.

Not too hard, not too easy, perfectly balanced.

For achievements hunters, you can complete the game in 25 hours minimum, DLCs are not required (though they seem really nice and fun).

author: {'steamid': '76561197979860863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1640138964}
review: For my time playing video games, I've been searching for a game that I can truly consider to be my favorite game. After playing Dungeons 2 I have satisfied this longtime empty void, Dungeons 2 is my favorite game and series. Dungeons 2 offers an enjoyable, witty, and fun rts/rpg/tower defense/tycoon game. While playing Dungeons 2, I never wanted to leave it. I once played this game almost 4 hours straight, and that has never happened before, I have been looking for a game that can really compel me to play it for so long this was the game that satisfied that need. The narrator makes sure that the player never gets bored and keeps mood light while we play as the villain, the game is separated into dungeon manager and rts, this is where the game differentiate itself from other rts games. The dungeon acts as your "base" and the rts is where you can accomplish quest while controlling your minions. The writing of this game is one that I can only describe in one word, genius, to fully encapsulate my experience with the story of this game I can find nothing better than to describe it like a Monty Python sketch, it doesn't take itself too seriously while providing the player with a great story to look forward to. Because of this Dungeons 2 conveys itself as a parody of the rts and rpg genre while also outclassing them. Dungeons 2 is my favorite game; with it's fun story, well written characters, amazing and refreshing gameplay, this is a game that all rts fans need to experience!

review:
Fun enough clone of DK. Worth the time to check it out. However, the campaign is not very well designed. Besides the objectives being somewhat different level to level, the actual gameplay is identical every time - build your base, build your army, then send em topside to clear it out. Rinse. Repeat. 

Hopefully the third chapter addresses this. Needs some constraints on each level to force the player to adapt and do something different. Otherwise you basically have seen everything there is to see after a single skirmish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075616912', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1608910581}
review:
Wer Dungeon Keeper mochte, wird dieses Spiel lieben. 
Für alle die Dungeon Keeper nicht kennen (Schande über Euch), aber auf Strategie, Humor, Basebuilding und leichte Tower Defense Anleihe stehen, ist dieses Spiel genau richtig. 

Ich gehe gar nicht so sehr auf inhaltliche Details ein, aber nur so viel, das Spiel macht eigentlich alles richtig. Gute Grafik, sehr gute Synchro, tolles Gameplay, nicht zuuuu stressig und der Mulitplayer ist auch spaßig, wenn auch nur mit Freunden (Randoms praktisch keine mehr vorhanden). 
Der Umfang ist überschaubar, aber ich empfinde das eher als Pluspunkt, da ich nach 25 Stunden das Spiel auf 100% gespielt habe und in der Zeit gut durch die Kampagne gekommen bin + 1-2 Runden online gezockt hatte. 
Klar, für manche ist das zu wenig und ja, gegen etwas mehr Content, grade im Solobereich hätte ich jetzt auch nicht unbedingt was gehabt, aber da der Preis des Spiels mittlerweile sehr niedrig (vor allem im Sale) ist und es ja auch noch einen 1. und 3. Teil gibt, sehe ich hier keinen großen Nachteil. Und man kann ja auch noch Skirmish spielen und sich da etwas austoben. 

Das Spiel ist inhaltlich eher klassisch aufgebaut. Also, Kampagne, Skirmish-Modus und Multiplayer ohne Schnickschnack. Keine Seasionpässe, keine Skins, keine Ingameshops, kein Levelsystem, keine Freundeslisten, kein fancy Schnickschnack, der sich aufgesetzt und unnötig anfühlt, keine Lootboxen, nichts, einfach nur das Spiel, vollumfänglich und statisch. Und das ist gut so. 

Vom Gameplay hat mir das Spiel wirklich so gut gefallen, dass ich sogar 2x die 100% geholt hatte, einmal auf GOG und einmal auf Steam. 
Es gibt hier und da kleinere Bugs, die aber nicht weiter stören, z.B. wenn man ein Gebäude des Feindes zerstört hatte, kann es passieren, dass ein eigenes Monster zwischen den Trümmern und ner Wand "eingeklemmt" wird, aber das portet man dann einfach da weg und fertig. Also wirklich nichts Schlimmes. Abstürze hatte ich auch keine. 

Das Spiel selbst ist innovativ, auch wenn es natürlich von Dungeon Keeper "inspiriert" wurde, aber Spiele dieser Art gibt es leider wirklich nicht viele. 

Spiel läuft auf kleinen Rechnern sehr gut. Ich hab nur ne GTX 750 TI und hab im Dungeon durchgehend meine 60 fps gehabt und in der Außenwelt 45-60, auf höchsten Einstellungen. 

Das Game unterhält sehr gut. Die Kampagne baut gut auf und führt mit jedem Level neue Möglichkeiten ein, so dass die bis zum Schluss nicht langweilig wird. Auch finde ich es gut, dass die Achievements gut schaffbar sind. Nicht zu krass, so dass man hunderte Stunden, teils repetitiven und schier unerreichbaren Mist machen muss, aber auch nicht zu leicht, dass man sie nach einer Stunden geschenkt bekommt. Die Meisten bekommt man eh durch "normales" Spielen. Schwierigkeitsgrad der Kampagne würde ich als leicht einstufen, entspanntes Zocken also möglich. Schwerer kann man es sich im Skirmish-Modus machen, aber alleine wegen des Humors ist die Kampagne n Zock wert. 

Unterm Strich macht man mit dem Spiel wirklich nichts falsch und ich hatte beim Zocken richtig Spass. Also ich meine, echten Spass, nicht dieses Gewohnheitsgefühl beim Zocken, wenn sich ein Spiel zwar OK anfühlt, aber in einem halt nicht unbedingt echte Freude weckt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111178855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1610903263}
review:
Was a fan of Dungeon Keeper & Dungeon Keeper 2 back in the day. Loved War for the Overworld, did not like Dungeons (1), so I never gave this game a shot. Several years later I check out a review of Dungeons 2 on a whim just to see how it improved itself, and was amazed it transformed itself into Dungeon Keeper meets Warcraft 2. 

Love this game to death, can't wait to play 3, and I hope to hear word that 4 is on it's way soon.

Just don't waste your money on the DLC. Auxilary maps are all they are, no campaign, no cohesion, nothing. Too bad, too was looking forward to more Dungeons 2, but this was basically like some fan made some mods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055091370', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1514650039}
review:
Warcraftowa stylistyka, zarządzanie lochami rodem z Dungeon Keepera i operowanie siłami zła, niczym Overlord. Twórcy Dungeons 2 ewidentnie wyznają zasadę, że jeśli ściągać, to od najlepszych. Ale czy uczeń jest w stanie przerosnąć mistrzów?

Historii prosto z Hollywood nie będzie. Nasz mały wychowanek pobierał nauki u każdego z nauczycieli, pracował ciężko oraz uczciwie, ale to po prostu nie wystarczyło. Oprawa wizualna, choć ładna, posiada trochę niedociągnięć i nie jest jakoś szczególnie przekonująca. Zarządzanie lochami szybko staje się schematyczne i powtarzalne, potrafi również być niezwykle żmudne, szczególnie w kontekście przechodzenia gry poziom za poziomem.
Odnośnie bycia czystym złem, narrator robi przecudowną robotę, ale mało tutaj trochę naszego pierwiastka - przydałoby się więcej wyżywania na poddanych poza wymierzaniem poszczególnych "motywujących" ciosów, może jakiegoś systemu decyzyjnego...

Wszystkie powyższe zarzuty nie zmieniają jednak faktu, że to, czego gra nie robi doskonale, nadal robi naprawdę bardzo dobrze. Strategiczne zarządzanie lochami bawi, otoczka naprawdę buduje specyficzny klimat, a przez kampanię miło się płynie, szczególnie ze wszystkimi elementami humorystycznymi. Miejscami wręcz trudno się nie uśmiechnąć, a patrzenie na naszych małych poddanych zbierających ukryte po podziemiach skarby jest wręcz relaksujące, tak samo jak przyglądanie się pokonywanym rycerzom.

To naprawdę bardzo dobry pomysł na grę strategiczną, nawet jeżeli nie kupi od razu serca, może chociaż skradnie kilka bliższych "przytulasów". Trudno nazwać to pełnym wykorzystaniem potencjału, natomiast naprawdę niewiele składowych frustruje albo jakkolwiek zniechęca do dalszej rozgrywki, dobry umilacz czasu.

Wielbicielom oryginalnych strategii spodoba się na pewno, to samo ze zwolennikami regularnego, czarnego humoru, choć muszą pamiętać, że to nie jest niezobowiązująca przygodówka, a jednak taktyczny RTS. Regularnym graczom polecam raczej jako ciekawostkę, natomiast zażartym fanom klasycznych tytułów wymienionych na początku sugeruję wrócić do korzeni i nie szukać niepotrzebnych wynalazków; najlepiej będziecie się czuli we własnych podziemiach, nie tych tutaj.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018959619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1605745448}
review:
Un gioco che ho trovato molto esilarante, considerando l'ambientazione, i personaggi ed il gameplay del gioco (stordire un moccioloso a suon di ceffoni è un'esperienza gratificante!). Anche i dialoghi sono stati fatti molto bene, e parlo di quelli in italiano, perché non ho per nulla sentito l'esigenza di effettuare un cambio di lingua. Infatti, ci sono riferimenti a giochi, film e serie TV fantasy che fanno che non mi sarei mai aspettato (oltretutto il narratore sfonda la quarta parete in continuazione).
P.S. Faccio i complimenti al doppiatore del narratore nel gioco che, a parer mio, ha saputo dare pathos ed personalità a questa figura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075836498', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1603804865}
review:
Игра косплеит Dungeon Keeper [1, 2], но не выстреливает. Осахаренная графика потеряла ясность, новые фишки не выстреливают, закадровые шуточки уже были раньше, а вот что совсем не хорошо, так это глюки с нахождением путей у юнитов, особенно при переходах подземелье -> земля.

Ну, такое себе.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228190400', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1606078084}
review: It's not a bad game, but in its attempt to do a bit of everything, IMO it fails in doing anything well enough. The Dungeons Keeperlike parts in the dungeon are fairly shallow and limited, while the RTS parts on the surfaces have the same issue and lack depth. Humour is good, visuals are fun, and it has an overall Overlord Vibe, but for me it fails a bit to deliver. Not to mention a weird map design style that had me stuck for nothing quite a few times. Playable, but not at all costs. Gets a 65/100 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367153722', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1606082545}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091149526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3252, 'last_played': 1620556438}
review:
this game was a big disapointement for me, you buy it and expect a dungeon game similar to war for the overworld but this game gives you a boring and difficult experience instead.
to elaborate the boring part: everything seems incredibly slow, workers mining, research ( which i don't like because i prefer the research tree in war for the overworld ), minions are the big problem ( they take forever to do any of their needs and require constant micro if you want to get throught some missions which i hate ), payday slows you down even more because minions just abandon everything they where doing to crawl to a treasury which takes time.
but that was the easy part now the difficulty: do not expext any kind of balance the developers wanted you to play the horde everything else is just garbage: 
-Horde is well balanced with great starting minions and late game minions, great traps, and useful rooms 
-Demons get run over at the start because of their minions who die in 2 hit, if you think "demons have great late game minions so actually they are great" i say no you already hate demons when you finally get to the late game ( which takes a LOT of time ), their traps are average if you get to late game ( starting ones are s.hitty ), your big problems with them is the hospital "replacement" where now you need another minion to heal them ( note that now instead of a bed that takes 1×2 it takes 3×3 )
-Undead is the big no no for me ( do not buy the DLC if you are a run of the mill player ) most of the problem with them comes from the map you play them in... dragons and spiders never underestimate them i don't know how but they took steroid during this DLC, just like Demons undead get r.aped at the start only reedeming factor is Barthas which like the narator will say funny things now and then but still dies in 2 seconds against anything, the second problem is that undead take forever to revive and they die a lot just like Barthas and minions do not prioritize healing, their traps are average, i have another problem with them: immersion ( i know seems stupid ) but the whole game the narrator talks about your minions and how mindless the undead are, so how the f.uck do they need a salary and want to clean themselves ?
and for the last one ( which ruins the game for me ): there is no endless gold just semi endless sources which take a lot of time to mine but eventually run out.

ok now that the worst part is gone i can talk about whats good: the narrator which carries the game alone, the ocasional voice actors are great to, the game is beautiful i like the style, being the vilain, story is alright, the corruption of the overworld is cool, great humour.
hope this helps someone choose if they want to buy it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049972643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1841, 'last_played': 1605858376}
review: Dungeon Keeper'dan bir haber arkadaşlar, "bu nasıl strateji oyunu, çatışma göremiyoruz" demişler. Komik geldi son derece. Dungeon Keeper'da olay tamamen dungeonunuzu büyütmek, geliştirmek ve dungeona gelen düşmanları öldürmekti. Bu oyunda ise dış dünya da sunulmuş, çok da güzel olmuş. Winter DLCsinden uzak durun, oyunu keyifle oynayın. Campaign de zorlamıyor, kafa rahat oynamak için bire bir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007398320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1624134928}
review:
Ever since the first one came out decades ago Iv always been a fan of the game series Dungeon Keeper by Bullfrog. Both it and all its sequels regardless. It was a disappointment for many fans that there wasnt a third one. The game series Dungeons I was expecting to be like it but it wasnt but still I enjoyed it nonetheless. This game I would most recommend for any fans and that is because if there is any game that hits the nogging on what they are looking for in terms of originality to the desire for a really good dungeon ruling game then this title accurately speaking hits the nogging with dead point accuracy and attention to detail. 


When you play this game it feels exactly like you are playing dungeon keeper 2. Its almost like a remake of the same thing literally. Awesome stuff. Totally far out. I have been trying so hard for years to get the dungeon keeper games working on a modern machine but unfortunately did not make it happen but at the same time this at least in some way does the trick so hands down for this title because no other one provides results as expected so far and what makes it even better is that it even works on the vintage apple mac which is a major 1up for me because thats my favourite console to play anything on which is also quite cool when you look at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060624962', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1604875068}
review:
To note, I have 22 hrs in the game, trying to get 100% steam achieves. I would say I only got around 14-16 hrs gameplay, with the rest redoing missions to get stuff I missed or to AFK for one achieve.

Also this review focuses entirely on the story and campaign, multiplayer isn't really the focus of this game.

Would I say this is mechanically a good game? Maybe. It is quite fun, with the premise being rather enjoyable. The art style complements this entirely- the corruption as you move through and clear a map is such a small but great feature. But looking pasts its appearance, the game is bland, repetitive and poorly structured. From missions you complete in 20 minutes, then have to sit for another 20 more waiting for NPC's to turn up, to boring fights that you just cheese, it really isn't great. Past the first 10 minutes, the NPC attacks on your base have no threat, with few enemies and the hospitals ressurecting fallen troops. Objectives are generally "go here, kill camp/npcs" with little varience in why. The story is okay -the voice actor (narrator from the stanley parable) really helps with it and the various evil titles is a nice touch, but sometimes with dated pop culture references or poor jokes it is nothing special, it often feels like the game doesnt know if it wants to be serious or not. The base defence elements are meh, the traps are pretty strong so most of the time its just lighting spam on the bards and then let the traps kill, and attacking outside the base is risky until you have the res mat, when you spend 10 mins afk gold farming to build 12 then win every map. 

Overall, it looks nice and had a nice concept, but with little payoff especially for the price. £5 sale? Get it, especially if you want an easy game to get 100% achieves. Full price? Dont bother

author: {'steamid': '76561198121638387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 11601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11234, 'last_played': 1613945160}
review:
Её раздавали бесплатно. Мне довелось поиграть случайно. 

Кто бы знал что ето будет любовь на долгие годы. Приобщение к сеттингу хранителей подземок, глубокое познание и исследование, куча часов проведённых с удовольствием! Пройденные компании, сценарии и все DLC. Остановится невозможно до сих пор... Ведь есть же ещё первая часть, пусть и совершенно отличающаяся от второй и третьей. Очень прискорбна, что вторую часть больше не развивают и не допиливают мультиплеер, не делают новых режимов и карт с DLC. Есть очень много фишек которые вписались бы  из третьей  части и наоборот из второй в третью. Не хватает совместных режимов и бесконечного развития, нету редактора карт, мультиплеер ели дышит. Впрочем чего ожидать когда трёшка гармонично развилась и вылизана практически до блеска, но всё же и вторая часть заслуживает нового контента. Хоть и нехватает героев, а раса демонов по темпу развития проигрывает орде и нежити, но определённые вещи в двушке сделаны даже лучше чем в трёшке. Например постройка зала без топтания сопляков на клетках, одним взмахом длани ужаса. Ето быстро и динамично. Не по классике данжен кипера, зато по своему уникально.  Отсутствие очков коварства и возможность играть лишь за одну из рас, а не иметь сразу три в своём личном подземелье вполне себе можно спустить на нет, минус в том что развитие происходит чуть дольше по времени. Юмор и диалоги более саркастичны чем в третьей части. Гоблины на мехе ваще имба, как и носферату у нежити с их скилом в виде летучей мыши и заклинанием выбраца на поверхность. Расширение очков населения через зал добычи маны = не самая удачная идея в етой части. 

Не смотря на все высказывания в духе "как бы могло бы быть и чего бы добавить убавить поменять", я принимаю ету игру такой какая она получилась и посылаю ментальный падземный респект создателям.

Dungeons успешный продолжатель сеттинга хранителя подземелий, и пока лучший!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969284508', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1601953268}
review: A game, first and foremost, should have good controls and it should feel easy and intuitive to do what you want to do. This game fails on this: the mouse cursor (literally a giant hand) is so oversized and horrendous, that when you want to pick creatures up (and you must pick each one up manually and individually), you will very often pick up the wrong one from among a bunch of clustered creatures, because the cursor sucks. There was a thread on the forum from 5 years ago where devs said they'd look into adding a menu option to tweak the cursor, but they evidently didn't. I'm passing on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056750672', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 1595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1603583069}
review:
И снова вы в роли хранителя подземелья. Игра уже не имеет практически ничего общего с первой частью, кроме разве что явных отсылок к разным фильмам. Ну обо всем по порядку.
Игра стала куда больше походить на старых добрых Хранителей подземелья (Dungeon keeper), тут уже и строительство комнат и управление миньонами и прокачка юнитов, но добавили и интересное новшество - возможность отправлять своих существ на поверхность и управлять ими уже на прямую, как в стратегии. Получилась этакая помесь хранителей подземелий и варкрафт 3. Звучит хорошо, но и без минусов не обошлось, но это то что не понравилось лично мне:
- Игра слишком "детская" мир очень яркий, никакой жестокости.
- Игра слишком простая, в ней можно конечно прокачать существ до 11 уровня, но в этом нет никакого смысла, поскольку разнашерстный отряд 5-6 уровня может справиться со всем.
- Карты и кампания в целом слишком маленькие. За 20 ч можно пройти игру вдоль и поперек.
И один момент который мне понравился, это возможность поиграть за две рассы, орду и демонов, но тут есть минус, за демонов дают поиграть только на 2 с половиной картах.
И ещё один плюс/минус, это неутомимый комментатор который будет сопровождать вас своим закадровым голосом всю игру причем даже на русском.
В целом игра довольно интересная, так что рекомендую поиграть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115807920', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2652, 'last_played': 1525028917}
review:
I have a bit of a love/ hate relationship with this one. 

On the one hand, the idea of mixing “Warcraft 3” with “Dungeon Keeper” feels like a Chocolate + Peanut butter situation, and when done right (in the sequel) it is. 
The concept is simple. You are an Evil overlord, in charge of Horde, Demon or undead Minions. You recruit new kinds of minions, and then build rooms to attract / upgrade more creatures before sending them to gleefully murder your enemies. Sounds fun, right?

Unfortunately, Dungeons 2 suffers from some major pacing issues. Your minions take forever to spawn and train, and until late in each campaign, they suffer Permadeath. While this could cause tension, it is usually of the “oh lord, it’s going to take forever to get a fighting force back up.” Variety. 
Upgrading rooms to get more units and upgrades is also a tedious Grind. 

The narrator is of course great, and for people like me, so is the humour. I even enjoy the Gremanisms throughout the script, as they add an extra layer of pop culture references only German speakers who grew up in 90’s will get.
All in all, it’s okay to play through once, and the DLC campaign addresses several of the pacing issues. However, if you are looking to get into the “Dungeons” series, you should start with this game’s sequel, “Dungeons 3”.

review:
Ich kenne noch Dungeon Keeper und muss sagen das ich anfangs ein wenig enttäuscht war, das das Spiel nicht die Tiefe von damals hat. Es sind deutlich weniger Räume vorhanden und auch das Kampfsystem ist eher auf Masse statt Klasse ausgelegt. 
Die Oberflächen-Erkundung ist an sich gelungen und abwechslungsreich.

An sich ein gutes Spiel was kurzweilig ist und der Sprecher ist Klasse mit netten Scherzen hier und da. 
Die Kampagne macht Spaß.

review: เกมแนวสร้าง(บริหาร)ดันเจี้ยน ซึ่งในหนึ่งแผนที่จะแบ่งเป็นดันเจี้ยนของเรา และโลกด้านบน ภารกิจหลักๆคือ ปกป้องดันเจี้ยนจากการบุกของมนุษย์ และส่งยูนิตขึ้นไปทำลายเมืองมนุษย์ให้หมด โดยระบบในการควบคุมจะแบ่งเป็น 2 แบบ ในดันเจี้ยนจะใช้การควบคุมลักษณะ point and click ในการสั่งให้ยูนิตทำงาน ส่วนโลกด้านบนใช้การควบคุมแบบ RTS ในด้านของเผ่าพันธ์มีให้เลือก 3 เผ่า คือ 1.Horde หรือ Orc 2.Undead 3.Demons ด้านการออกแบบยูนิตถือว่าดีมาก แต่ละเผ่ามีเอกลักษณ์ของตนเอง ซึ่งถ้ามองรวมๆแล้ว เป็นเกมที่เล่นสนุก เล่นง่าย แต่แอบรำคาญการบุกของมนุษย์ (บุกมาบ่อยมากแทบจะทุกๆ 3 นาที)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980932967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1599436622}
review:
If you loved Dungeon Keeper, this is it's spiritual successor, and it's incredible!... Part Tower Defense, part RTS, part resource management, and freaking hilarious! Even the tool tip text is funny. Such a great game. With Dungeon Keeper being so dated now, this is such a welcome re-imagining of that same concept.

For those who haven't played, the concept is simple.... You are the Ultimate Evil. You start underground with a Throne Room that is essentially your "town center"... There you can spawn new creatures and eventually upgrade your dungeon.

Instead of exploring through the "fog of war" you send little minions to dig out sections of the underground and fill them in with rooms to expand and enhance the capabilities of your dungeon... Different rooms grant new creatures, upgrades, spells, and... traps!

A big part of the game deals with fending off waves of goodie-two-shoes heroes that infiltrate your dungeon. This is where the tower-defense aspect comes into play. You can dig and sculpt the underground however you like, taking heroes through a maze of tar pits, exploding treasure chests, spinning axes, rolling boulders, spike pits... You can place guard rooms where your creatures will patiently wait to smash nearby heroes... 

This is one of the most fun aspects of the game in my opinion. And this is where the orginal Dungeon Keeper series begins and ends... However, in Dungeons 2... You can also take your creatures to the surface! Yes, in addition to defending your dungeon below ground, you can also attack the human kingdoms above ground, and even enter dungeons of other evil keepers as well. And it's all very fluid. You can switch back and forth in a single click with no load screen. It's awesome.

All of this makes for a very unique experience. Combine that with the best voice-over I've ever experienced in any game and this is a pure delight to play. So happy to have found this one. It's a real diamond in the rough, because the developers really did not go out of their way to let anyone know it existed! The Dungeon Keeper series is an all-time favorite of mine and I had no idea this game was ever even in development. In any case, it's well worth a play through, and another, and another, and another...

author: {'steamid': '76561198104347725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1601244350}
review:
Прикольная игруха, где нам дают возможность поиграть за повелителя Зла, по управлять зеленокожими миньёнами. Но в отличии от "Оверлорд" мы не управляем злодейским героем, а даём задания слугам, и они уже сами всё делают: гремлины строят, копают, гоблины создают инструменты, наги собирают ману, орки бездельничают, но когда люди вторгаются во владения - спешат на битву (при наличии гонга), но это всё в подземелье, на поверхности же, войны полностью переходят под наш контроль, можно посылать их уничтожать лагеря людишек и т.п. Так же в подземке мы можем сами назначать народ на задания, путём перетаскивания их к месту задачи. Солдаты наши не безвольные создания, у них есть потребности: в содержании (зарплата*), питье (пиво), в работе (укрепление стен, исследовании и др.), развлечениях (есть показатель скука, гнев, уныние и т.п.). Для лучшей работы своих поданных (все поданные - именные, имеют лэвэл ап, могут носить артефакты) нужно удовлетворять их потребности: на строительство, расширение владений, на защиту владений (ловушки, стража), на это всё будет уходить львиная доля игрового времени. По сути это симулятор градостроительства с элементами войны. 
Очень вытягивает рассказчик с русской локализацией, который прикалывается, повествует, даёт советы (прямо как в "Стенли Парабола").
