author: {'steamid': '76561198862447192', 'num_games_owned': 2493, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 3374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1649529730}
review:
Really preferred the concept of the first 2 dungeons games. Obviously certain things in them had to be improved, but the basic concept of heroes invading your dungeon, levelling up and entertaining them was great. The heroes in this game are just enemies. Overall, it's a great game, as it's own thing. However, if they could find a way to incorporate the new dungeons and old dungeons together for dungeons 4 that would be ideal.

I think Dungeons 2 and 3 are secretly prequels to tthe first two games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086041189', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1563470223}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031835934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 81344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20536, 'last_played': 1666999370}
review:
Before you buy the main game or all these annoying dlc bug you may need to read my post and yes i buy this game on sale but that don`t changes anything.

The game is very nice but all these DLC have a lot of issue. I have never ever play a game where the game crash on every map on every DLC and they don`t do it one time but several time each DLC on each mission on each map and they do it just in the air without any reason and that is very annoying and sometime i just wanna give up and turn in all these DLC and the main game as well because of the DLC Issue.

By the way they all have some bug and the baddest of them is Auto-Save failure ( except game crash and invisible mouse arrow ) and when that happen you can`t make a new save or a quick save and now you need to load back to another save once again.

Game of Winter DLC have some serious bad bug where you get trapped in cave and can`t get out and not only in one cave but several cave and i need to load back again but that don`t help because i got stuck on all these cave every time i try them and now i need to restart the hardest mission on that dlc .
After several restart i manager to beat all enemy and wait for the ending but that ending also got bug because my main character did not transfer to the Evil and yes i load back once again and the same issue pop up and i can`t finish the mission so now i need to restart the game mission once again and again and again and ............. so what is going on and why did not the devs fix all these annoying issue hm probably because they did not know how to do it before they left the game.

-- Combat unit have also some bad bug where 30 % of my army with max population ( 5 out of 15 unit ) don`t wanna attack enemy and the enemy don`t wanna attack them, no wonder why the game was so hard on that mission on A Game Of The Winter.

-- And you need to know your unit gonna get stuck some few places on almost every DLC mission map.

-- Unit who disappear from the map and when you aim at them on your unit menu you got a black screen and now you are one unit minus and need to load back again.

--Your mouse arrow disappear in the air " all the time " and when you are in combat and can`t grab your unit or use some magic power with your mouse arrow then you probably gonna lose the battle.
When you start to play you got a info panel who pop up to help you out all the time  to the end of the game about everything on the map but that don`t help when your mouse arrow is gone and you can`t aim at them.
Well if that happen you need to click on Esc and click on something there and then go back but if you gonna go back to the battle then you have lost a lot of unit and you may load back this time as well.

-- I don`t remember who may time my unit lv down randomly when they hit max lv and that is very annoying.
Just think about it you got the best unit at max population and they all are at lv 10 and when they hit level 11 who is max then some of your unit gonna level down automatic to a poorer unit and then they suddenly are at level 9 and now you still got max population and cant level them up and the game say you need population space. This issue happens very often if you use training apparatus from level 10 to lv 11.
Last time i got 4 flame robot at lv 11 and suddenly i notice i only got 2 flame robot and two other poorer unit at lv 10.So i load back and monitor my 4 flame unit at max lv and then i notice two of them going to the training apparatus and level them down to a poorer unit by them self.
I try everything to avoid it but it don`t help so i load back and shut down my training quarter.

Just to make it clear my computer is pretty much overpower to any game at this stage and my online speed is very fast and very good no issue there at all and why did i make this post well after a hard combat and not one but several in few minute and what did happen " The dlc game mission " crash again and now  i need load back 30 minute one more time and do everything once again and  yes now you  know it too.

-- Unit get stuck - unit  disappear but the info say they are still in the game - unit who do not wanna fight and the enemy don`t wanna attack them either - your mouse arrow  disappear all the time - the game crash all the time - one of the mission have so much issue and it was almost impossible to continue the Campaign DLC and then we have all these auto save failure so what more can go wrong may i ask after your unit level down randomly when they hit max level.

By the way i managed to beat Isle Of Terror on difficulty is impossible + setting dungeon level 1 + money start on 1.

Yes you can buy the game if you feel for it but at least now you know about all these annoying errors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068468308', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2371, 'last_played': 1678464993}
review:
偶然发现了这么一款游戏，尝试玩了后感到了些许惊艳。所以认真写一篇测评。[spoiler]说在前头，我只玩过这一代，1、3代我都没碰过，所以内容只针对这一部作品。[/spoiler]

首先，这个题材非常少见但也非常不错，建设好你自己的地下城，随时准备着反攻地上，用你的邪恶去撕碎那些虚伪的地表种族！
所以，这个游戏分为两个部分：
一是你躲在地下，安心发展着自己的势力，偶尔用陷阱去玩弄那些敢入侵你地下城的勇者们。
二是地表被那些可恶的种族占领着，你随时可以反攻地表，邪化地面来转化为你的领土，最终杀光那些虚伪的家伙。

这样就好分开部分说了。

地下这一部分：
-资源有两种，一个金钱一个法力，全部都可以在地下弄到。但此外有一个重要的要素，邪恶值。邪恶值只有一种办法弄到，就是反攻地表然后攻下据点。邪恶值关键在于它能升级你的王座，进而升级新的科技。就是说，你想升级科技就必须进攻地表，否则就会被卡人口卡科技。这点无可厚非，它鼓励你积极的去进攻地表，而不是窝在地下一万年然后暴兵一波扫荡。
-哪怕是一个地精都会有它的小脾气（鼻涕虫除外，它们是最好的无怨无悔的勤劳小仆人），所以你得建造酿酒房，让你的手下们时不时喝上几口，甚至还得建造竞技场好让它们发泄自己的脾气，此外它们领钱时是最高兴的但你却是最不高兴的。不得不说这些细节我还是蛮喜欢的，这使得它们更显真实，而非个个都是任劳任怨的机器人。[spoiler]你的邪恶之手放在它们头上它们还会对你敬礼。[/spoiler]
-地上的偶尔还会有大胆的勇者们敢来入侵你的地下城，这时候就需要准备些陷阱给他们玩玩了。但这一部分我相当不满意，简单的来讲，陷阱种类太少了。把升级版也算上也就8个陷阱，这就有些索然无味了。而且，最重要的一点，有一种敌人，吟游诗人。它能完全无视陷阱的伤害，并能暂时废除陷阱和门，只有滚石陷阱能推动一下，但仍然没法造成伤害。这个敌人的设计真的彻底把我恶心到了，你如果暂时无视它那它就会一直一路摸到你的王座去。

地上的这部分：
-如同一只烤全羊，全部都是你可以抢过来吃的东西。
-你在地表的每一步推进都会邪化地面然后转变为你的领土，这有个好处就是使你可以使用那些只能在你领土上使用的魔法。哦，还有邪恶值，这关系到你解锁新的科技。
-操作非常简单，派遣一队手下去一路碾碎他们就行了。虽然人类都很脆弱，但你如果不阻止那他们就是无穷无尽的，正确的做法是把他们的兵营全拆了，这样不管剩下多少敌人都只是瓮中捉鳖了。

最后，旁白我很喜欢，假如你觉得旁白很烦，那就成功了，不烦你还叫旁白吗？
[spoiler]汉化的文本我也非常喜欢，很接地气。[/spoiler]

所以，我个人给出7/10分。题材的潜力很强，但并没有挖掘出足够的游戏内容来，属实可惜。但仍然值得一玩，现有的游戏内容还是足够你爽一爽的。可以体验一把窝在地下城里鞭挞着手下策划着邪恶的计划的邪恶至尊，随时准备着反攻地表来进行血腥的复仇！

author: {'steamid': '76561198071496648', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1566163432}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988534641', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 7719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7670, 'last_played': 1629753582}
review:
So if you played through Dungeons and Dungeons: The Darklord and you somehow made your way to here expecting a true sequel...well buddy I got news for ya.

THIS GAME HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE FIRST ONE.  At all, nothing.  Nada.  Zip. Zilch. The original game mechanics have been completely scrapped in favor of what is what I will call "The Dungeon Keeper Clone people expected the first game to be".  

That being said... the game actually is quite good - I mean.  You have three types of factions- Horde, Demonic, Undead for your evil underlings...you build a dungeon that you will play very differently based off of what faction you choose... and you will lead campaigns in the RTS fashion (either with Strategy or just a giant angry mob crushing everything in it's path).  It's a simple concept that is easy to learn but takes a bit of effort to master.  Especially the Dungeoneering Parts... but overall I think one of the coolest accomplishments this game adds that even Dungeon Keeper didn't have is the fact that you can...

FILL IN THE TILES WITH DIRT

This adds for a huge amount of options of optimizing the perfect defenses when building your dungeon and minimizes the pain of "over digging".  The plot is charming and tongue in cheek with better voice acting.  The only character to survive the first game is the Dungeon Lord himself... there is a guy that kinda resembles the Undead King though.

There is a lot to work with here, personally I like rerouting hero entrances to underground neutral enemy monster areas so that while I'm building those bastards can fight and kill eachother for a while.

One of the few games that I found myself actually buying and playing the Expansion Maps packs because of the challenge.

My only complaint is that I kinda miss some of the stuff from the first game - I believe there are elements there that would have made a solid game though this direction is welcome too.

Perhaps one day the first game's mechanics can be continued in a different...spinoff series?

I recommend getting, Hell I even recommend buying at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078322276', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1573044538}
review:
Hra mě sama o sobě bavila. V nudnějších chvílích to zachraňuje vypravěč, ale musel jsem si vybrat co může a nemůže komentovat. Protože když vám opakuje pár vět pořád dokola aby jste si pospíšili, a kolo dokončily. Tak to začne lézt na nervy. 
Najdete tam i narážky na jiné hry, a postavy. Jen to občas přehání, a pak už to není vtipné, ale otravné. Hra sama o sobě není moc dlouhá pokud nejste jako já, který si z toho dělá simulátor stavění.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008068737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1563033093}
review:
던전스3 AI가 구리다고 생각했는데, 이건 더 구림...
인터페이스는 2015년이 아니라 2005년에 발매가 됬다고 해도 구리다고 느껴질정도로 불편함.
난이도도 후속작인 던전스3가 그냥 던전에서 심시티 하다가 밖에 나가서 쓸어버리는 수준이라면 2편은 그냥 심시티 하면서 한 숨 자고 와서 해도 될 수준... 후속작이 있으나마나한 난이도 조절 기능이라도 탑재한것에 비해 이건 난이도 조절조차 안됨...

거기다 플레이타임이 되게 짧은데, 다른 게임들은 흩어진 아군 세력을 규합하고, 적 보스의 주요 측근을 하나씩 제거한 후 마지막에 적 보스와 대결을 한다면,
이 게임은 흩어진 아군세력을 규합한 후, 적의 측근들과 보스를 한 번에 작살내고 게임을 끝내는.... 진짜 무성의함의 끝을 보여줍니다.
게임이 느려서 플탐 10시간이지, 다른 게임 템포였으면 3~4시간이면 엔딩 볼 분량입니다.

후속작이 나와있는 현 시점에선 전혀 구입할 가치가 있는 게임이 아니며, 혹시 어디서 게임을 공짜로 받았더라도 해볼만한 가치가 있는진 모르겠네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102929724', 'num_games_owned': 1206, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1562323730}
review: Dungeons 3を入手したので、持っていた2からやることにしたが、期待以上に面白かったためレビューしたい。これまでの先人の方々がレビューで書かれているとおり、ゲームを始めて目的が日本語で書かれているのにもかかわらずなかなかクリアできないことは実感できた。確かに説明不足の感はあるが試行錯誤するのも楽しめるのであれば十分面白いゲーム。ダンジョンパートはRTSの育成部分、地上パートがRTSの戦闘部分といった感じだろうか。ダンジョンパートでも戦闘は発生するが、RTSのような指示はだせないのでご注意を。このゲームに関してPS4のほうで多少情報はあるが、日本語での攻略情報が非常に少ない。キャンペーンをするには、攻略なしで臨む気力が必要であろう。ごり押しでもすすめれるところはあるが、非常に楽しめているのでDungeons 3も楽しみである。

review:
Juego recomendado para los que nos gusta la estrategia.

- Tiene un control sencillo que lo convierte un juego recomendable para gente que quiera iniciarse el género estrategia.
- Tiene una historia y unas narraciones humorísticas que lo hacen muy divertido.
- En contra diría que sin los DLC adicionales tiene pocas horas de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011003167', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1554329240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198842848657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2300, 'last_played': 1655645232}
review:
¡¡¡Juegazo de la faking mader!!! Básicamente eres “Sauron” o en su defecto, cualquier señor oscuro de un universo de fantasía medieval épica, en un juego que a ratos es un tower defence y a otros, un juego de estrategia, si te gustan cualquiera de los 2 géneros te va a gustar Dungeons 2, ya está. Creas una mazmorra o calabozo del mal, en el cual gestionas unidades y recursos, para luego ir a la superficie y patearle el orto, con tu horda del mal a los tipos buenos.

Por otro lado el juego hace muchos chistes, guiños y referencias a series como Game of Thrones, Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter y el universo de Warcraft. Si eres fan o conoces de algunas de dichas franquicias, te reirás bastante con el juego.

El único aspecto negativo del juego es su campaña, bastante corta (aunque los DLC agregan mas misiones bastante buenas), pero por su bajo precio, lo vale completamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961830115', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1560985221}
review:
un giro fresco al la estrategia clasica, personalmente no jugue el 1 pero, la narrativa y eventos te entretiene, es facil de jugar pero se puede volver algo dificil con algunas situaciones que salen del control. 

lo recomiendo, me ah sacado algunas risas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313536756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1495621718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068655127', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1561735790}
review:
Интересная игрушка, но не без изъянов.

Неплохо сбалансирована, продумана и с любовью сделана. Сюжет и юмор местами забавны, но по большей степени не играют никакой роли.

Главным минусом для меня стала скорость игры - она достаточно медленная и часто приходится ждать, пока накопятся ресурсы, пока рабы что-нибудь сделают, пока армия дойдёт из точки в точку.

Играть за демонов не интересно, в Битвы не тянет, но кампанию прошёл с удовольствием, хотя на последних двух миссиях уже откровенно скучал половину времени.

review: Played this game after Dungeons 3 and I was quite disappointed. A lot of things changed in dungeons 3 and I can't recommend this game. if you want the Dungeons experience, go for Dungeons 3. What I liked that still remained, was the voice actor and the story style of evil against good, which was a really fun experience. I wished more games would have done this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343556875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1697161797}
review:
Con la de horas que metía al primero...

Esta segunda parte se me hace muy lenta y aburrida donde la gran diferencia es que debes invadir la superficie y... no tiene ninguna gracia especial.
Yo conocía las mecánicas por el original pero para alguien que entre de nuevas están muy mal explicadas ya que resultan bastante confusas.

Salió gratis y le tenía ganas por lo mucho que me gustó el original pero ha sido una decepción que dejaré aparcada no por no poder seguir, si no por aburrimiento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378005200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1559563215}
review: This has elements that reminds me of Warcraft I and II. I’m really enjoying it. It has a great tutorial that is led by narration and also has the notification system that reminds you how to do things (in the small chance you don’t listen or forget). This sets you up nicely for the game (because let’s admit, a lot of games these days throw you in the deep end) and the manual is extremely informative too. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2072, 'last_played': 1558016766}
review: Un jeu de stratégie bien sympa où l'on incarne le mal méchant. Ici le but est simple, on se retrouve dans la peau du mal absolu qui a trouvé refuge dans son donjon suite à une défaite cuisante. On commence avec quelques serviteurs puis on recrute de nouveaux monstres afin de partir à la conquête de la surface. Le jeu est relativement beau et il propose de nombreuses améliorations à débloquer. Les doublages en français sont de qualité et l'humour est omni présent au travers des commentaires du narrateur durant la campagne. Le principe est bien pensé et devrait plaire aux amateurs des jeux de stratégie. En définitive le jeu est plaisant et on prend plaisir à aller chasser les ennemis vertueux du mal absolu. Pour compléter la campagne, le jeu propose un mode escarmouche solo ainsi qu'un mode multijoueur.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986527965', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1557111099}
review:
Dungeons 2 is a lighthearted humorous RTS/Simulation hybrid where you run a dungeon that you need to protect while sending troops to the overworld to destroy your enemies.

Ultimately the game fails because the RTS and Simulation aspects are both below average.  The RTS aspects of running around on the surface with units is simple and not engaging.  You make a bunch of troops, send them to fight small bands of enemies lying around, and kill them easily.  You never really need to use any abilities that your troops have and it's annoying trying to find them to activate even if you wanted to.  You never need to use any of the many spells you've researched and many are limited in where you can cast them anyway.

The simulation aspects are the same thing every level.  Send minions to dig out areas so you can build rooms.  Some rocks contain one time gold pickups, others contain gold you can mine for a bit before they give out.  Occasionally you stumble upon some free troops or monsters that just sit there and block your way until you drop a couple troops in to kill them.  Occasionally easy to kill enemies enter your dungeon and you'll either drop troops into their path to kill them or let them get killed by the traps you've placed.  Repeat every level.

The game needs a lot of streamlining with its UI and has some other annoying issues.  You'll sometimes try to drop units into the sacrifice pit or on the stairs up to the overworld.  It'll look like you're hovering over these with your cursor, but you're not unless the object is highlighted yellow.  So you'll drop your units just short of them and then you have to wait 10 seconds or so for them to stand back up since you can't pick them up while they're lying on the ground.

Dungeons 2 combines an underwhelming RTS with an underwhelming simulation aspect.  Throw in a poorly done UI that desperately need streamlined and other annoying issues and you've got an underwhelming game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993335444', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1557097879}

review:
Стратегия в реальном времени. Подземелье это база, которую придётся развивать и нянчить так и каждого жителя в ней.

review:
Dungeons 2 nous plonge avec délectation dans la peau du maître du donjon. On y creuse son repaire, on le protège avec des pièges sournois et des couloirs labyrinthiques, et on crée une armée de créatures assoiffées de bière et de pillage, dans le but de botter les fesses des forces du bien.
Beaucoup d'humour, des références à foison (mais pas que), et un gameplay simple et efficace.
A mettre entre toutes les mains, sauf celles des héros du Bien, évidemment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995849278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1651358604}
review:
En primer lugar, mis mejores agradecimientos a Humble Bundle por poner éste JUEGAZO de forma gratuita! <3 

Ahora voy a mi reseña en cuestión:

DUNGEONS 2 parece una mezcla entre un creador de mazmorras, un juego de estrategia en tiempo real (RTS) y una especie de WarCraft III en versión parodia en la que manejamos a las criaturas del Señor del Mal. Con unas misiones bastante entretenidas y un narrador que provocará nuestras risotadas es una joya de juego. 

Lo básico es que vas creando tus mazmorras con salas para el oro y otras estructuras que ayudarán a tus criaturas, luego tendrás que luchar contra los buenos de los caballeros de armadura brillante y llevar a cabo una guerra de guerrillas para triunfar. Todo muy bien diseñado y con un doblaje al castellano excelente. La música está muy molona y las criaturas son graciosas en su forma. Por ejemplo, los orcos serán tus combatientes más duros, pero les encanta beber cerveza y aporrear a los trabajadores goblins. 

En fin un juego divertidisimo que le encantará más a los estrategas que a los roleros, pero que gustará por igual a todo el mundo. Y si a todo esto le añadimos un modo multijugador, más otro modo multijugador cooperativo es la caña absoluta. 

Y por si fuera poco añaden un DLC de expansión GRATIS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021726329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1555710015}
review:
[h1] Great blend of Dungeon Management and RTS mechanics!	[/h1]

[u] Introduction	[/u]
Dungeons 2 is a dungeon management game where you are required to build up your dungeon defenses from invaders as well as build up the various type of resource gathering rooms in order to research and create better creatures and upgrades.  Dungeons 2 is also a RTS game when you are on the surface level, controlling and ordering your creatures to conquer and destroy  bases in various part of the maps. We play as a defeated evil overlord who is only able to use his hand of terror to accomplish his will in order to bring the entire region into the grasp of darkness.

[u] My Opinion	[/u]
Dungeons 2 is a humorous game filled with obvious parodies and reference of popular shows like Game of Thrones and Lord of the Rings. There is only one main voice actor in this game which takes on the role of the narrator and he is voiced by the Stanley Parable narrator, Kevan Brighting. Therefore, the voice acting is pretty good and well delivered.

The story campaign spans over 11 missions, 3 of which are branched off to an alternate demon faction while the other 8 are with the standard horde faction. Both the horde and the demons plays out pretty differently each with their own unique creatures, rooms and upgrades. Each of the missions last on an average of an hour or so. Hence you are looking at roughly around 20 hours of gameplay content which is pretty decent.

There is a multiplayer and skirmish mode available as well. The multiplayer mode is basically a race between whoever gets the highest points through conquering and killing the neutral enemies found in the map. However the multiplayer is pretty much dead at this point as there are nobody in the matchmaking system. The skirmish mode feature various different maps, some are from the main story and some are completely  new. They allow the player to enjoy the gameplay without any of the story constrictions. There is also an endless mode for those that want to play the skirmish mode forever!

[u] Conclusion	[/u]
Dungeons 2 is a decently length dungeon managment/RTS game with enjoyable gameplay loop and funny references/parodies of various popular medias. I would give it a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988664393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1555168985}
review:
Also Hand aufs Herz viele kaufen sich das Spiel wegen der Dungeon Keeper Reihe aber als großer Fan eben jener muss ich leider auch sagen das Dungeons 1/2 ganz und gar nicht mit halten kann alten original. Das spiel haten einen sehr schönen Humor die Grafik ist gut und die Steuerung passable aber das wars schon. Das Spiel besitz keine Spieltiefe, jeder der das original zum vergleich gespielt hat wird das Gefühl nicht los werden das etwas fehlt.......

Es gibt wenig Räume, 3 fallen und nur eine handvoll Einheiten die jeweil zwei entwicklungen haben und ein sehr Minigame anmutenden echtzeit strategiespiele Teil. Alles wirk etwas abgespeckt und nicht zu ende gebraucht. 

alles in allen nicht schlecht aber auch nicht gut, die langzeit motivation ist auf jeden Fall nicht gegeben und so habe ich nach  ein paar stunden kampagne und ein, zwei Gefechten das spiel leider zur Seite legen müssen weil es mich nicht vordert und mich auch nicht in seinen bösen Bann ziehen kann

author: {'steamid': '76561198028436082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1608591116}
review:
Dungeon 2 est l'enfant bâtard de Dungeon keeper et d'un minion petit chaton rose, avec de grands yeux kawaii qui font de petites étoiles. On incarne le gardien du donjon un monstre sanguinaire qui paye ses créatures et leur fournit un petit nid douillet, GRAOU, euh pardon miaou, désolé d'avoir parlé si fort.

Le gameplay reprend les bases de Dungeon Kepper : on creuse des galeries, on mide de l'or et on construit des salles. Mais bon il n'y a pas vraiment de stratégie : la géométrie importe peu, les niveaux sont tous identiques, et les salles se construisent toujours dans le même ordre...

Il y a aussi le monde de l'extérieur, mais les niveaux sont tous designés comme un tuto : si on fait ce que dit la voix off, tout se passe bien... Ahh quel plaisr de détruire ses contrés verdoyantes pour les remplacer par de la jolie lalave rourouge et du sol noir! Ahhh quand je pense que l'écran de sélection des niveaux du premier Dungeon Keeper était meilleur que le monde du dessus... Vraiment, comment ratter un truc pareil.

Bref dungeon 2, c'est la version gentillette des démons qui se vernissent les griffes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120581054', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1554016172}
review:
An really great rts-like game, reminds me of warcraft 3. An funny history telled by an ironic narrator, in this game you're the devil and need to "conquer back" the world. 

     I liked the dungeon management style in the gameplay, but in the overall, the game seen fairly easy to play, it do not have a real challenge to beat, nothing that you could worry about in the gameplay. Each scenario, at least for me, was really long, increasing the time of gameplay by each map, maybe beacause i was trying to do everything possible in each "match".

     It can be a bit boring, because every time that you go to foward in the missions, it is aways the same thing: raise your troops, farm gold, enhance your gear, defend for a bit and go "hunt'em". I couldnt lie, it is really fun, but probally to someone out there it'll be really boring. Each map you get to know new allies and tecnologies, but it is basically almost to raise the time of playing.
 I recommend it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 1508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1643038704}
review:
Tags: Tycoon&Simulator&Sim&City

TLDR: Warcraft/Dungeon Keeper hybrid with decent implementation. Build a dungeon and split efforts between defense with traps and guards and offense of an overworld using RTS commands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094933427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2402, 'last_played': 1552085560}
review: This was an enjoyable romp through the underground of a magical realm being corrupted by pure evil.  Out of the dungeon, on the surface of this world, things were different.  The little bunnies would just keel over and die when the lands became too evil for them to tolerate anymore.  My therapist says I should confront my uncomfortableness in the world and express myself so I have to say, that bothered me the most.  I wouldn't go so far as to say the bunnies were frolicing but they were happy nonetheless.   Perhaps they were merely gamboling merrily or even just skipping but.... no more.   They fell to the way side and were trampled by the horde when they left the dungeons.  Perhaps a more suitable name for this game would be dungeons 2 and....dungeons 2 and.... BUNNY KILLING!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071926221', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1552758112}

review: Great game and I really love it, except the surface battles. But the game breaking bug really stopped me from progressing. It's 2019 I can't seem to find anything related to this. At the 4th mission, I'm supposed to mine crystals after plugging the artifact, but the option to build the room does not appear. I hope dungeons 3 doesn't have this problem. What a waste. I really wanted to finish this game as the comedy is pretty good and the gameplay is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099710707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3696, 'last_played': 1552393831}
review:
I had a random copy of Dungeon keeper 2  back in the day, saw a guy review 3 and thought omg cool.. 

Firstly.. what i fail to understand is why when you have implemented certain stuff in 3.. like random generation..
why the hell haven't you added it to this version of the game when clearly you can and people keep asking for stuff like that it seems.. I noticed that someone has said in an older review that theirs no map editor either and no mod support or anything..

you say in a reply that using unity is hard to make an editor in game.. well i call bs on that one.. I actually also feel like what happened here is you just created this game using a "blueprint" so i did some looking around at engines and stuff and yea you can basically just buy software to make these kinds of games super easily..

All in all, this will give you a "Dungeon keeper 2" fix in a way.. but like i'm super glad i got the dlc coz without it i cant see that their would be much to the game.. only looks like 8? main missions.. which are basic at best.. and then you think oh yea i'l give "A Game of Winter" a go.. which then all of a sudden is bloody brutal asf after the first 2 levels the next like 3-5 are nearly impossible to even leave your dungeon when you actually need too.. and you just have this announcer repeating everything for like 1-2 hours while you struggle to figure out wtf your supposed to do..

I got this on sale.. at like 10$? with all the dlc.. and i see the standard is like $20 at mo.. honestly i wouldn't buy it without dlc and it would certainly be a huge bloody rip off at 20$ when u only get like 8 missions on what 4 levels? you would honestly get one day out of it.. and the only reason you get much more than that out of the dlc is because its brutal and takes you forever to figure out what you have to do.. and once you do its then too easy.. and then the level is over.. and your left like half dissapointed..

i think maybe.. i should have just bought 3.. but i mean.. i feel like this is a necessary precursor anyway..

its great in the fact it does give you that Dungeon keeper 2 vibe etc.. but yea.. not enough content and lacks functionality.. 
both problems which could still be fixed.. quite easily.. and like everyone else is saying why!! isn't this workshop enabled omg.. like those 3 things would make the game worth buying.. but right now my suggestion would be make it free.. 
like quite honestly i've downloaded mobile apps for free with more content in them.. 

still, its fun, and a good waste of time.. i do recommend this but i wouldn't pay full price for it.. if this was donation based i might give 5$ but thats it..

review: The best game in the Dungeons series by far! A fantastic dungeon keeper game, with a lot of witty references to Lord of the Rings & Game of Thrones. I never get bored of this game, it was a huge improvement on the first game in the series, but if you’re deciding wether to buy this or number 3 I would go for this one, easier to get in to and much better gameplay all round. So worth the money.

review:
Pretty good actually. As Dungeon Keeper only not games go this is fairly spot on. Great fun building your dungeon up and setting complex networks of traps only for some idiot smegging bard to come along and disable them because you weren't paying attention and now the throne room is under attack.

In short: F*%k bards. Kill them with lightning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017056908', 'num_games_owned': 4176, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1551930914}
review:
I dont know how the multiplayer is but im playing for the singleplayer. For that its a really enjoyable game. I love the narrator in this a lot of times its pretty funny. Sometimes it can be kind of annoying when he keeps rushing you but overall its not too bad. Its kind of nice having a voice cheer you on the whole time. 

The game plays like an ongoing story. Im sure youve read how it all works etc as far as it being part dungeon keeping and part overland RTS battles.  I just wanted to say that im enjoying the game. Its a LOT better than Dungeons 1. I mean like night and day. This one plays like a mix of the sims, a management game and an RTS.  It might not be for everybody. But me personally i kind of love this game. Going to play through this and check out 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010018820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3557, 'last_played': 1547229836}
review:
First thing first, if you played the first one and are expecting more of the same, you will be disapointed. The gimmicks, the pentagrammes and the hero skills system are gone for a more traditional dungeon builder like Dungeon Keeper. For me, however this is not a bad thing. Loved the original but hated the gimmick system so I am a happy camper that it is gone. 

Now this is out of the way and your still reading, let talk about the game. Story wise, it is a lot of fun. Classic fantasy villain conquering the world of good with lots of humor and references that will make you chuckle. At least I did. I does not confirm really that we are playing the same dungeon lord as the first one or maybe I miss something, but the ultimate evil is a great replacement (if different characters they are). The narrator is gold. Pure gold. He makes everything better.

Gameplay wise, building your dungeon and attacking the surface are both tons of fun. Multitasking between dungeon building, defending and attacking the surface world can be a challenge sometimes. However, nothing unfair, you just need to kick yourself in buns and go for it!

Never played multiplayer, so my experience is only PVE aka campaign. That being said the factions idea was a great. Although, to me some were much more easier to play then other.

Conclusion, it is a very good game. Especially for fans of dungeon builders and fantasy. Play it. 
Now get going, evil deeds wont do themselve you know?

author: {'steamid': '76561198833051601', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1549907762}
review:
Хорошо подойдёт для расслабления (красочная, юморная стратегия в реальном времени). Но весьма лёгкая и однообразная, можно обойтись в защите 2мя-3мя видами ловушек, всё по одной тактике делаешь, не нужно особого подхода к врагам. В конце даже на ачивки забил и скорей завершил игру, минимум желательно её разбавлять с другой игрой.
6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008049239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1704461433}
review:
Enorme évolution graphique, sonore, scénaristique et du gameplay par rapport au premier.
On retrouve cet humour décalé qui a fait de cette licence un excellent jeu.

Par contre le gameplay a changé et je ne suis pas particulièrement fan. Plutôt que d'attirer les héros dans votre donjon pour les capturer et en extirper tout ce que vous pouvez ici vous devrez défendre votre donjon des incursions des héros et en parallèle, aller conquérir leur terres à la surface.
On se retrouve avec un côté STR qui, à mes yeux, casse la marque de fabrique de la licence.
Cela dit, c'est bien réalisé et ce n'est pas désagréable à faire.

Bref, c'est une très belle suite qui mérite de s'y pencher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136617729', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1549194089}
review:
This is a nice game. 
Of course it is inspired of Dungeon Keeper, which can´t stand a direct comparison. 
But the strength in this game are somewhere else. 
- You have 2 fractions (3 with expansion) which provide some variety
- There is a story, nothing special but kind of nice
- The missions are not as difficult as in Dungeon Keeper, so it is nice to play it for a short time 
- Control is easy
- Best thing is, you nearly don´t fight other Keeper, you fight the Overworld. 
There you have control over your troops like in Warcraft.

Anoying was:
- Bad documentation, often I wasn´t clear about how to achive an aim.
- Sometimes it happened, that the mission ended in an dead end, because in a place there gathered two many enemys which can´t be defeated or because of the constantly rushed to your dungeon, your units can´t come out of hospital. (Anyway on the secons try, I was always able to finish the mission)

Even if I was sceptical in the first two missions, I really liked the game in the end. 
But I also wouldn´t pay to much for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313667807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1548780766}
review: Une refonte totale du premier épisode. Byebye le vieux genre pour un truc un peu plus moderne aux déplacements caméras figés. Fort heureusement qu'on en ai pas vraiment besoin pour jouer sans problème. Dungeons 2 vous présente de nouveaux systèmes, de nouveaux besoins et un gameplay qui n'a plus rien à voir avec son prédécesseur. En somme c'est une bonne chose : on se rapproche beaucoup plus du genre Dungeon Keeper. Une modernisation d'un vieux nom qu'on connait et qu'on a aimé pendant longtemps. Un joli coup qui marche et qu'on recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167940370', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 700, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1666361859}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971544967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 2978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2978, 'last_played': 1548481891}
review:
Servicable game but enough weak points that it is more of a time waster than a truely good game.  The main reason I say that is that the game isn't very difficult (unlike the DLC).  The narrator is quite good which makes each mission enjoyable enough though.  The game isn't overly long unless you get into the DLC.  My time is probably 60-70% from the DLC as it was so hard.

The game is heavily inspired by Dungeon Keeper and is much more like that game then Dungeons 1.  The biggest difference from Dungeon Keeper is that you can leave the dungeon and attack the surface directly.  This is a very good idea but the implementation of that is awkward.  Each map has different controls and mechanics.  Above ground you directly control your creatures, including their abilities, while below ground they follow there own wants (unless you pick them up directly and drop them).  Makes for a weird experience.

Other than that it is just DK with some different creatures and mechanics.  It's been too long since I played that to go into details on the exact differences but you basically build up a dungeon by having your workers dig out rooms / ore veins you tell them too, and build different room types.  Rooms include letting you generate things like mana or pots (or whatever) to build traps or to train your units, heal them, make them happier, etc.  I found myself building in a similar manner most games and that became a bit of a chore instead of the fun creative thing it should have been.  This was hurt a lot by the very restrictive camera.  Fully zoomed out is what the screenshots all show, you cannot go further out.  This makes planning especially painful, not to mention things like finding the creatures you want, etc.  Probably my biggest complaint about the game actually.

Defending your dungeon tends to be the most common thing I found myself doing as it takes a while to build everything up where you can make progress on the surface (but that varies with mission of course).  You do that through traps, guard rooms, spells and just dropping creatures on them.  Traps are effective early, in small number but later on are only effective if you build many of them.  I did not end up using them much until the DLC where I think they are pretty much required.  Spells are just a suppliment, so creatures will likely be your main defense and deciding how to juggle sending them to the surface or defending becomes your major time investment along with just building out your initial dungeon.

The rest of the time is spent on the surface (or in special far away dungeons that play like the surface but with some traps and doors to deal with).  If you spent the time building a good group, especially on later levels, it is just a matter of smashing through all the guards and camps until you meet the objectives.  Once you get healers you can probably stay out there indefintely if you want to.  Creatures have special abilities but I found the interface too clunky to ever use them much, other than for a few special areas I rarely found them necessary.

So very, very minor recommendation.  Play this if you love the idea or want something a bit different that won't stress you out much (other than controls maybe).  There are better games though so you are probably better off playing those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261362617', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1703783925}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002513498', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1548500891}
review:
Вначале мне игра очень понравилась, но потом... игра однообразна. 

Есть 3 зла, орда, демоны, нежить. Орда из всех самая нормальная, они хотя бы пауков в подземелье могут убить, а то играя за нежить, и, тем более,  демонов, их выносят очень быстро. Да, если их прокачать, то они очень даже ничего, но в начале развития чувствуешь себя полным ничтожеством, уж лучше играть за орду.

Основную компанию я прошёл, немного пострадал за демонов, а за нежить я уже бросил прохождение, ну капец как они слабы...

Если сравнивать с первой частью, то игра шагнула далеко вперёд, а если сравнивать с родоначальником этого жанра, то пустышка.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983247247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1548495081}
review:
Tras pasarme la campaña principal y echar un par de partidas individuales solo tengo que decir que me parece un grandísimo juego. Es un juego sencillo de estrategia, en el que gestionar los elementos de tu base, protegiéndola e investigando nuevas salas mientras excavas en roca para ir ampliando tu mazmorra.

Me parece muy bien llevado el tema de la gestión de la propia mazmorra, con mucha variedad en las mazmorras y una progresión muy lograda, las trampas para los enemigos aventureros que se atreven a entrar en tu base son una pasada. Un añadido en esta segunda parte es la de poder salir al mundo exterior, que, aunque novedad, dista mucho de estar tan desarrollada y tan bien pensada como la actividad en la propia mazmorra, convirtiéndose en una parte algo tosca en cuanto a gestión de unidades, objetivos y actividades en el mundo exterior.

Los gráficos son simpáticos, caricaturescos, y las animaciones están muy bien llevadas, el sonido no tiene mucha variedad pero no se hace repetitivo, aunque debo aclarar que es algo básico en cuanto al mundo, y la BSO es correcta, con alguna canción un poco más destacable.

Pero sin duda, el gran punto fuerte es el modo campaña, muchísimo humor, un muy buen guión que tiene de trasfondo una historia con "mucha" inspiración en sagas conocidas de aventuras, y hasta ahí puedo escribir.

Sin duda, recomiendo el juego a quienes les haya gustado el primer Dungeons, y quien quiera un juego de estrategia sencillo, ameno, pero muy divertido para echar unas cuantas horas creyendo que solo han pasado unos minutos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104754404', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3150, 'last_played': 1704741311}
review:
Ich mag das Spiel eigentlich echt gerne AAAABER ... was soll denn dieser scheiß mit dem: "Hier, hast du zig super einfache Missionen. Bau einfach deinen Dungeon komplett aus und schon rotzt du alles weg" und dann kommt auf einmal ein Level in dem man vorne und hinten nicht vorwärts kommt. "Nimm drei Punkte an der Oberwelt ein, bitte ganz zu anfang, die werden dir aber auhc immer wieder weggenommen, während du keine Zeit hast deinen Dungeon auszubauen oder Upgrades zu erforschen, weil ja dauernd auch Gegner in deinen Dungeon rein rennen, während du nicht mal einen der drei Punkte halten kannst, weil deine Gegner viel höherlevelig sind als deine eigenen Viecher, die du aber nicht hoch gelevelt bekommst, weil du ja keine Zeit zum erforschen hast, weil dein Dungeon non-stop von Gegner geflutet wird und in deinem Dungeon bist du auch noch arg begrenzt, weil überall riiiiiesige Nester sind von wirklich großen Spinnen und Drachengruppen" ... Ganz ehrlich... Was soll der scheiß? Ich finde das Spiel gerade so angenehm, weil es so 'gemütlich' war. Ich baue einfach gerne. Nun bekomme ich nichts gebaut, weil ich nichts erforscht bekomme, weil mein Dungeon permaüberrant wird und meine Viecher nur am kämpfen sind die ganze Zeit... Das macht keinen Spaaahaaß. Und ja, ich habe durchaus verschiedene Taktiken versucht bei der Bauweise, bei der Vorgehensweise usw. Nicht machbar. 

Ist übrigend die Quest mit dem Jungbrunnen im Eis-Addon. 

Das Hauptspiel kann ich empfehlen, für Leute, die gerne gemütlich was aufbauen und dann oberimba alles abschlachten wollen. DIESES Addon... is nicht zu gebrauchen. Ich versuchs noch ein Bisschen aber ich fürchte, das wird mir die Laune am gesamten Spiel killen... in Dungeons 3 (das ich vorher gekauft habe) gabs bei dem Karibik-Addon auch so ne schier unlösbare Quest...

author: {'steamid': '76561198050369301', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1987, 'last_played': 1548167996}
review:
[h1] "Злейшее" Зло вернулось в этот мир [/h1]

Dungeons 2, соответственно, как подражатель жанра Dungeon [strike]Master'a[/strike] Keeper'a (next D[strike]M[/strike]K), является своеобразной пародией на множество фантастических франшиз, к примеру: Warcraft, Lord of the Ring, Game of Thrones. И, как понятно, игра наполнена каламбуром в исполнении харизматичного повествователя.

Не смотря на множество плюсов, игра не смогла обойти оригинальную серию D[strike]M[/strike]K, но получила хорошую базу. Как и D[strike]M[/strike]K, Dungeons 2 остается всего лишь скучным симулятором бога, поэтому оценить ее смогут единицы, но если Вам хочется занять себя на пару вечеров, то эта игра для Вас.

Без лишнего, игра может получить от меня 8 "Унылых" Зол из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007812404', 'num_games_owned': 1247, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1552, 'last_played': 1547777791}
review: On the surface, this game feels like a very boring idea...a more distant minecraft. This could not be further from the truth. The narrator, straight from the Stanley Parable, is amazing and witty, which couples well with the goofy, yet satisfying gameplay. This game suffers from the same affliction that Minecraft, or Total War or Civ does... Just one more day, just one more thing. It is so satisfying to watch minions scuttle around and the different units are all very charming and packed full of character. Cannot recommend this more, and cannot wait to play the next one! Well worth getting and a perfect way to pass the time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973190491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1547563087}
review:
The narrator is decent but the meta-jokes and pop culture references get a bit old and it feels extremely unpolished. Units frequently clip through walls, the controls feel a bit clunky and I already lost my motivation to continue playing during the first or second mission.

It's a step up from the first Dungeons game but they're basically milking the Dungeon Keeper nostalgia with a mediocre game that trys to add something new to the game with the overworld missions but it could've used a lot more hours of cleaning up and tweaking in more or less every department. Would not recommend this in general. If you're looking for a Dungeon Keeper experience, there are other games that are much closer to that, like War for the Overworld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240598162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1547175536}
review:
有中文好评。不过不得不说这一作还是对地下城守护者的拙劣模仿，设计的新内容到后面反而成了休闲玩家的累赘，机制弄的太复杂到后期玩起来越来越糟心。去地面作战之后就变成了RTS游戏，每关还有类似WAR3自制地图的需要技巧通过的类似设计，起初前几个战役玩起来还是挺有新意的。到后面几关发展起来要研发的内容越来越多，去地面之后需要排队型放关键技能的操作，都让我感觉玩起来太过疲惫。本身小时候玩地下城守护者感觉还是比较轻松的，地板铺好之后房间的建筑就自动生成，传送器占领之后你的手下就源源不断的涌入。在地下城2这一作里就变成了你点击的负担。
值得一提的是在守地下城的难度并不太高，敌人给你的压力不是很大。难点就在于地面上的RTS打斗，如果你仅仅是像小学生玩RA2那样攒够兵种再点一下敌人，那你会尝到比较大的惨败。
总之如果你是为了怀旧地下城守护者这个游戏，那我不太建议你购买这作，你可以去玩地上战争，那个比较原汁原味。
如果你是想尝试新的扮演反派的游戏，那这一作打折后低廉的价格和中文的支持我觉得你不妨一试。用DK2的一句话来结束：It's good to be bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004443721', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2531, 'last_played': 1496006510}
review:
He visto que algunos llaman a este juego el sucesor de Dungeon Keeper, es difícil no intentar compararlo al tener como punto común la gestión de una mazmorra. Pero a la final, en mi opinión, son dos títulos distintos, con jugabilidades y mecánicas diferentes. Así que no dejes que el nombre de este juego te sugestione que encontraras una joya como el inigualable Dungeon Keeper.

Sin embargo para ser objetivos, el juego entretiene, aun cuando es una mezcla extraña entre RTS, Tower defense y Warcraft. Por ello la jugabilidad la divido en dos: lo que para mí es el Tower defender, con la gestión de una mazmorra donde extraer recursos, reclutar unidades, entrenarlas, investigar mejoras... los enemigos nos visitan desde distintas entradas, y nuestro claro objetivo es diseñar nuestra mazmorra para hacerlos pasar por caminos llenos de trampas y así lleguen lo más debilitados posible para enfrentar a nuestras tropas que se encuentran custodiando el corazón de la misma. 

Si utilizamos las entradas por donde llegan los enemigos, nuestras tropas irán al mundo exterior, y es donde viene el juego RTS con intentos de simular un Warcraft. Y es allí donde el juego pierde rumbo, pues parece ser el punto de origen de los bugs de otras mecánicas del juego, da la sensación de que esta incompleto y sin nada de estrategia más que encontrar las bases los enemigos y arrasar con ellos. En conclusión, como si lo hubieran metido para diferencia este título del que antes más arriba mencione y de alguna forma innovar en el género.

Algo que destacar es el doblaje al español, que me pareció muy bueno, dado a que el juego depende bastante de la narración, te introduce en la historia y te da consejos de que hacer para que aprendas lo básico del juego.

Para terminar, me permito recomendarles el juego porque cumple su cometido de entretener, divertir y pasar buen rato…

author: {'steamid': '76561197994386334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1547033765}
review:
I can't play this.  I have tried numerous times and just can't seem to get a trap researched in time to slow the constant raids. I can kill a couple of raids with the Mistress as the Demon faction, and even threw them in the admiration room to get them back on their feet after falling in battle, but to no avail.  Perhaps I am too slow.

Or, perhaps the devs should include a few basics such as a tutorial! - or a PAUSE button! - or a setting easier than 'normal.'
(reducing raid frequency)  More time to explore my options, learn the game, and plan my room layout a bit.  I havent figured out how to show the minion information without actually picking them up.  What else, a better camera for any angle and a farther zoom would be nice.

I'm kinda bummed because of paying for something I can't play and enjoy.  Ah well, it looks like others seem to have done well with this...

author: {'steamid': '76561198065286279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1546467236}
review:
Unless you like constantly being overrun by waves of highly upgraded enemies in the later missions while you need to deal with an objective, having just barely started to set up your own dungeon, don't buy this game.

While the game is initially fun, it quickly becomes terrible.

Start a new dungeon from scratch.
Without even having time to research the first improvements, I get the main objective.
Then hordes of enemies flood my dungeon a few minutes later, I still haven't researched anything.
Fight off that horde, units go back to heal, which is extremely slow and taked forever, meaning they can't do research, the rest is undergoign the upgrading process.
Before the units are even half healed, or an improvement has gotten anywhere, the next wave invades the dungeon.
Go fight back that horde, event X creates a spawner in your dungeon.
If I don't destroy that spawner immediately, the next wave will appear before you get done with it and cause more trouble.
Meanwhile I still have barely managed to do any research or upgrade my units.
Wave after wave of enemies spawns in the dungeon and doesn't let me do anything.

Suddenly I lose to a timed objective after barely having gotten to do any research and having not even gone half way to upgrade my units.
My units, which are still barely on half their health rom the last fight, underleveled and constantly need to fight fully upgraded enemy units on the objective I ahd no chance to achieve anything on.
While wave after wave of enemy units is still flooding my dungeon.

It's like having to fill in a crossword puzzle while 2 people rock your chair and desk, someone wants to have a conversation with you and an orchestra has set up around you playing at full volume.
Sorry, that just sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016127365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1545445624}
review:
This singleplayer game was okay at best and felt like a bit of a chore to play.
The interface and controls were clunky and confusing.
The pace of the game was slow.
The minions/enemies/spells/economy didn't seem balanced (which led to the slow gameplay).
The story/narration had many pop-culture/fantasy references which got tiring fast as they were just relentless and incredibly ham-fisted.
The overall game is a mix of Dungeon Keeper and Warcraft 3, but nowhere near as polished as either leading to a lesser game.
I don't think I'll bother with the DLC and just move on to Dungeons 3 - hopefully it'll be an improvement.
Play this if you're a fan of WC3 and Dungeon Keeper and have time to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982614217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2286, 'last_played': 1545263578}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007486006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1544995880}
review:
I would like to start by saying that I don't feel like recommending this game, but this is not going to be a completely negative review. However, I feel that the cons outweight the pros.

Cons:
- repetitive: every mission in the main campaign starts with an empty dungeon in which you need to build the same series of rooms and structures. There is no sense of growth or continuity.
- banal story without any sense of unity: every mission could stand on its own
- simplistic dynamics

Pros:
- quirky humour
- the narrator!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028667907', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1807, 'last_played': 1551968377}
review: Подземелье 2 похож больше на старый Dungeon Keeper. В отличие от 1 части, игра сделана на 200% лучше. Мне любителю подобных игр в которые можно проходить одну токо миссию часа 2-3 игра очень нравится. Продуманная система прокачки и класный редактор своего собственного подземного царства. Гид в компании недает скучать. Рассказывая всякие приколы и отсылки старых игр и фильмов подходящие к тематике задания которое вы выполняите в компании. Единственное раздрожение в игровом процессе это то что прихвостни ооочень ну ОООООчень мнедленно несут добытое золото в сакровищницу. Логика токова что ебашить киркой они несутся сломя голову похлеще соника, а несут они его словно блять тарелку барщя налитую до краев и несут так чтоб не пролить. Ну я думаю люди меня пойтут по крайне мере те кто играл в оригинальный Dundeon Keeper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058057967', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1544994871}
review:
本作劇情十分單純，講述了一名魔王從頹勢中逐步振興，一一擊敗善良陣營的英雄，最終完成邪惡大業的故事。「旁白」是本作的一大特點，他以詼諧、不正經的口吻推動劇情，給予提示，甚至嘲笑玩家的戰略。旁白甚至使用了大量影視娛樂的哏，但對我這種不在那個文化圈的人，理解上有些困難。

每個關卡都有「地下城」和「地上世界」兩張地圖，玩家在地下城經營自己的邪惡帝國，發掘隱藏於土石之後的房間及其秘密；待軍隊壯大，便前往地上世界攻城掠地，完成關卡目標。地城的挖掘與設計就佔了攻略關卡時八成的時間－－畢竟本作即以地城為名，也因此交戰和其他戰略遊戲相比簡單很多，兵種只有四系，每系有三種型態，大多是越後面的型態越強，只要平均產兵再把兵都升至最終型態即可打遍地上世界，也不需要太精細的微控。

後面的關卡我幾乎得花兩小時才能通關，跟其他戰略遊戲的30分～1小時相比似乎冗長不少。地城內的單位命令很不便民，玩家無法一一指定每個單位去做特定的事情，如果在工兵短缺的狀態指派他們挖過多的牆，會導致產出資源的工作不可避免地停擺。本做有大量的科技可以研發，但惱人的是研發會因為單位休息、領薪、小酬、戰鬥而暫停，導致本來研發時間就偏長的科技難以完成，偏偏本作的人口上限又十分吃緊，無法透過大量的單位輪班彌補研發時間的缺口，使得這個缺點更形明顯。

我在購買本作時，期望的是「我能設計一座滿布陷阱的地城，能令我方不費一兵一卒就擊退來犯」，但敵方只要有一人是解除陷阱的兵種，耗費心思與大量資源鋪設的陷阱就毫無用武之地，最終只能回歸屯兵鎮守的模式，花了數十分鐘的路線不僅派不上用場，還無法延續到下一關，有種白費力氣的感覺。

因此儘管打了二折後的價格非常漂亮，我決定還是給予不推薦的評價。

author: {'steamid': '76561198123046489', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 4600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2399, 'last_played': 1668226175}
review:
Yep. This is the spiritual successor of Dungeon Keeper, and if they continued the franchise this is what the 3rd installment would look like. Although there are significant differences between the two, while this one feels expansive and limited in direct comparison.

For anyone not familiar with Dungeon Keeper, Dungeons allows you to have an almost-absolute control over an underground base while full control over surface battles outside of your base. You are able to control 2 different factions of dungeon builders (3 in skirmish mode) who come with their own kinds of rooms and half-dozen different kinds of units. 

It feels like a tower defense game (unlike Dungeon Keeper) because there are regular raids on your dungeon, forcing you to create defenses. However, you can't progress your unit's levels or builds without going out of your dungeon to explore and destroy your above-ground enemies. 

One thing I didn't like about the campaign was that it feels a lot like a very closely guided tutorial until the last couple of missions. It would have been nice to learn in one map, then have freedom to explore and come up with unique ways to fight your enemies.

The world and narration is fun and entertaining, however I had to reduce how often the narrator heckled me or made meta-game comments. The combat and spells you can use against your enemies really feels good when you are levelled up, because of how each unit can progress through different skill lines and compliament each other.

It's great if you like strategy games with very short learning curves and playing-as-the-enemy aesthetics. If you loved Dungeon Keeper like I did, this is a must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345824559', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1544134588}
review:
Dungeons 2 é um jogo inspirado no clássico de PC, Dungeon Keeper, onde sua principal tarefa é gerenciar uma dungeon habitada pelo mal em pessoa (que no caso é o próprio player) e seus minions (goblins, orcs, nagas, etc.) e nesta dungeon você vai administrar entre outras coisas, salários dos monstros, nível de satisfação deles, colocar armadilhas para deter invasões de humanos, extrair ouro e cristais de mana que são necessários para a manutenção da dungeon e ao mesmo tempo para evoluir o seu exército de monstros nas incursões no mundo dos humanos. Outra característica muito boa do jogo é o seu narrador sarcástico, que sempre fará observações engraçadas sobre o seu modo de jogar, demora para tomar decisões, demora em cumprir objetivos da campanha, etc. Sem falar também que é um jogo repleto de referências a cultura pop/geek.
Recomendo muito para passar um tempo jogando algo mais descontraído e ainda mais se ele estiver em promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050237511', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 3908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3735, 'last_played': 1529295307}
review:
Al mejor estilo Dungeon Keeper, tenés que administrar tu calaboso y crear tu ejército de demonios para proteger tu territorio. En la historia vos sos el malo de la película, tenés que destruir el reino de paz de los humanos y sus héroes. El narrador es gracioso. Los gráficos están buenos, también los efectos de sonido y música. 
Si te gusta el género recomiendo comprar la edición completa a ARS$350, son varias horas de juego a buen precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100232524', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 443, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1495658424}
review:
Adoro questa serie, l'ho giochichiata poco perchè non è proprio la mia parrocchia.
da quel che ho capito è un gestionale alla AoE dove però la base il centro città è fuori dalla zona di battaglia, raccogli oro, "cibo", costruisci roba per i tuoi omini così non sono scontenti, Si perchè c'è anche quella variante lì hanno fame, devono dormire, curarsi etc.. 
poi crei l'armata e invadi. in più per difendere il " centro città " devi costruire trappole e piazzare incantesimi per bloccare gli avversari:  che ti possono attaccare, rubare le risorse..
Ma non solo mentre espandi il dungeon puoi incontrare mostri o roba che ti rompe il cazzo nel dungeon come mostri che non fanno parte dell'esercito avversario.. 
Ma la cosa migliore è il modo goliardico e cazzaro in cui la storia è raccontata, è proprio ignorante, ogni 3x2 ci sono citazioni a qualunque cosa, rotture della quarta parete...
L'unica cosa è che il tutorial per un neofita del genere è decisamente ostico.

review:
한 4시간까지는 할만함 꼬맹이들도 상당히 귀엽고 던전을 내맘대로 꾸밀 수 있는것도 마음에 듬 그러나 인터페이스가

존나 불편함 던전내에서 건물을 선택하려고 해도 꼬맹이나 고블린이 잡히고 내가 공격하고 싶은 적을 선택하지도 못함

지하에서 유닛을 옮기려면 무조건 들어야만 하는데 대체 왜 이렇게 만든건지 이유를 모르겠음

author: {'steamid': '76561198067062670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1554377094}
review: Je ne me lasse pas de ces jeux où l'on se retrouve dans les bottes de l'enfoiré de service qui a le monde entier en grippe. Dungeons 2 est un plaisir à jouer et le narrateur est le tonton cynique qu'on rêve tous d'avoir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358147481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1669778130}
review: Dungeons 2 is a game where you control a giant hand (at least, from what i've played so far), and you must bring back evil to the sickeningly happy world above. The narrator gives you instructions and insults you if you don't get them done fast enough (funny at first, but can become tedious). You must do evil and terrible things to the world above, from killing kings and heroes, to crashing the stock market. So overall I recommend this game to people who like straying away from the norm of good guys always winning/saving the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179604937', 'num_games_owned': 2457, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4486, 'last_played': 1561039616}
review:
A friend recommended this game when it was on sale, and I love it. I found the base game quite easy, but the DLCs are not. Currently playing "A Game of Winter" and it is harder than the base game, which is actually kinda awesome. The naration is hilarious at times. In the beginning, it can be quite repetitive where he berates you for not being fast enough, but throughout the story, there are some funny shots taken at various fantasy franchises. At times I've found myself thinking "Did he just say what I think he just said?" Pretty sure Bartos Snow told me to "stop letting me die or I'll fuckin chin ya," or something to that effect in a very British accent. I love the fourth wall humour, it's the best thing about his game next to the whole crafting your Dungeon thing. 

I didn't play the original Dungeons, or Dungeon Keeper, so I am judging this game entirely on it's own merits... and did I mention that I LOVE it? I just can't agree with some of the reviews that are saying "it's not as good as x or y." That's all subjective because out of all the games I've played, this one ranks right up there with my favourites. 

If you do enjoy the game, "A Game of Winter DLC" is a worthwhile addition once you've finished the initial, easier, base campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064075828', 'num_games_owned': 1687, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1542488737}
review: Dobrá hra, kde máte za úkol uchránit svůj dungeon před hrdiny, kteří Vás přišli zničit. Na pomoc si můžete najmout různé monstra a nebo pokládat pasti. Někdy na místo bránění se chopíte útoku a posíláte monstra na povrch země zničit lidstvo. Graficky a hudebně to ničím neurazí. Ve hře je spousta vtipných hlášek od vypravěče. Na hře mi vadila jen zdlouhavost a to že mají monstra v dungeonu lepší pracovní podmínky než já ve své práci ( nedělá jim problém se vykašlat na práci a jít si pro zlaťáky a nebo se jít napít piva ).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998404426', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1542762626}
review:
DUNGEONS 2 - 7/10

Basic Info
-----------
Genre(s): RTS, Tower Defense
Game Length: 10~ hours
100%: Length: 25 hours
Achievement Difficulty: 3/10
Missable Achievements: None

Brief Synopsis
--------------
The Ultimate Evil was banished and sealed away eons ago. Now he has come again, and it's up to you to guide his horde of monsters against the ever good Alliance to conquer the world in the name of evil!

Gameplay Synopsis
--------------------
Fairly different then normal RTS games. You have 2 maps instead of one: The Overworld and The Dungeon. The Dungeon is where most of your game takes place. You build your buildings here, mine your resources, do your upgrades etc. When you have enough power you can send minions into The Overworld to complete objecttives (mainly just destroying bases). The controls for each are fairly different. Overworld has standard RTS controls whereas The Dungeon changes your cursor into a giant hand that lets you pick up and drop units as well as a few other things.

Pros/Cons
---------
+ Great Narrator
+ Easy to pick up and play
+ Addictive
+ Never feel any real pressure

- Cluttered UI
- Constantly waiting
- Maybe a bit too easy
- Overused references
- Lots of minor annoying details
- Lackluster, grindy achievements

Details
-------
+ The Narrator plays a huge part in the game. During the story he'll guide you through almost every objective, detail constantly whats happening with his enthusiastic and humourous voice while constantly spouting out jokes. He really doesn't like the goody two shoes alliance!
+ The game is very basic. You build floors of rooms (instead of buildings, so you can build Treasury Floors or Hospital Floors), then you build specific facilities in those rooms, then almost every else is automated. All you end up doing is upgrading and send units to The Overworld. It's pretty stress free!
+ At least for the first 5 hours I found myself wanting to play this quite a bit. Because of the humour and simplicity of the gameplay I never felt turned off by anything.
+ Coupling with the above points you don't ever feel stressed playing this. There's no real time limits and when there is they don't matter anyway, almost all gameplay is done automatically and the game isn't very challenging anyway.

- The UI in both Overworld and Dungeon isn't very good. In the Dungeon you can't select multiple things and always select individually and there's menus and such all over the screen. The Overworld changes it but selecting units individually when they're all cluttered together is annoying.
- Because the gameplay is reliant on getting things done over time, you're going to be waiting and doing nothing ALOT. Buildings require units to work in them. Those same units need breaks for exercising, drinking beer, picking up their pay etc. Their walk speed is also slow so if you want an upgrade done asap and your unit needs a break then you'll be waiting a while. Couple this with the massive amount of facilities that rely on manned buildings makes it truly annoying and slows down games WAY too much.
- Most of the fighting is done in The Overworld and apart from the last 2 missions (which even then aren't that hard), a few upgraded minions will constantly stomp any adversary you fight. It's almost no contest and almost every battle is unloseable unless you just send like, 1 guy. And if your units die they will just get revived in your Dungeon anyway. Enemies also never recover health.
- While the Narrator is funny, almost 90% of his jokes are either from LotR or Game Of Thrones. Sometimes they're direct ripoffs and not jokes at all. The humour, while funny, is not very diverse.
- Waiting times. Selecting individual unit spells to cast in The Overworld is pointless. Pointless, weak dungeon invasions. Traps are almost useless because they get disabled almost constantly. Every mission has the same progression. Little things that while never game stopping will annoy you.
- You can get most achievements just playing through the game while the last few are all about waiting. Mining 250k mana will take upwards of 6 hours extra after beating the main game. 25 hours playtime too.

Other
-----
- If you hover your cursor over a unit in the Dungeon, they'll turn to the camera and wave at you!
- I liked the spells you could use and while I never found myself using all of them, they were diverse and interesting.

Tips
----
- Make use of your lighting bolt spell to kill enemies fast. it costs almost no mana and never gets weaker. It's enough to take out any troublesome units!
- If you REALLY want to get things done faster, when a unit takes a break just pick him up and drop him off where he wants to go and when he's done take him back to wherever he was. Micromanaging units will get things done 100x faster, but it's also annoying, time consuming and aggravating having to do this constantly.
- For the grindy achievements, in the final mission you'll get an objective to destroy a bunch of houses. Do this, but then don't kill the boss here and instead go back to your dungeon. Make a save. You won't get invaded ever again and will have all the time in the world to produce gold and mana! This also saves you from having to load a skirmish map and setting things up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 512, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2399, 'last_played': 1704076141}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are well worth your time[/url][/code]

[b]Approximate amount of time to 100%:[/b] 30h
[b]Estimated achievement difficulty:[/b] 3/10
[b]Minimum number of playthroughs needed:[/b] 1
[b]Is there a good guide available:[/b] Yes, I used [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1263673934] this one [/url], which has them nicely sorted by level. 
[b]Multiplayer achievements:[/b] Yes
[b]Missable achievements:[/b] No, as there is level selection
[b]Grinding Achievements:[/b] Yes, there are grindy achievements for getting gold and mana. Gladly the game plays also when it is not the active screen. so running it in the background and let the game grind gold/mana is highly recommended once you have unlocked the other achievements. 
[b]DLC-Only achievements:[/b] No
[b]Speedrun achievements:[/b] No
[b]Time-gated achievements:[/b] No
[b]RNG-achievements:[/b] No
[b]Does difficulty affect achievements:[/b] No difficulty option
[b]Unobtainable/glitched achievements:[/b] No

The humor in Dungeons 2 is top-notch! I love being evil in games and with such a narrator helping you on your way and reminding you of the objective... is just awesome! The narrator is the same is in The Stanley Parable, for those who know that game. and he does such a good job. The humor, the sarcasm! it is just everything. 

Dungeons 2 is a strategy RTS with base building. You build your base underground, which helps you collect resources to buy more troops. However, those pesky humans have found the entrance(s) to your cave and are set on destroying it. Gladly you have access to a lot of traps (my favorite is the gold chest, just to see them explode in the hero's faces), and troops. And this also gives you opportunities to level up your troops. 

I did enjoy the story Dungeons 2 told, and the gameplay was a lot of fun. But as already said the highlight of the game is the humor and the narrator, those lift up this experience so much. And I was glad to hear that they kept the same narrator for Dungeons 3 & 4. 

Most of the achievements you'll unlock by playing through the game. none is missable because you can replay a level. There is at least one achievement that requires multiplayer, and there are a few grindy ones. 

I highly recommend Dungeons 2 if you're in the mood for being evil, while also being entertained!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001679105', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 560, 'playtime_forever': 1960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1635196245}
review:
Vous êtes le mal absolu, et votre mission est de détruire le bien.
Pour cela, créer votre base, enfin, votre donjon, car oui, le mal habite toujours bien profond, et protégez-vous contre toute pénétration de votre salle du trône, car sa destruction signifie la fin.

Hormis le coté gros méchant, sachez que vos esclaves…euh, non, vos monstres…quoi que…si, vos esclaves sont capables de protester si vous ne les faites pas travailler assez et que l’humour du narrateur est toujours présent. Oui, des clins d’œil en jeu sont fait à EA pour Dungeon Keeper et plein d’autres.

Bref, de l’humour, de la création de donjon, de l’esclavagisme voulu par vos monstre, un donjon immense, du fouet, des esclaves qui font des truc bizarre (si, c’est marqué dans le jeu), un 4iem mur qui s’effrite à n’importe quel moment, c’est une bonne surprise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168346778', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1541170245}
review:
Dungeons 2 is an okay game. It was good for a one-time-diversion, but probably not something I'd play twice.

+ great narrator with very entertaining comments during the entire game
+ funny gameplay and animations
+ many references (mainly Lord of the Rings and Game of Thrones)
~ somewhat short. Took me 25 hours, but I made my life extra hard because I wouldn't accept any casualties. If you just go for it and deal with some losses along the way, it's a lot shorter.
~ very challenging. It starts easy at first, but the learning curve is steep and some missions were a bit frustrating.
- lackluster ending
- little to no replay value

review: A sad pathetic attempted cloning of what was a fantastic game (Dungeon Keeper). The hand controls are clunky, the humour completely forced, (it's amusing for about five minutes...), and the game mechanics are just plain awful. author: {'steamid': '76561198084062987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3294, 'last_played': 1667241492}
