author: {'steamid': '76561198178956435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1505084993}
review:
현재 버그는 없는듯 합니다.

게임자체는 정말 재미있습니다.
다만, 어느분의 리뷰대로 뽑을수 있는 병력들이
너무 적다 보니 방어와 지상공격을 제대로 하기가
많이 빡십니다.

마법연구에서 리콜스킬을 꼭 익혀야 하는 불편함이 있습니다.

함정도 좀 불만이 있습니다. 들어오는 애들중에 하나는 함정해체기술이
꼭 있고, 그나마 쓸만한건 폭탄상자인데... 그것도 머 좋은편은 아닙니다;

게임자체는 정말 재미있고 번역도 잘되어 있습니다.
창작마당이라도 할수 있었다면 더더욱 재미있는 게임이 되었을겁니다.

던전키퍼류 게임이 어려워하시는분들도 좋습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080075542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1495367256}
review:
Dungeons 2 est un mélange très inspiré de Dungeon Keeper (2) pour la gestion du donjon et de Warcraft III pour les combats en surface, dont il reprend l'esthétique. Autant le dire, il n'est pas aussi développé que ces deux jeux, mais ça n'en reste pas moins un très bon jeu.
L'humour du narrateur, les scénarios et les très nombreuses références crééent une ambiance très réussie, soutenur par  une VF excellente.
Comptez 10 à 15h pour finir la campagne.
Je vais peut être me laisser tenter par Dungeons 3...

review:
Strategico in tempo reale, dallo stile ironico e ricco di citazioni parodistiche al genere fantasy, graziato da un ottimo doppiaggio italiano, senza il quale l'esperienza di gioco ne sarebbe risultata probabilmente penalizzata. 
Gameplay divertente ed accessibile, alterna la costruzione del proprio dungeon a consolidate meccaniche RTS, dove rimane ancorato ai classici del suo genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979505422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1496081063}
review:
In short - Fun, Silly RTS/Tycoony/RPG, very much in the spirit of the original Dungeon Keeper. 

The Good: Really good narration, easy to play, nice fun game that can be played in spurts and easily paused if you watching over your own minions (aka kids)

The meh: a bit of a short main campaign (completed in ~15 hours) 

The Awesome: The narrator.

p.s. I got this game through the Humble Bundle free deal - I had been waiting for it to hit a sale to get the price to ~$10-15 at which I would highly recommend it.

review:
Addictive game with amusing references, a narrator breaking the 4th wall, yelling at you and insulting you because you don't do the objectives fast enough, simply don't follow them or even ignore a warning.

And you'll do this with a smile on your face, as the narrator gets bored watching you, fooling around in your dungeon and slapping your servants, instead of conquering the world.

Also you get to kill a unicorn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051686021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1495133815}
review:
Disclaimer, I got this game for free via a humblebundle sale. Having said that, it is a solid dungeon keeper clone with a fun narrator. So if that is what you are looking for, the game is what you want to get.

But except for a few game mechanic improvements, the game did not really evolve from the original Dungeon Keeper at all, which by now is 20! years old.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970643590', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1499778986}
review:
The game is a gem.
It's like Dungeon Keeper on Steroids.
With two variations of Dungeon Lords to play, and a surface world to conquer, this game really nails it.
The narration is superb and very funny and the level design is good and not boring.

Not too many levels to conquer in the main campaign, but the DLCs and skirmish play makes up for it.
If you liked Dungeon Keeper or you would like to try a Dungeon creation game, get this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252132570', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1530724969}
review:
Bueno este analisis es bueno por muchas cosas

PROS
-Un juego que es divertido con un modo campaña bastante caotico
-El multiplayer es GENIAL con tus amigos
-Hechizos y mucha variedad de tropas (Son 5 pero se pueden entrenar para convertirlos en otros)
-Un narrador GENIAL que siempre esta haciendo algo desde comerciales de los creadores hasta narrar la epica aventura
-Buen sistema de progresion en tema de dificultad
-Vive en la mazmorra y explora en la superficie <3
CONTRAS
-Un poco monotomo los mapas hacen cambiar la cosa
-Un poco caro (en una oferta lo pille gratis)

NOTA FINAL 8/10
COMPRALO SOLO ESO

author: {'steamid': '76561198036629195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1496579597}
review:
Uwielbiam serię Dungeon Keeper dlatego z entuzjazmem podszedłem do tej gry. Po tych kilkunastu godzinach moge z czystym sumieniem stwierdzić, że ta gra jest naprawdę dobra. Podobieństwo do DK ogromne co na początku trochę mnie martwiło ale już nie martwi :P

Przyjemna dla oka grafika, przypominająca (przynajmniej mi) Warcrafta 3 :) Świetny narrator i humor! Można się naprawdę pośmiać z jego tekstów :) (dajcie się pokonac w prologu to zobaczycie o czym piszę ;)) Gra nie jest zbyt wymagająca przez co można sobie ciągnąc misje tak długo jak się chce :) (przynajmniej ja tak robiłem przez co niejednokrotnie zostałem nazwany jakoś zabawnie, coś w stylu "Leniwe zło")
Dużo nawiązań do innych produkcji - czyli wspomniany humor (głównie "Gry o Tron" ale i motyw z Warhammerem był zabawny :))

Co tu dużo pisać, gierka naprawdę dobra, jako fan Dungeon Keepera polecam :) (i to pomimo faktu, że DK dalej jest wyżej na mojej prywatnej liście najlepszych gier w jakie grałem)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994828997', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1495225100}
review:
4/5 Stars
★★★★☆

Much better than the original [i]Dungeons - The Dark Lord[/i] to the point of not even being comparable.

[b]Gameplay[/b] - A nice hybrid mix between RTS top world and RTS management in the dungeon world. Everything here is reminicent of Dungeon Keeper except for the lack of first person view. 3 tiers of upgrades for units, many upgrade trees using 3 different rooms, as well as 3 different races (one requires [i]A Game of Winter[/i] DLC). Basically there's a lot of 3's.

[b]Campaign[/b] - Fun and explains much about how to play the game. Although the references start to get cringey after the dozenth time. We get it. You like LotR and Harry Potter.

[b]Music[/b] - Compliments the game perfectly to the point where you don't really notice it, which is a good thing.

[b]Controls/UI[/b] - This is honestly what makes or breaks games like this. The original Dungeons had a god awful interface which just brought the whole game down. This game does everything right. Hotkeys for buildings, everything condensed into one area of the hud. It's great.

[b]Multiplayer[/b] - Here's where they dropped the ball. No lobby system, poor quick match, requires you to search the forums or steam groups to add players in order to play anything more than 1v1 on the same gamemode and map. It's also impossible to win the Deathmatch mode unless someone goes AFK. Spells are too overpowered, and you can just make a maze around your entire base which is impossible for them to get through. Basically imagine if the original Dawn of War multiplayer sucked, and you've got Dungeons 2. If anything they went too literal with making a Dungeon Keeper remake when it comes to multiplayer.

[b]Overall[/b] - Solid game only let down by multiplayer and some minor bugs like unit animations breaking in multiplayer sometimes.

4/5 Stars
★★★★☆

author: {'steamid': '76561197970880630', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1495295357}
review:
Highly suggested, but, falls flat after a few hours. 

PLAY SKIRMISH MODE FIRST! Full unlocks, no story mode that's lackluster vs skirmish. 



Devs if you want to make this Dungeons 3 a best seller do the following: 

Add a speed option, watching at 1x is fun for a few hours, but, would love a 2x or 3x speed option. 
Increase or, better yet, remove the level cap for number of units, you're an evil underlord, it should feel like it. 
Add first person possession mode, was a fun component of Dungeon Keeper
Add a way for your minions (all of them) to require sleep, and, food, I recall having to raise chickens back in the day
Scaled down the HUD, or, give the user the option to remove elements of it/scale it down

Pros: 

Gets as close as I've seen in years to the original Dungeon Keepers from 20 years ago

Excellent sound design, graphics and fun missions/tutorials


Cons: 

Lack of units aside from a few base attack / defend types

Login with your XYZ account, no, never, I loath doing this for EA, and everyone else, remove this. 

Initial unit cap of 15 is pitiful, feels like a mobile game, and, forces you to upgrade and venture out into the world to get more evil points

HUD is HUGE, feels like it was made for a mobile game, taking up 15-20% of the screen, with, no way to minimize/remove

author: {'steamid': '76561198146300490', 'num_games_owned': 1525, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1553008618}
review: Warcraft meets Stanley parable. Really a great game with so many funny moments due to the narrator and the countless reference jokes! Gameplay is also very well done! amazing freebie from HB. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964080126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1495124312}
review:
If you want a true Dungeon Keepers style game then this probably something you will like, and the campaign mode brings back lots of good nostalgia. Definitely worth a play so i will recommend the game based on its campaign.


However the longetivity & large flaws of the game are made strongly apparent by it's Skirmish mode, which mechanically fails to function. If you want to purchase Dungeons 2 to build large dungeons and defend them for as long as you like then i DO NOT recommend Dungeons 2. The information below will explain why for those who are interested:

---
Problem #1:In skirmish mode the game encounters a game-killing problem. Most if not ALL of the Skirmish maps offer very little gold, so little gold in fact that you arent even able to complete enough research and facilities or upgrades you need to win the game or even pay your minions with. I had a map where i only had 1 Infinite gold node, and i could only mine it from one side, meaning not enough income for the game to continue.

Skirmish mode maps are designed to last longer than Campaign levels, yet offer a severely limited amount of gold far under what is required to complete the goals, meaning you cant really accomplish anything and Skirmish mode comes across as broken. Endless Mode is for people who enjoy building or just defending their dungeon, but because of the lack of gold on the map, yet again it is not possible to enjoy this mode forever.

No gold = the games cannot continue.

My message to the devs is to make all Gold money tiles provide an endless supply of gold. Only 4 minions can mine a Golden vein at a time so i do not understand why the developers made the gold amounts so limited.

Problem #2: In order to play the game in any difficulty higher than Normal, you have to have played the maps to the point that you already know where all the resources are in advance, even though shroud in this game is supposed to be an important element. This creates a huge rush early game in order to get your build down perfectly or you just fail every single game, leaving you with limited choice, and limited build options.

In short, the entire game becomes less RTS and is ALL ABOUT trail and error, killing the mood to play once you realise how poorly tuned enemy waves are.
---

Graphics: 5/10 - Medium quality models but this does mean that the games hardware demands are small, so most of you should have very little problems running the game 'graphically'. The game however seems to have optimization issues and seems to use the CPU very inefficiently, leading to a lot of framerate stuttering particularly with digging and selecting units in the dungeon. I use a AMD FX 8150 (8x 3.6ghz) so i cant understand how i could be having any CPU issues.

Sound: 6/10 - The Narrator does a great job (apart from that jab at JonTron which was not cool if it was intended to be funny) and the rest of the games sounds are fitting but not great quality.

Music: 1/10 - Sounds like cheap stock music which can barely be heard throughout the whole game. Sorry guys but i have to be honest to the reader, this was really lacking from your game.

Gameplay 6/10 - Plays similar to Dungeon Keeper 2 and it's quite fun going through campaign mode, but has huge Economy and balancing problems and clearly is missing a great deal of polish and a severe lack of skirmish maps to keep you playing after the campaign. This highly diminishe sthe value of the game.

[b]**OVERALL SCORE: 5/10**[/b]
Average game.

If the economical game-killing problems were fixed, enemy waves properly tuned and the music was given a large improvement, i would say this game is capable of a 9/10 but with the DLC's containing very tiny map additions along with the announcement of Dungeons 3, i sense Kalypso company are simply piggy-backing off of the Dungeon Keepers name, and want the cash more than want to make a deep Dungeon Keepers classic revival. 

The Ultimate Evil here is Capitalism.

Questions:
Q. Is it worth £25? (the current british sale price)
A. Considering how short the Campaign was and the polish needed in this game, no. i would buy this at £15 maximum.

Q. I love Dungeon Keepers, should i play Dungeons 2?
A. Yes if you can get this game on a deal, but do not expect to be playing this game for a long time, there's nowhere near enough longetivity and content to keep you playing long, which is a real shame. 12 hours playing casually (and very defensively) and i had finished the main story. I would estimate the average gamer would beat this game in about 8 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376203162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1494556623}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974426498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1495616469}
review:
The campaing is good. Mostly thanks to the narrator. Without the narrator it would be rather dull. Good humour and the nostalgia of dungeon keeper 2 keeps this mostly positive. 

The skirmish mode however is really boring. It takes forever to get the gold for the upgrades which are really expensive. You mostly sit around waiting for your little snots to gather enough gold. Here's how it plays out: Oouuh, I can almost afford the upgrade! > Yey, i got it! > Oh, crap... now I have to wait 10 minutes to get the next one...

Considering I got the game for free from the humble bundle, it's worth it. Wouldn't have paid 29,99€ for it though. 
If you want a devilish good story campaign, feel free to purchase it. I'd rather play DK2 though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981027175', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1495256538}
review:
I have no clue why this game got such mediocre reviews. I picked it up just for kicks during the 48 hours "for free" blitz last week and figured it'd just sit in my backlog forever. I fired it up to see how true it felt to the original Dungeon Keeper (a classic from my teenage years), and before I knew it, I was hooked.

I've played the entire single-player campaign, which is unheard of in my gaming habits. I normally only want stuff for multiplayer. This game is very well polished and the production values are incredible. You can tell the developers put their hearts and souls into the "feel" of the game.

Roughly 20 hours in, and I'm finally ready for some skirmish and multiplayer. Pretty damned unexpected from a game that was basically given away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022625471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1506969576}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197993689844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1495133457}
review:
[h1]Sehr schönes Strategiespiel mit Basisaufbau und einer guten Portion Humor.[/h1]
+ toller Sprecher mit guten Dialogen und nettem Humor mit vielen Anspielungen
+ gut gemachter, nicht überbordend komplexer Aufbau mit einigen netten Ideen und Verbesserungen für die Einheiten
+ keine störenden Bugs entdeckt
+ Kampf auf verschiedenen Ebenen (Dungeon, Außenwelt der Allianz, manchmal auch fremde Dungeons) mit unterschiedlichen Steuerungsmöglichkeiten
+ Gute Speicherfunktion mit Quick- und Autosave
o Kampagne nicht allzu lang, aber auch nicht gerade kurz und dafür, dass das Spiel nicht allzu viel kostet, absolut in Ordnung
- schade, dass man die zweite Rasse in der Kampagne nicht besonders viel zu spielen bekommt
- Steuerung im eigenen Dungeon manchmal etwas frickelig, man trifft durch den ungewöhnlichen Cursor (mit Hintergrundgeschicht, erfährt man am Anfang) nicht immer das, was man eigentlich möchte

Das Spiel hat wirklich Spaß gemacht, deshalb vergebe ich 5 von 5 imaginären Sternen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094977284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1584554081}
review:
Я не знаю почему ее все сравнивают с Данжен кипером,по этому я это делать конечно же не буду

Играл я в 1 часть и могу точно сказать что она интересней,чем 2
Да тут тоже есть свои плюсы,это шутейчкки,контроль войск,внешний мир рейды
Но тут настолько все медленно что аж становится скучно,сопляки копают медленно,добывают медленно,копают только по 1 клетке,что бы сделать 1 комнату 5х5 нужно ждать минут 5-10,а если вы еще и парралельно делате 2 комнату то все 20
что бы сделать действие нужно время,и причем очень длительное.
Впервой части все делалось как то быстро,сопляки носились по подземелью как угарелые,а если их еще и прокачать то вообще как на спидах,искатели приключений приходили туда нетупо к сердцу а реально за баблом и прокачкой,как играешь в диабло только наооборот,непонятно зачем они сделали упор в другом направлении,была же особенная игра,практический единственная в своем роде

Не рекомендую покупать,брать только по скидке и то ради сюжета и шуток (дам подсказку: делать все наоборот,что говорит рассказчик что бы получать лулзы)

author: {'steamid': '76561197975753826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1496089265}
review:
I have enjoyed this game, though I am not sure it is worth the full purchase price (I got it free from Humble Bundle).

Generally I like it, though certain aspects are clunky:

The interface isn't always the most intuitive - though that could be an issue with me being familiar with Dungeon Keeper and assuming this should be the same because it is a similar game.

The overworld parts of the game are a bit of a chore (get creatures, train creatures, send creatures to surface, creatures die - repeat), but I think it makes more sense as a mechanic than in Dungeon Keeper where you didn't leave the dungeon and helpfully the Lord of the Land came to you to be killed.

The narrator can get repetitive quickly. Especially if he feels that you aren't completing objectives quickly enough (sometimes this is because it isn't always obvious what the game wants you to do, which adds to the frustration)

I have only had one bug, where I could not click on my creatures' thumbnails to go to the other area they were in but saving and re-loading fixed it.

Generally I like it and will continue to play it and buy dungeons 3 as and when it comes out in the hopes that it will improve on the overworld aspect, which is my least favourite part (but the part I was most looking forward to).

author: {'steamid': '76561198027965746', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1812, 'last_played': 1509310618}
review:
Очень достойная замена DK. Шагнули чуть дальше и вбок от DK. С двумя мирами и несколькими подземельями шикарная задумка. Большого разнообразия в юнитах нет, но те что есть, хорошо различаются и сразу понимаешь какой для чего. Жаль, что демоны не проработаны так же хорошо.
С постройкой комнат все хорошо, планируешь, подбираешь ячейки, копаешь золото, потом восстанавливаешь камни и это имеет смысл, т.к. есть показатель эффективности комнаты. Внутри комнат небольшие постройки и их улучшения, опять же хочется довести все до совершенства и выбираешь оптимальное положение для аппарата по варке пива и цеха. Такой себе конструктор, все как любим.
В бою абилки монстров решают и даже здесь есть небольшие ветки развития.

Ключевых недостатков для меня всего два:
- Нет нужды прокачивать юнитов. Появилась арена, появился дефибриллятор - считай дело сделано. Весь процесс боя до этого был по сути и не нужен. Это рушит всю ценность своих юнитов. Как в DK ты был просто счастлив, когда у тебя даже самые убогие гоблины достигали 10-го уровня и ты с ними мог нагибать, а здесь ты берешь зеленого новичка, бросаешь в арену и за короткое время у тебя мощный монстр, который к тому же бессмертный фактически.
- Закликиваешься до посинения всеми этими улучшениями для слуг, гоблинов, троллей, хранения бочек пива, ящиков и прочей муры. На последних уровнях просто все к этому сводится. Ну нельзя же оставить что-то не прокаченным, верно? Финальный бой, надо подготовиться. Вот и сидишь "клик-клик-клик, ждешь, клик-клик-клик...".

Вот честное слово, Dungeons 2 получил бесплатно, а War for the Overworld покупал. Первое полностью пройдено, второе забросил на первой же миссии, настолько там невыразительная копипаста.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058729925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1495161471}
review:
SI lo que se busca es un juego para pasar el rato agradable varias horas y terminar una campaña divertida y algo corta, este juego es para ti. Por el contrario si esperas una trama compleja o enviciarte en gran medida en un juego, no sera este uno de ellos. Dungeons 2 es para pasar el rato agradable perdiendo el tiempo, divirtiendose sanamente y poco mas. Es recomendable en el aspecto anterior nombrado y no hay mucho que decir debido a lo simple que es el juego, ademas de gracioso por los comentarios del narrador. Me parecio que el sistema multijugador tiene algunos defectos y el juego en si mismo esta poco optimizado, cosa que no importa casi nada ya que al final de cuentas se puede pasar rapido y gozar un poco mas luego de hacerlo, pero luego de ello ya no tiene mucho sentido seguir jugando.

Gracias por el juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198026983045', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1497129408}
review:
Nach vorn oder nach hinten. Man muss sich ihrgendwann im Leben entscheiden, wohin man blicken will. Es mag zwar wohl auch die Nostalgie großer Grund dafür sein, erinnerungen an die Vergangenheit, die man kennt und schätzt... an Dungeon Keeper! Somit blicke man aber auch in die Zukunft, wenn die alten schönen Spiele nicht mehr auf unseren neuzeitlichen Rechnern funktionieren wollen und es ist manchmal auch beängstigend und oft auch enttäuschend. Aber es kann ebenso sehr aufregend und wunderbar sein - wie es mir in den ersten Stunden von Dungeons II erging!

Ich finde, dieses Spiel ist durchaus würdig sich als "Nachfolger" der Dungeon Keeper reihe zu krönen. Mit einem funktionierenden Multiplayer-Konzept, einer sehr insteressante und omg-ich-liebe-diesen-syncronsprecher Story, die einen somit nach und nach herrantastet, was eigentlich so alles möglich ist. Gelegentlich kommen Momente, an denen ich zwar altes vermisse, aber doch finde ich das Spielpinzip und die 2 (3) spielbaren Rassen sehr interessant und nahezu völlig verschieden zu spielen. Was bei ersten Blicken vielleicht an Diablo oder Warcraft erinnert, ist hier doch ein sehr stressiger und interessanter Echtzeitstrategie und Wirtschaftsimulator geworden. Wenn auch beides nicht so tiefgründig sein mag, hat man doch recht viel um die Ohren! Aber um mich kürzer zu Fassen, mache ich mal lieber eine Liste. Dinge die mich an damals erinnern oder sogar neu sind und mir gefallen, Dinge die man besser machen könnte und Dinge - die leider nicht so gut gelungen sind.

[b]=Positiv=[/b]
[list][*]Das Interface ist zwar zu beginn an ein wenig unübersichtlich (PC) aber nach ein wenig einarbeiten oder dem Tutorial (Kampagne) findet man sich schnell zurecht, sowie die Shortcuts ebenso recht angenehm platziert wurden.
[*]Auf jeden fall lohnt es sich die Kampagne zu spielen! Die Scripts des Sprechers als auch die Story sind extremst unterhaltsam und trotzdem knackig, dass es nicht zuuuu einfach ist, hehe.
[*]Optisch spricht Dungeons 2 mit dem zwar Cartoon-Mäßigem Look fast für ein Kinderspiel, doch finde ich, dass dies auch einen ganz eigenen Scharm hat. Mir gefällts!
[*]Es gibt den eigenen Dungeon, als auch die Oberwelt - in der man sich zurechtfinden muss. In der Heimat hat man die Macht über alle und jene, doch in der Oberwelt, anderen Dungeons und co. muss man strategisch, wenn auch vorsichtiger sein, was man sich da durch den Kopf gehn lässt!
[*]Mir gefällt die Balance sehr, dass man darauf achten soll, wieviele Einheiten nun in den Krieg ziehen und welche für die Produktion, Verteidigung und co. zuhause bleiben sollten. Ebenso da jene, die viel arbeiten, auch effizienter werden in ihrem Job! Sogut wie - nein eigentlich JEDE - Eineheit hat ihrgendwie immer etwas zutun. Ob es das anspornen von seinen Kumpels ist, das verprügeln von einem deiner Arbeiter oder einfach nur das "Dekorieren" deiner Dungeonwände, hehe.
[*]Viele der Einheiten funktionieren mittels eines Schere-Stein-Papier Prinzips, doch lassen sich ein paar interessante Optionen hin und her verstellen. Erforschen von Fähigkeiten oder einer Einheit eine Beförderung verpassen, kann alles seine Vor-Nachteile haben. Vielleicht gefällt die die Einheit auf der 2. Evolution besser, als nur die auf der 3. ?
[*]Lust mit Freunden zu spielen? Du kannst mit bis zu 4 Spielern eine Partie starten! Ob in Teams, FFA oder im Duell!
[/list]
[b]=Verbesserungsfähig=[/b]
[list][*]Gerne hätte ich den Sprecher auf den Multiplayer Maps auch gehört - sowie auch mehr NPC-Aktivitäten, wie diese angriffswellen etc., die leider im Multiplayer didaktisch reduziert wurden.
[*]Wünschenswert wäre auch eine KI oder eine COOP Version, um mit Freunden eben im Mehrspieler oder besagten Coop Missionen gemeinsam Spaß zu haben.
[*]Die Hand ist... wui! Die Hand des 'ultimativen Bösen' ist ja quasi die Maus/Cursor von uns - der Spielerinnen und Spieler. Leider ist das Greifen oder anklicken damit, gelegentlich eine qual, da diese ihrgendwie gefühlt mehr mittig, anstatt dem Zeigefinger greift/klickt.
[*]Auf der Oberwelt ist die Weltveränderung wunderbar mitzuerleben, wenn man Gebiete nach und nach einnimmt. Jedoch ist es auch sehr irritierend, dass die Nebel und Inszinierung der Lichter merkwürdig verhällt, wenn man zwischen gut/bösem Territorien hin und her wandert.
[/list]
[b]=Nicht so gelungen=[/b]
[list][*]Was schnell in einem Chaos versinken kann, ist die Steuerrung der Einheiten auf der Oberwelt. Entweder fehlt mir da die Übung, oder mir fehlen da ein paar Tipps und Tricks, um angenehmer meine Truppe zu bewegen, ohne mich umständlich hin und her zu klicken. ((Hab aber auch noch nicht getestet, ob Gruppenselektierungen existieren im Sinne von Makro-Gruppen))
[*]Man kann in Multiplayer-Matches oftmals schon die Feinde erkennen, trotz Nebel des krieges, sollten diese ihren Dungeon verlassen und ausziehen. Das ist zwar ein wenig Metagaming, doch hätte man das bestimmt verhindern können. Sind zwar nur ggf. Schatten oder Partikeleffekte, aber man kann daraus herleiten, um was es sich handelt!
[*]Das Endgame im Multiplayer ist deutlich nicht dafür ausgelegt, dass man gegnerische Dungeons raiden kann bzw. überhaupt eine Chance darin hat. Die Untoten können noch nicht einmal Fallen entschärfen/abstellen?!
[*]Zauber im Mehrspielermodus sind unbalanced, da sie anscheinend keine wirkliche Cooldown besitzen und in diversen Fällen sehr mächtig sein können. Die DLC Rasse der Untoten ist deutlich im Vorteil, da sie stehts mit ihrem Eiszauber eine ganze Armee einfrieren kann, während die Einheiten gemütlich jene niederschnätzeln. Leider ist hierbei aber auch ein Bug mir aufgefallen: Die eingefrohrenen Einheiten bleiben auch nach ihrem Tod (beim Wiederbeleben im Dungeon) in diesem Nahezu-Eingefroren Status. Was dazu führt, dass diese für ewig unter dieser Verlangsamerung leiden. Dass, als auch der fehlende Widerstand/Immunität gegenüber Stunns ist schade.
[*]In der Verteidigung sind die Monster nicht immer so helle. Oder die Menschlichen Gegner doch manchmal sehr extrem. Wenn eine Meute von Zauberern eine Fure Kettenblitze in deinen Tunnel jagd, überleben es vielleicht deine Dicken riesen, doch jene, die stark gegen diese Zauberer wären, wurden schon lange gegrillt. Meist sind dies nicht so stabiele Fernkämpfer.
[*]Ein Paar der Zauber scheinen nicht richtig zu funktionieren (zBsp. Schild und Feuerball bei den Dämonen), doch bin ich mir nicht sicher, ob ich selbst versage oder es ein Fehler des Spiels ist.
[/list]
Gut, soviel dazu! Wie einfach es doch währe, könnte man doch jedes Spiel einfach so neu erleben, ohne immer an die Vergangenheit oder durch die Furcht vor schrecklichen Veränderungen sich vorab beeinflussen zu lassen... Ich habe mir Dungeons II bereits vorher angesehn, war mir aber stehts unsicher dieses Spiel zu kaufen. Als es schliesslich im HumbleBundle in der Aktion war, tratt es mir erneut unter die Augen und ich ergriff die Chance. Diese großmütigkeit weiß ich sehr zu schätzen und ich finde, dass dieses Spiel definitiv das Gelt wert ist! Zumindest den Rassen-DLC habe ich mir vor zu besorgen, hehe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997584767', 'num_games_owned': 1017, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1495047392}
review: It's like Dungeon Keeper without the FPS but with a simple RTS layer when you invade the world on top of your dungeon. The main campaign is very easy, but also fun to play. The droll narration contains a bit too many references to various fantasy books and films but is still entertaining overall. The UI is somewhat annoying; clicking on the right things can be hard sometimes because the cursor is too big and it registers clicks not fast enough. I'm keeping my eye out on what this studio is going to do with Dungeons 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284618306', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1495337474}
review:
很好玩的游戏，本来只准备加一，结果发现好好玩，几天连续玩，一直到通关，游戏算是个大杂烩吧，TD、RTS、模拟经营都融合在里面了，地上地下的地图界面很有趣，之前没有玩过牛蛙的地牢守卫者1，所以感觉很新颖。战役和魔兽有点类似，也很喜欢。游戏没有中文，英语渣玩着累一点但是还是可以玩的，剧情也可以大致了解。
缺点就是研究实在是太慢了，这个游戏有多人模式，现在应该没人了，但是如果真的多人玩，让大家都等这个研究，可能会疯。
优点的话，多个种族的斗争，虽然只能操控两个种族，但还是比较有趣的。你的手下要拿工资，要解闷，要吃的，跟模拟经营一样，但是总感觉他们萌萌哒。旁白很有趣，这个游戏最开始给我好映像的就是旁白，旁白的吐槽很有趣，而且不只一次的吐槽，多吐槽几次后旁白会爆炸XD
现在准备去玩玩地牢守卫者，然后期待第三部~

author: {'steamid': '76561197969527004', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1611736888}
review:
People who think Dungeon Keeper is better than this game are looking through rose-coloured nostalgia glasses. I should know - I was one of them until I picked this up for free in that recent Humble Bundle giveaway. 

Dungeons 2 is everything those older games were, and more. I'm thoroughly enjoying the humour and the dungeon management, and I was pleasantly surprised by the above-world RTS-like gameplay that I wasn't expecting. It's very pretty, too.

In all, this is a fun, relaxing and really well done game. I'm actually looking forward to #3 now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972214947', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1497261829}
review:
Recommended for the fact that there aren't many Dungeon keeper styled games. out there. 


So... where to start..

I wanted to Love this game.. I wanted a game that built upon and improved Dungeon Keeper 2. 

I finished it in under 16 hours and don't see myself playing it again. 

In no particular order of thought about the game. 

* MEMES and references. Mostly the Narrator... if I could turn him off. I would have.  Excessive references to Game of thrones... also Insults by the narrator to HURRY UP AND FINISH THE LEVEL. 

* Minions Count against your Population.. So you have to decide between a strong workforce or strong broke army.. or half and half in a way.. 

* Population cap = Feels like a crutch to slow/stop the player from fielding a Huge army. 

* Feeding/Keeping minions happy = Once beer was setup.. ignored it for rest of the level.. 

* Base = Stripmine to find gold spots.. ( You can easily scan the locations of gold buy click dragging large areas that minions can't mine. just look for the slightly jagged areas and you can spot where gold is. )

* Base Defence = Setup 6 to 10 explosive chests in a 3 wide tunnel and it takes care of all attacks against your dungeon. 

* Narrator. Sounds Exactly like the Stanley parable narrator.. so just felt as a joke.. and not as a dark moody game.  also before I found the Option to minimize the talk of the narrator. I Alt + F4'd the game due to the amount of insults. 

* Game is a "Slow" quick game... Slow as in it takes a while to get the basics up... Quick as in once you do. you don't really have to worry about much. 

* You can ONLY view minion stats while they are on the surface.. trying to select them while in the dungeon only picks them up. 

* Once you get a working Hospital up... your minions are IMMORTAL. 

* I finished the final level.. with 13 units.. and it was easy to cheese.  

I could go on... but..


Dungeons 2 feels like a forced comedic take of the dungeon. Lacking a dungeon atmosphere. 


Tips for late game.

* when you start the level with 500 gold... spend it to buy 5 minions to get your base going.

* Setup a Small Treasury about the place that you are mining gold.  Build Treasury's EVERYWHERE that your minions are mining gold. or they'll spend most of their time SLOWLY walking to store gold.. even if the treasury if just a few cells. it will save you HEAPS of time.

* Setup a 4x4 Brewery in a spot where you can easily expand it.
* Setup a 4x4 Workshop to research Traps (explosive chest trap)
* Buy a goblin and an Orc. 
* Keep mining for Gold... the Minable gold spots actually give less each time, but more gold over a long time. Mine the walls that contain gold and you'll get more. 
* Build the mana place and buy one naga.. work on expanding Population

Continue this

when you start the Second population expansion and get it... have about 10 minions. 2 Goblins for only making traps and research.. 4 Naga, 4 Orcs...

Take a force of the 4 naga and 4 orc. (let the orcs tank) and complete an objective and come back to heal.. 

Keep your minions alive early game.. go out and murder enough to clean up the areas.. come back and heal. .then go finish an objective.  You don't have to worry about being surprised by a large force... the Game Tells you every time the computer sends a force to attack your base... 

HINT!!!!

If you setup a force that you only use for going out.. Select them all while they are on the Surface ( won't work in the dungeon)  Hit Ctrl + 1  (game doesn't tell you this). this will set the group. Now while your minions are in the dungeon all rested... move to the surface map.. hit 1 to select the units and right click on the grass outside... the minions selected will walk out of your base. so you don't have to worry about tracking down your fighting units. 



Final Quote.

- "Micro-piglets stalk your dungeon - beware."

author: {'steamid': '76561198041509028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1500870045}
review:
I played dungeon keeper 1 & 2 when those were fresh, and picked up War for the Overworld as soon as it came out.  However, somehow this game slipped my radar.  

I was reticent to write a review until I had a few hours into it, but I turned it on today and for five hours could not stop.  It's got every feature you would've enjoyed from a Dungeon Keeper game but manages to infuse an ADDITIONAL RTS element to it via the change in how your minions work on the overworld.  Not only are there optimizations for room size, but the rooms, themselves, are upgradeable via research.  Each minion you have can not only be trained individually to a higher level, but can be completely upgraded to another unique creature via a -different- kind of training:  Nagas become queens, which channel heals that are not only automatic within the dungeon but can be manually controlled in addition during the overworld RTS mode.  Goblins become assassins with the ability to stealth and backstab.  You can even continue to upgrade them, RTS style, with a forge that grants individual evolutions such as the ability to have trolls regenerate or improves the critical strike chance of your goblins.  And there are areas in the campaign where specialized units are absolutely fantastic- Goblin assassins completely disable traps in an area, so that the bulk of your cadre can bypass a trap that would otherwise leave most of them on the ground.

The community via multiplayer isn't robust, but the game was released in 2015.  The fact that it was free last week may shuffle that a bit.  But if you enjoy campaign and skirmish missions with a mashup of dungeon keeper and starcraft-style RTS gameplay, and a narrator who memes about World of Warcraft, Lord of the Rings, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Supernatural, this is the game for you.  In my experience, it ticks all the boxes, and has made me laugh at least once a hour for the five hours that I played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998362614', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3124, 'last_played': 1495335656}
review:
TL;DR - Polished game.  Fun while you are learning to play it.  Menus and cursor icon could use some work.  Single player skirmishes get old after about 20 hours.  Limited number of maps.   Needs more units and different variety of styles for how to play, which it is lacking.

-----------------------------------------------------

This is a nice game.  For what it is, I believe this game is well constructed.  It was developed to closely resemble the old Dungeon Keeper games.

But after 20 hours, it gets old.  There are only two factions to play (Horde and Demon).  Each of those have a very limited number of troops (4 basic units for each).  Both of the factions play very similar as well.

Dungeons 3 has been announced.  I hope they add more to the game.  I would love to see additions which would deliver more variety.  Below is what I would love to see, which would make this into an outstanding game.

1.) Stop trying to clone Dungeon Keeper and instead, improve it.
by....
2.) Procedurally generated dungeons over static maps.
3.) More factions. Playing the good guys even.
4.) More units, more variety.
5.) Outside units attack dungeon rooms (your units repair).
6.) Your guard units require stock while stationed. (food/drink)
7.) Food! Farming, slaughtering of chickens!
8.) More room types please.
9.) Ability to change game speed.

These are just a few things which I feel they could add which would be beneficial to the game.  I have done a few playthroughs currently, and aside from adjusting the difficulty and surviving, there really is not much more to do and discover in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144475097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1521199804}
review:
NOTE: I've recieved the main game Free from humbleBundle but the DLC were bought seperately. (except for the Pumpkin one) 

ONE OF THE MOST AMAZING GAMES I'VE PLAYED SO FAR!
Very well executed Dungeon manager with an RTS side to make it dynamic and letting you feel as if you're in complete control of a true evil spirit's army.
The skirmish maps are as fun as the campaign with some exclusive challenges, quests and even boss fights, specially in the DLCs.
All the DLCs are amazing as well, well worth the $$$. Multiple hours of fun gameplay and numerous quests and managing to do. To top it all you get a whole new faction with the "A game of winter" DLC which, in my opinion, is the best faction so far. 
Its amazing humor and references to Game of Thrones, Lord of the rings and the Warcraft series are the cherry on top of the cake. I've found myself laughing out loud at the constant sattires the narrator makes

Graphics AND Art style: 9.5/10
Sound AND Music: 9/10
Story, Lore and Worldbuilding: 10/10
Gameplay and Replayability value: 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010735249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1630634432}
review: Every minute you play, you're just reminded that its not Dungeon Keeper. And although thats a disappointment, the game in itself is not a bad offering. Sure, you keep dungeons but thats only a part of the gameplay. For most of the campaign you'll be juggling for the perfect balance of your topside warefare and of course, your dungeon's defense. This insanity is where Dungeons 2 shines brightest, but in all other regards comes off as a mediocre title. Its not a great RTS, or a great Dungeon Keeper game, just kinda meh at both. Its a good game, but don't expect anything genre defining, or something to quench your wish for a new Dungeon Keeper successor, for you will find none here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097837480', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1494980270}
review:
Me llegó un mensaje de que había un juego gratis en una página, me dirigí a esta y lo canjee. Decidí -junto a otros tres amigos- instalarlo y ver que tal, grande sorpresa tuve al notar un juego contundente que te agarra y no te suelta más.

[h1]Modo un Jugador[/h1]
Quizás el más tedioso, con una historia bastante llamativa y un narrador elocuaz además de muy irónico. Te atrapa en una contienda entre el mal y el bien, donde tiene que triunfar el mal.

[h1]Modo un multijugador[/h1]
Quizás el más entretenido, existe la posibilidad de jugar un 1vs1 junto a algún amigo, también un 1vs1vs1 y (obviamente) un 1vs1vs1vs1. El máximo de jugadores que pueden jugar en una partida son cuatro, y dentro de la misma se puede seleccionar el mapa en el cual se quiere jugar (la cantidad de jugadores depende del mapa) y el modo de juego que se quiere jugar en el mismo.


8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 1588, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1494957478}
review:
Toller Humor ! Zum Beispiel, wenn man zu lange brauch um eine Aktion durchzuführen, sagt der Sprecher in der Kampagne : "Dungeons für Dummies" (Tutorial Einweisungen), oder das lahme Böse usw. Klasse, in jedem Level coole Sprüche. Klar nicht jeder mag sowas. Auch der Anfang ist wunderbar, man wird nach und nach schön eingewiesen. Grafik ist auch super und stimmig. 

Multiplayer Erfahrugnen habe ich jetzt keine gemacht. Aber man kann bei Dungeon 2 etliche Stunden verbringen. 30€ sind vielleicht etwas viel, aber im Angebot aufjedenfall ein Blick wert. Ich habe es bei Humble Bundle kostenlos bekommen und bin froh es kennen gelernt zu haben, da ich es eigentlich auf der "Nicht interessiert" Liste hatte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039688046', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1505932674}
review:
Well from what i saw and heard about dungeon keeper, this game follows it's structure to a T, and it is just the brand of RTS gameplay i was in the mood for, with a very strong element of base building and a slower pace. 
A very relaxing single player campaign that will educate you very well about all the mechanics that are involved in the game, a charming narrator (of  "The Stanley Parable" fame) and the visuals, are A ok, the most impressive effects are when you conquer a territory, and the entire landscape changes dramatically to reflect how evil it's all become. Plus the hand icon has impressive light and shadow effects inside the dungeon.

Heartily recommended for the campaign and the multiplayer is certainly there, and given the amount of systems involved, could prove for a very strong competitive game. Just, dont expect any major tournaments to prop up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1494951954}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Dungeons 2 is a game developed by Realmforge Studios and published by Kalypso Media Digital and is the official sequel to DUNGEONS

First off, Dungeons 2 is definitely not Dungeon Keeper. With that out off the way, this game is good in it's own right

The first couple levels are basically tutorials and are slow, but if you get past the first couple it does become more challenging. When I first bought this game I had the idea that it would play similar to the Dungeon Keeper games

Your objective is to give the heroes that enter your dungeon everything they want filling their soul meters, then destroy them before they get a chance to leave your dungeon. Using their souls to buy "gimmicks" that you use to fill your dungeon leading the heroes throughout it, and making you more powerful

There is a balance you need to strike to get the heroes happy without having your creatures accidently slay them to soon, and losing soul energy in the process, as yourself the "Dungeon Lord" gets more soul energy from killing the heroes personally

I find trying to build my dungeon in such a way to completly fill the heroes soul bars and leading them to my dungeon heart, where I await them, to be challenging but rewarding

Dungeons 2 is again a mixed bag but I thoroughly enjoyed playing it. Just give it a chance it may surprise you, like it did for me, but don't expect the next Dungeon Keeper

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039582547', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1535218975}
review:
Lorsque j'y ai joué, j'ai trouvé ce jeu vraiment prometteur. Je ne me suis pas aventuré plus loin dans le jeu mais il me plaisait déjà. C'est un genre de Craft the World, en 3D, à la Age Of Empires (ou autre jeux de ce type). L'humour du narrateur dans le mode campagne est vraiment sympatique, cela m'a fait sourrir pas mal de fois, tout en faisant des références (exemple d'une référence dans le jeu : Le Seigneur Des Anneaux). Le type stratégique du jeu change des jeux de stratégie standard : Je trouve que Dungeons 2 a son style de jeu unique (c'est le seul jeu auquel j'ai pu jouer de cette manière), et mérite un bon nombre d'avis positifs.Et le jeu vaut bien son prix.
Ma conclusion : jeu à essayer imprérativement !

author: {'steamid': '76561197983645799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2205, 'last_played': 1494950200}
review:
This game is great. Single player was a lot of fun and I bought the undead DLC because they seemed like fun. Overall the game ran really smooth and was a blast in single player.  Loved the narrator. the RTS/dungeon hybrid play was awesome and I'm looking forward to Dungeons 3.

Would I recommend this? For the single player experience, definitely.

Where does the game fall flat? Multiplayer. The Quick Game feature usually bugs out, and when you do get a game the other player usually quits or drops after 2 minutes. Then you have the games that do go on, where you spend 30 minutes building your base then the other player quits. I played 1 game where I lost, 1 game where the other player never left their dungeon, and about 20 partial games where the other guy leaves at some point. Almost universally before anything actually happens. I tried to find a discord, reddit, or game groups SOMEWHERE but they just do not exist. Googling Dungeons 2 and permutations of gaming groups results in nothing or for different games entirely. There is no lobby system, which severely hurts this title. You can have up to 4 players in a game, but you have to invite them all. Good luck finding anyone to actually play with no subreddit, discord, teamspeak, or gaming groups of any kind. And it's not like you can make friends during matches and invite them later. Most the time matches just don't happen. Overall, a great game with an abysmal and dissapointing multiplayer side.

If they fixed these issues for Dungeons 3 and give multiplayer a lobby system I'll instantly buy it. If they attempt to do this quick match thing again I will not buy Dungeons 3. It's that simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015148367', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1495048397}
review:
Eine Nudel ist ein ... also ein Ganztag. Man kann im Winter, Sommer, man kann morgens abends sie essen, ein Nudel ist ein wirklich ein sehr leckeres Gericht.
 Man kann Nudeln machen warm, man kann Nudeln machen kalt. Also man kann in der Lurlaub, man kann in den Picknick machen, man kann abends morgens essen, wie man gerade hunger hat. Dawegen spielts keine Tageszeit, keine Sonnenzeit, kein Winter oder so. Die Italiener essen es auch jeden Tag!!! Also ist eine Nudel ein ...ein...ein... ewiges Essen. Egal, aus was es die Nudel gemacht ist, egal wie du Nudel zubereitet wird, jeder hat sein' Geschmack. Einer ist gerade morgens aufgestanden, iss äääh der isst... äääääääh, gerne Nudeln,DER MACHT SICH AUCH MORGENS NUDELN !!!. Kein bisschen. 
Dawegen lass ich auf Nudeln nix' kommen. Humor muss sein. Dafür ist ja die humorvolle, italienisch Nudeln. Der hat ja auch Humor, der Italiener. Eine Nudel kräftigt. Eine Nudel kräftigt nicht nur, die hat Energie trägt sie, auch sichtig  dann wichtig ist , wenn man die gegessen hat hat man auch Freude an den ganzen Tag, umso schneller ist man. Oder, umso mehr baut man seine Kraft und seine Freude auf. Das ist das Wichtige! Haha! 
Fazit :
Die Nudel schmeckt, dadrauf kommts an

author: {'steamid': '76561198142753139', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1501523641}
review:
*****
В тёмном и глубоком подземелье... сквозь трещины в стенах слышны какие-то отдаленные удары молотов и вот раздался крик Орка:"Архгыргагагах!" что означало на человеческий "Логово зачищено, могучее Зло!"(да, именно ВЫ и играете за злую сторону, неожиданно?).... И вот стена разламывается от кирки растяпы и нашему взору препадает увидеть то самое поле битвы, где лежат тела пауков и... ЛЮДЕЙ?

Так и начинается наше путешествие на поверхность!

*****

Игра мне очень понравилась!

Есть своя доля изюминки, играть за тёмную сторону, творить коварные делишки попутно расставляя ловушки против навных искателей приключений.
Постепенно расширяешь своё подземелье, открываешь многие технологии, чем-то напоминает Warcraft 3 на современный лад.
С оптимизацией всё неплохо, ничего не вылетает.
Порадовала русифицированная озвучка игры, чего только стоят комментарии рассказчика в Компании (с юмором и понятно всё).

РЕКОМЕНДУЮ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098607985', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1494656855}
review:
Early Review 

I got the game for free,
It like warcraft 3 and dungeon keeper and black and white.
The mix feel quite poor with a interface and control hard to understand
i was hoping good strategy rts but it more slow puzzle.

Seriously i really don't like the interface.
Some option are hided in some buiding zone and the narrator keep nag me 
as i try figure out were to click.
You don't seem been able select all unit and they understand poorly where to move.
I got take them throw one by one to move correctly. (seriously)
Moving to each map was awful. (overworld and many underground)

The gameplay seem kinda really basic don't seem offer much. (still early to be sure)
I wish the equipment, unit and trap was better and not a complex annoying micromanagement.
I want a big army not a metal gear mini squad. i don't like small limit)

The narrator seem really nice but you try figure stuff it quite annoying. 
Give me more info where and how i do it.
The rest was meh and i feel soo noob.

Feel free to add comment

author: {'steamid': '76561197999029022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 27229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2509, 'last_played': 1569348035}
review:
A slow-paced resource management game. I always enjoyed playing the turtle in RTS games, and Dungeons 2 is basically that.

Step 1: Max out your teir one tech and units
Step 2: Attack some enemy bases to unlock teir 2
Step 3: Back into the shell with your reward of teir 2 stuff
Step 4: Re-arrange your base to make better use of your space for the new teir toys
Repeat for teir 3

Way faster and less complicated than Sid's Civs, for better and worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076566904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1602448152}
review:
Do you like fantasy?
Are you sick & tired of hero clichés? 
Do you want to make your evil dungeon with either demons, undead or the good old orcs&goblins ? 
Want a funny narrator that doesnt care about making mistakes & that "reminds" you of TV series, games and movies that you love?

Well then my evil brother, this game is for you. 

My only complain about this game... is how spells are pretty much useless with the exeption of 3 or 4, but that doesnt matter, im evil, if i want spells, ill have my minions cast them for me. 

I realy hate when my minions get their pay.... this only makes me a better ultimate evil :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999622891', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1494885657}
review:
The gameplay is a perfectly servicable Dungeon Keeper 2 riff with RTS elements spot welded on. I appreciated the experiment of that sort of pitch, if nothing else. The only major gameplay complaint I encountered was that the pacing of mechanics and play was somewhat plodding.

However, the main campaign's ""jokes"" are so atrocious I could not bring myself to complete it. They stunt casted the narrator from the Stanley Parable and gave him a script that half-asses its narration gimmicks at the same time that it quarter-asses Dungeon Keeper's dry, sardonic take on being the bad guy. It is *relentless* in its attempts to make sure you get a joke, even - especially - when it isn't funny. The early levels are a torrent of awkwardly written "meta jokes" every time you do basically anything, making no less than three jokes about event flags and level scripts in the first two levels. It constantly, unpromptedly brings up how lazy its own writing and scenarios are but expects that saying that it's doing the thing makes it funny. 

It makes a joke where the narrator says "Insert funny line here" then goes on an annoyed aside about the unprofessionality of the writers. I was so deeply tempted to just uninstall the game right there, but I kept going until I hit a mission written in 2015 that was nothing but an extended series of the laziest Occupy Wall Street jokes imaginable - the title was even just named "Occupy Wall Street". Stadium beer has more punch than the writing in this game, and it's less likely to give you a headache.

If you look up a few videos of early stuff and aren't bothered by the narration, then give the game a shot if it goes on deep sale. It ain't that bad, aside from the slow, slow pacing. But if it grates on you even a little bit, stay the hell away, because it only gets worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002181744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1494882200}
review:
This review is only about the single player component, whose main campaign I have just finished.

This game was a joy to play. I got it from a previous Humble Bundle if I remember correctly, but I hadn't gotten around to it until I heard many people praising it after the recent giveaway took place.

It takes a humorous approach at creating a universe bashed together from many popular series, and it prides itself on what it is: a modern, chilled-out Dungeon Keeper clone using updated Warcraft 3-like graphics. You're as evil as evil can be, and anyone out there who disagrees (or dares to oppose you) must be crushed to a pulp. In the underworld, you order your minions around generally, deciding what needs to be mined and what should be built, and slapping, er, motivating your minions. In the overworld, you control your units RTS-style to take out enemy spawning points that periodically attack you as well as other mission-specific objectives. There's a few tower defense elements thrown in as well, but I never found a situation where they truly mattered.

It has a fairly low difficulty curve, but I honestly didn't mind it. I played along, sometimes outright wasting time, just to get all I could out of the beloved narrator from The Stanley Parable. He's half the game, in a good way.

My disappointments with the game revolve around two things: 
- lack of micro; while there are a few unit specials, it's pretty much about blobbing your enemy to dust.
- weak animations; many of the units feel like they could've had much more polished animations. It broke my immersion as, admiring the graphic style, I was fantasizing about the likely never-to-be sequel to Warcraft 3.

All in all, I'd give it a 7. A good little game worth trying and relaxing with, likely one you'll remember along with the likes of Overlord and such, but not really ground-breaking.

review:
The game is extremly slow paced for no good reason. I had to play a 4 hour game to finish one map and the final tier is underwhelming as hell. There is nothing to gain from exploring the overworld. Nothing you can't get in the underworld. There is no strategy to follow in this game, you just have to zerg. 

The most underwhelming thing for me was that you couldn't even resurect the Ultimate Evil outside your dungeon. What the f*ck are you going to do with it INSIDE your dungeon? Anyway it is a mudane game, that's why they gave it for free.

Good conept bad execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091558494', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1497425195}
review:
Это шедевральная игра! Здесь есть все!
1) Пиво 
2) Орки которые постоянно потребляют пиво
3) Наги которые потребляют пиво
4) Тролли которые потребляют пиво
5) Гоблины которые потребляют пиво (тут не уверен так как не видел как они это делают)
6) Рабы которые... как вы думаете? Тоже потребляют пиво!
Короче говоря сдесь все держится на пиве (Ну и на золоте)
Кроме пива тут присутствует: Прокачка юнитов (а еще что-то типо эволюции), Мана и заклинания, различные изучения, Мультиплеер, неплохая кампания, мультиплеер (из-за того что игра не сильно популярная сложно найти противника).
Кроме того тут присутствует ЮМОР!
Замечательная игра чтобы порубиться с друзьями!
Спасибо Humble Bundle за эту игру!

Сейчас я ищу несколько игроков дабы порубиться 2 на 2 и я надеюсь прочитав этот коментарий кто-то да найдется)
Надеюсь вам понравился мой обзор и вы купите эту игру (если этого еще не сделали).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008318653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1494869076}
review:
Une agréable surprise.

J'ai eu le jeu gratuitement ; ce sont en général ces jeux auquels je n'accorde même pas une vraie chance. Celui-ci n'en a pas eu besoin, il m'a cueilli. On est accroché par l'univers et la narration, on reste pour le gameplay.
Si la campagne principale ne pose que peu de difficultés, certaines cartes en escarmouche demandent de bien macro et micro ; alors qu'une macro de base suffit à finir le jeu. Il y a des petites subtilités absentes du didacticiel (combinaisons en MAJ/CTRL) et des choses à découvrir soi-même (comment ""micro"" quand on est dans son propre donjon).
Un peu dommage de voir que l'aspect "défense de donjon" (pièges, labyrinthes) semble tout à fait négligé, voire inutile, en tout cas en solo. N'ayant pas lancé une partie multijoueur, la défense par installation (et pas simplement par la même armée qui écrase les camps à la surface) est peut-être plus pertinente face à un vrai joueur.

Une belle durée de vie, un jeu chronophage après tout : malgré cette richesse, on a quand même envie de se pencher sur les DLC. J'ai donc attaqué le DLC Halloween (aussi obtenu gratuitement).
Un peu déçu de voir que ce DLC ne propose que des cartes escarmouche et pas de narration. La narration de la campagne principale, quoiqu'un peu lourde de prime abord, permet de remplir ces phases de jeu vide qu'on remarque en escarmouche. Après, je ne suis pas un expert en STR qui fait quinze choses à la fois, hein.

Pour ce bon jeu, je pense qu'il serait raisonnable d'acheter un DLC s'il proposait une mini-campagne avec de la narration ; en tout cas ce n'est pas le cas du DLC Halloween (assez mauvais d'ailleurs, passez votre chemin).

author: {'steamid': '76561198050785245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1495910351}
review:
Dungeons 2

[h1]Inhalt:[/h1]

Für mich ein guter Dungeon Keeper Klon mit kleinen Macken, aber einem tollen Gameplay. 

Die Story dreht sich rund um das ultimative Böse, dies seid Ihr selber, und dem damit verbundenen Kampf zwischen der Horde und der Allianz. Eure Aufgabe ist es ein Dungeon aufzubauen und von dort aus die Allianz mit Orks und Nagas und anderen teuflischen Diener die Allianz immer weiter zu schwächen bis Ihr in der Hauptstadt Königsschlund ankommt. 

Wer hier bereits die ein oder andere Anlehnung an Serien oder Spiele entdeckt, der hat auch ein Kernelement des Spiels erkannt. Den Humor. Dieser wird durch den Erzähler in bester leichter Satire und einer Prise Schwarzen Humors erzählt.

Schnell erlernt man die Basics des Spiels und baut seinen ersten Dungeon. Von da an kommen immer weitere Mechaniken dazu. Hier will ich nicht zu viel verraten, da es leider nicht so viel zu entdecken gibt.


[h1]Fazit:[/h1]

Die Technik ist gut umgesetzt. Der Grafikstil gefällt mir persönlich und der Humor trift bei mir ins Schwarze.

Für mich gibt es eigentlich nur 1 Punkt, welche mir nicht gefällt.


1. Die Spieltiefe ist nicht gegeben. Man hat es schnell gelernt und schnell wiederholt sich alles.


Alles im allen ist es ein sehr Solides Spiel mit viel charm und nur einer leichten Schwäche.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966643420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1494819769}
review:
Imagine this, you get a free game off of humble bundle that is reminiscent of the games you played as a kid. So you get a copy for yourself and your spouse. Mother's day rolls around, the kid is down for a nap, and you get that "Down to play" look that could possibly end in a fat ZJ. Boot the game up and find out it's only competetive or playing with randoms online. Well at least there's pizza, beer, and giving myself a stranger. 

Even though this game was free on Humbebundle, I cannot recommend it simply do to the lack of a coop vs ai mode. I did some reading and the devs said back in 2015 that they were going to implement it in a dlc pack based on public interest. 2017 and it's still not in the game and they've already announced a 3rd installment. Not only is there no coop vs ai but there's also no ai in multiplayer, period. As a free game I'm not bitter but if I had forked out the $30 retail price I'd be pretty sour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010632008', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1494862042}
review:
The game is alright, when you ignore how much of a chore everything seems to feel.

But the fun is also over shadowed by the fact that nothing is ever explained to you properly.
The narrations are funny and informative yes, but they aren't explaining quite a few things things that the game just expects you to realize them on your own, which gets very frustarting.

A good early example of such frustration happened on the second mission - the first time you get to control the "hand".
The game right away asks you to create one of those slave creatures for 100 gold, and gladly explains to you multiply times how to summon said unit from the only structure currently there.

Only problem is that a few moments before, i noticed a gold patch in that throne room, and couldn't resist clicking it as these were my very first few minutes playing the game.I clicked on the gold,the hand holds the gold.. and im unable to do anything with it so i dropped it on the floor.
I then return to my original task, to summon the slave unit. But wait, i suddenly don't have the gold to summon him, and the narrator is constantly repeating that i need to summon said unit, angerly.
I then notice that i lack the gold to summon anything, which is weird because i see the gold right there on the floor.
I tried picking up the gold and placing it into the pit. Didn't work.
Tried played around with it in the room, placing it in different spots on the floor. Nothing happend.
After 15 minutes or so of being stuck literally on the first task of the game, i resorted to google, there i saw multiply people complaining about the same lack of information and also being stuck, and explaining that i needed to return the gold to the exact spot where i took it from, as it wasn't random but actually some sort of "Mini" treasury spot.

Like seriously?

author: {'steamid': '76561197977352818', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1494853753}
review:
I'm glad I got this for free because wow what a slow and frustrating game.
It takes elements of Warcraft 3 and Dungeon Keeper and completely fails at doing either well.
Gold trickles in ultra slowly with your extremely limited crew of imps who slowly chip away at walls, never improving or getting faster. They're worse at doing tasks than the builders in Tropico 3. Some things just get completely ignored.
This creates a knockon effect for the rest of the game as progress pivots on gold. As soon as you have some, it is payday

author: {'steamid': '76561198316493000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1494806832}
review:
Resumiendo, un juego que podría haber sido mucho más ya que presenta una combinación de dos géneros y se queda corto en los dos. Tenemos que crear una mazmorra excavando túneles y creando trampas para que nuestros adversarios (IA de la que más tarde hablaré) no puedan acceder a nuestro trono. También deberemos ir conquistando zonas de la superficie para ganar “Maldad” e ir subiendo de nivel nuestra mazmorra. Hablando de la IA tengo que decir que es ridícula, ya que hay tropas muy lerdas y mueren con todas las trampas, y otras a las que nuestras trampas ignoran y no se activan (por ejemplo una especie de ingenieros que pueden desactivarlas pero se quedan en un bucle desactivando las de delante y vuelven a desactivar las que dejaron atrás para volver una y otra vez a las mismas y no avanzan por nuestra mazmorra)… Algo ridículo ya que entonces para qué pongo las trampas… Hablando de las trampas son escasas, no hay variedad y al final la mazmorra es repetitiva y parca en originalidad. El diseño de los personajes y del juego me recuerda al ¡Gran Startopia! y el diseño de la superficie al LOL.
En definitiva he jugado 20 horas (Las partidas son muy largas si eres un perfeccionista decorando y mejorando la mazmorra XD) y tengo que decir que mientras estas obteniendo recursos y construyendo la mazmorra disfrutas, pero en cuanto al combate en sí es aburridísimo por culpa de la IA y el mal manejo de nuestras tropas. 

Lo Bueno:
-La construcción de tu mazmorra.
-Diseño de personajes.

Lo Malo:
-Claramente la IA es ridículamente estúpida y no supone un desafío.
-La conquista de la superficie es muy aburrida.
-Los combates son aburridos.
-Escasez de trampas.

Nota 5,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380713384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1608432682}
review: 游戏拥有多种地域元素的怪物，不错的故事题材，以及顶着20年前牛蛙工作室《地下城守护者》头衔，游戏和以前模式基本一样，专门坑杀勇者，然而和前作有所区别的是没有下功夫的操作模式、话痨一般的新手教程、拥有相像的两阵营，如果你是前作玩家，不介意游戏很烂，那么可以一试，如果是第一次接触，我建议放弃这个游戏，相信我，你值得把时间用在其他地方.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198054347147', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1494843991}
review:
La primavera toca las cálidas llanuras nuevamente, posando sus suaves rayos sobre las delicadas flores y acariciandolas dulcemente con ligeras brisas mientras los unicornios pastan a sus anchas. Los reinos de la tierra media... quiero decir de este mundo de fantasía nada inspirado en otros como WoW, SDLA, entre otros... están en paz desde hace mucho tiempo. Pero Sauron, digo... el que no quiere ser nombrado... mierda, el Mal Absoluto, ha llegado para acabar con toda la asquerosa bonanza instaurada desde hace mucho en la región.

En resumidas cuentas, esta es la historia de Dungeons 2, donde manejaremos en esta ocasión al mal para destruir el bien haya donde enviamos a nuestra horda compuesta por orcos, trolls, Nagas y Duendes. Su manera cómica de romper la cuarta pared, introduciendo un montón de coñás y guiños referentes principalmente a sagas de fantasía, son simplemente divertidisimas.

Referente a la jugabilidad tiene dos apartados a simple vista, un """Tower Defender""", el cual será una mazmorra donde extraer recursos, reclutar unidades, entrenarlas, investigar mejoras... todo ello ampliando cual Gnomoria (lógicamente, obviando las diferencias). Los enemigos pueden llegar desde distintas entradas, y les podremos hacer caminos con trampas (de aquí lo de Tower Defender).
Si utilizamos las entradas, nuestras tropas irán al mundo exterior, donde las manejaremos cual RTS.
Pero tiene un fallo destacable, y es que las investigaciones, mejoras y demás tardan demasiado en hacerse, siendo que para conseguir todo/lo indispensable en una partida, vas a tardar bastante, alargando una partida más allá de la hora. Un claro ejemplo de esto son las dos últimas misiones, durando alrededor de dos horas cada una. Como dato, la campaña dura 10 horas más o menos.

Aplaudir el doblaje al Español, me parece maravilloso y muy necesario para un juego que depende tanto de una buena narración.

Lo único que me da pena es no haberlo conocido antes, pues, al igual que muchos otros, acabo de conocer esta saga por que HumbleBundle la ha regalado (imagino que para promocionar el próximo lanzamiento de la tercer parte).

Por aquí han captado a un futuro comprador. No hace falta decir que recomiendo el juego sin dudarlo, ya no solo para los amantes de la estrategia, sino también para aquellos de la fantasía por todos los guiños presentes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058672762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1494833675}
review:
เกมดี เราเป็นปีศาจที่ต้องคอยดูแลดันเจียนของเรา และถล่มแดนมนุษย์
เกมแบ่งโลกเป็นสองส่วน
ส่วนดันเจียนของเรา ควบคุมแบบ point and click สั่งการให้ยูนิตต่างๆทำงาน
สว่นที่ไม่ใช่ดันเจียนของเรา เช่น พื้นโลก หรือ ดันเจียนอื่นๆ ควบคุมแบบเกม RTS สั่งเดินสั่งตี
เนื้อเรื่องทำออกมาได้ดี มีการแทรกมุขตลกตลอดทั้งเกม
ส่วนของ RTS อาจไม่ดีเท่าเกม RTS อื่นๆ แต่ก็เพียงพอในการเล่น
การควบคุมในางส่วนลำบากนิดหน่อย
สรุป ถ้าชอบสัตว์ประหลาด ชอบก็อบลิน ชอบ RTS ชอบ เกมแปลกใหม่ เกมนี้แนะนำ

author: {'steamid': '76561198025872487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1495230608}
review:
Played With: Mouse & Keyboard; Windows 10

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
-Narrator: The Narrator is great, he was also the Narrator in Stanley's Parable and he does a great job here making fun of you and your enemies while throughout puns and references, never gets annoying and is always a pleasure to listen to. 
-It’s Fun: The game feels good to play, building the dungeon and commanding your troops in the overworld brings you back to those days when RTS games were in their golden age. 

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
-Reference: This may not be for everyone so it’s in Neutral. Do you like Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones and Warcraft 3? Well the developers clearly do because every Campaign map is filled with references and nods to them and many more franchises. 

[h1]Cons: [/h1]
-Simple and Easy: The game has rather few rooms, and they’re not very complex, in addition to that the game isn’t really that hard if you just build up your army you shouldn't have too much problems. 
-Texture Pop In: There is a graphical glitch when you move across the map or your troop enter a new area where the textures take a second to pop in and it jarring but doesn't interfere with the game play.

[h1]General Thoughts: [/h1]
-I had a lot of fun with the game, RTS games have always had wonderful Campaigns and were the main reason I played them and this one doesn’t disappoint. It’s a bit simple, but you’ll be enjoying managing your dungeon and laying waste to the Alliance that you won’t be bothered by it. To simply put it the game is good old fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062324758', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1495892954}
review:
Das beste Spiel seit langem! Es ist wie Dungeon Keeper 2 von damals was ich nie spielen konnte und schon etwas neidisch darauf war. Dann hat mir ein Freund erzählt, dass es das Spiel gratis gab und ich hab mich wie ein Kind darauf gefreut.

Zum Spiel.: Die Level machen sehr viel Spaß und dauern zum Teil mehrere Stunden da es hindernisse gibt, Gegner die in das Dungeon eindringen und erledigt werden müsssen, man muss an manchen stellen etwas strategisch überlegen, der Geschichten erzähler ist der Hammer, Grafik ist sehr schön & ich liebe es.

Das Spiel ist sein Geld auf jedenfall wert, selbst wenn ich es nicht bezahlt habe!
