author: {'steamid': '76561197969574260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1439756944}
review:
Und so zog ich in Dungeons 2 mit der Horde und König Joffrey auf den eisernen Thron mit Frostmourne in meinen Händen welches ich von Gandeldoore erhielt....

So ungefähr spielt sich Dungeons 2. Kein Vergleich mehr zum ersten Teil welcher mehr ein Dungeon-Vergnügungs-Tycoon war, als wie wir es alle erhofften ein ähnliches Spiel wie Dungeon Keeper. Ich muss gestehen - seit langer Zeit mal wieder (nach Tropico) ein super geiles Spiel von Kalypso! - Manchmal hat man bei Dungeons 2 das Gefühl dass es von Paradox Entertainment ist - aber natürlich eben nicht!

Von mir eine glatte Kaufempfehlung, ich habe lange gezögert es mir zu holen aber für 20€ fand ich es mehr, weit mehr, als gut! Geniales Spiel!

Für Leute die Dungeon-Games mögen, ist dies ein tolles Spiel, was auch wirklich mal ein gutes Dungeon Keeper gefühl vermittelt!

p.s. wenn man nicht auf lustige texte steht - wie in meinem ersten Satz geschrieben -> Finger weg! Denn das Spiel nimmt alles was mit Medieval/Fantasy zutun hat, egal ob Film oder Spiel, auf den Arm :) Ich hab's gefeiert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001097657', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1439727280}
review:
Оккупировать Уолл-Стрит, что-бы не дать государству спасти банкротящиеся банки? Взглянуть на ледяную стену, за которой бродят белые ходоки? Захватить деревню Хипстерово, во главе с великим вождем орков по имени Трололо? Да!
Чрезвычайно забавная вещица...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996040791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1439550067}
review:
Ни что не предвещало беды! Заезжаю довольный домой, после нескольких дней кутежей, разогреваю хавчик и падаю за комп. Мол порубиться,да что бы не напригало. А тут среди скидочек натыкаюсь на это "зло, насилие, страх"! Тут же вспоминаю оверлорда и улыбаюсь от удовольствия жмуря глазенки, типо :"блять это то что мне нужно!". После долгих ковыряний в обзорах купил и тут же блеванул. 
Ребят ну это откровенно дерьмовая игра, задумка действительно привлекает. В остальном все очень печально, не пытаюсь задеть ни чьи чувства, но вот эти типо ловушки,типо войны и рабочие- просто мусор на экране. Разказчик "очень забавный",   пытается каждый раз добить своими шутками. В этом мире пиздец как все линейно,каждая тропинка, каждый твой ход заранее указывает тебе этот "шутник". 
В добавок ко всему оптимизация кал. Тонны кала,а не игра. 
Мой совет не берите, ну не стоит она тех деревянных что за нее просят =\ 
Пытаюсь вернуть деньги, надеюсь удастся!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993521471', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 3250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1530191323}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966235063', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1433122781}
review:
A fun little game, where the operative word is "little", as in small, as in shallow, as in you sped 45 min on it and you'll have build every thing in the game. No real strategi to speak of. enemies just run streight for your dungeon heart, with no concern for their own safety. also only one stategi for beating the enemy is just to swamp him with all of your forces at once. the game is literaly lacy and quite boring. all of the VERY FEW maps might as well be the same map, and all the enemies are just as boring and generic. there is no features other than a name that distinguish your forces from eachother, and enemy forces are just as boring. the game lacks personality, and playing it is like eating a plain piece of bread. this game is barely worth playing as a tablet-game. When you are building your "dungeon" you will experience that most items can only be placed in one or two ways, which is the locked angle of the camera, this is especially troublesome because it break any oppotunity you'll have for more complex designs (not that you need it, as said earlier AI is basically abcenst) visuals are good though, but that is the only praise i could ever hope to give it. 

Summery:
Empty & shallow gaming experience.
Very restricted building oppotunities.
Abcent and lazy AI (both enemies and your units)
Obvious DLC mill.
Extremely repetative.
Total lack of strategy.

Conclusion: Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135717586', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1924, 'last_played': 1470488588}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963512358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2530, 'last_played': 1510622981}
review: Fun, quirky game. I wouldn't compare it to DK, as it lacks the depth. This is more of a hybrid of two genres, without the depth of either. But its still pretty entertaining on its own, and one of my favorites currently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983859076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1435918468}
review:
This is a good game, but it's not worth the high price tag - there's very little content and almost no replayability. There's basically nothing to do once you've finished all the maps (which is around 4-5 hours of content).

But the thing that frustrates me the most, is that they've just released their DLC 'Chance of Dragons', for a game that's missing a lot of content - it's just another blow in the face to the players.

Do NOT buy this game for this price tag. It's NOT worth it, and the publishers are milking the rest with DLCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983264706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1440011366}
review: By far the most fun i've had with any dungeons saga, now i can't sadly judge it compared to the old dungeon keepers as i've sadly never tried those, but i believe this i a worthy succeser of the once fabled dungeon keepers "I believe that was what it was called!" 10-10 through and through, the only sad part is once you've finished the campaign there isent much else to do really, sure the MP and SP is fun too but still it dies out alittle after that sadly. However with upcoming expansions i believe it'll have a much more valueble replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984405329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1430610069}
review:
The reviewer below me pretty much summed it up extremely well and I have nothing more to add.

- extremely low difficulty
- very shallow (or pretty much nonexistant) tactical/strategical component on both sp and very much recognizable on mp
- one multiplayer mode is senseless (the destruction of the other dungeon heart) because its pretty much always leading to a draw and unwinnable / unloosable for both sides, this is confirmed by the devs since version 1.0
- the visual language is extremely blurry and unclear, battles blur into a mess of colors and effects with no way of telling what is what and why its there
- no true need for many research options like better traps, doors (totally ignorable), spells (totally ignorable too) or working power improvements of the workers
- simply becomes boring very fast because of the bottomline difficulty

author: {'steamid': '76561198090948961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1485049086}
review: Well, i can only say this : MONEYGRABBERS ! This game coulded be awesome, and is really enjoyable playing it. The problems are a lot still. First of all , you will find NO ONE online, unless you add people from hub comunity and then, playin this for about 4 hours before start something pvp vs them . why ? beacause the game is extremely unbalanced. Very short campaign, very few units, they not yet finished the game and already releasing a paid dlc , seriously, don't buy it if not have it, there are a lot of better games than this out there .

author: {'steamid': '76561198122066450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1041, 'last_played': 1518378200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977564005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1436786291}
review:
Dungeons 2 is a Dungeon Keeper clone with a touch of innovation. If you are a fan of the Dungeon Keeper series and are in the mood for something a bit more light-hearted, this might be the game to try.

There are two main aspects to this game: dungeon management and RTS. The RTS element is a welcome addition, although it is somewhat simplistic.

What this game lacks in depth, it makes up for in style and charm. The art style is delightful. The narrator practically bombards you with amusing pop culture references.

The single player campaign will last you around 15 hours. With that in mind, I'm not sure it's worth the full asking price, but definitely consider this game if you see it on sale with a decent discount.

[i]Please note that this recommendation does not extend to this game's predecessor - Kalypso's Dungeons. Dungeons, like most other games in any way associated with Kalypso, is a disappointing game which does not deserve your money or your time.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198055234495', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1850, 'last_played': 1498674156}
review: Mit einer hübschen Grafik einer coolen Story und noch cooleren Sprüchen kommt Dungeons 2, ein Spiel in das man sehr viel Zeit investieren kann und selbst wenn man die Story durch hat machen die PvE und PvP Gefechte trozdem Spaß. Dungeons 2 befasst sich damit alles Schöne und Gute auf einer Mittelalterlichen Fantasy Welt zu Zerstören. Als das "Absolute Böse" kommandiert man seine Schergen durch das Dungeon um dieses zu verbessern zu Verteidigen oder um sie ihrer Tätigkeiten nachgehen zu lassen. Erstmal in der Dungeons spielreihe kommen die Kreaturen auch an die Oberfläche und verwüsten dort Dörfer, Stadte und Wälder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049534212', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1462059960}
review:
Если вы когда то мечтали стать Повелителем зла. Данная игра вас не разочарует. Копать пещеры, добывать золото, гнать своих рабочих на работу, выписывая смачные оплеухи, либо просто хватать за шкирку и отправлять в нужное место. Нанимать войска, выходить на поверхность и уничтожать лагеря жителей. И захватывать территорию для абсолютного зла. Многое другое ждет вас в данной игре. В игре представлена сюжетная компания, а также кооперативный режим, в котором могут поучаствовать до 4 человек.
В заключении хотелось бы добавить, что Dungeons 2 хороша не только из-за того, что очень сильно пробуждает ностальгические чувства, но также имеет свою неповторимую атмосферу и искрометный юмор.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvJJeYeuaOI

author: {'steamid': '76561198066389727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1436644746}
review:
The Single player is amazing and entertaining. although it gets the same over and over again. due there is not much space in intervention of using different units, you are always stuck with a same line up of units, due you need them for your production. at first this seems all fine, but if you are in skirmish and do this strategy 15 times in a row it gets realy boring. the horde is worked out very well. the demons are totally not. the upgrading of their units is a drag and the leveling up of their attack is a terrible experience. while the horde has a room where you can just drop m in. the demons have to cast spells to drop some kind of pig that your units have to kill to get xp. this process is however so slow, that you are manually clicking about 1500 times to get them one level up. and due the cooldown on the spell it takes even longer.

then there are the spells in this game. so far i found only a few usefull. 3 out of 10 spells i did use, the rest is complete garbage. *summoning units to the throne room, meteor storm (demon faction), for the horde (horde faction)*
the other spells are not usuable because they have a very low impact on the game. are solo targetable and consume too much time to cast them right. and use too much mana that you can better save for the 3 strong spells.

Traps: those are amazing early game. if you are 1v1 its almost impossible if you build up your dungeon equally to get to someones throne room. so the game will drag on forever if you both try to get the throne room. which is a way much more fun goal. than running around on the surface for flags. for the capture points (which you can win with lvl 1 fastest / stealth units vs the fully upgraded slower units.)

the maps for skirmisch 2 players are a whopping 2 maps which isnt enough to make the game amazing for more than 3 games.

over all this game plays slow, too much things you have to do manually and no satisfaction if you have all the units maxed out. it is a drag and stays a drag.

but for the single player it is an entertaining game. still play dungeon keeper 1 and 2 over this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031896360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1436556566}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3184, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 3344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1520711322}
review:
One hell of a fun game. I enjoyed every moment of this game as even though it is more simplistic than Dungeon Keeper 2, the mechanics work well and with two separate campaigns it's quite interesting, but the annoying this is that there aren't that many. There are still MANY hours you can replay the missions. I felt it was a little short, however it was still very enjoyable with the same narrator from the Stanley Parable doing his thing and the many different comical references like the "Bloody Wedding" mission with so much Game of Thrones references as well as several other moments, including the Narrator making fun of the heroes dying, you when you fail a mission and even himself at times.

I'd highly recommend this to anyone who's a Dungeon Keeper 2 as they do some new things, but it's a lot more fun. Sadly you can't capture heroes to torture or turn to your side or use their bodies to create new units like vampires, but it's a awful lot of fun.

One of the major issues is that unlike DK2 or War for the Overworld, the animations are very slow. Especially when digging without upgrades (though you can speed them up with a slap. However, unlike the aforementioned games, you don't have to claim squares to start building and can do so immediately. You can also buy the production items to place into the room so they need to be larger for more items so it doesn't matter what shape the room is, as long as it's big enough for the items in question.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033300542', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1492907431}
review:
Este juego es muy bueno, el narrador es un punto fuerte del juego ya que da un buen toque de humor al juego diciendo cosas con referencias a peliculas o otros juegos.El juego es muy entretenido lo malo es la corta duracion de la campaña.

Al juego le doy un 7/10

Si el juego lo pillais de oferta os recomiendo mucho que lo compreis pero por 45€ no es muy recomendable por su corta duracion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000116246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1436305282}
review:
Just finished the game and I have to say that I am a little bit disappointed. One person described this game as 'nothing but tutorial' and that's pretty accurate. You are unlocking abilities right up to the final boss fight.

And it's EEEEEASY.

Like, almost impossible to fail unless you don't understand what the word 'retreat' means.

I also have to say though that I did enjoy it, but that might be because I bought it heavilty discounted.

If I had paid full price for the game I would raging right now.

It's a fun little game that costs far too much money for what it gives you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009738960', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1436270933}
review:
Initially I picked this game up on steam sale, only knowing it had some serious hindering bugs on its release. However at this point I can thankfully say throughout my whole playthrough I encountered no bugs at all and it was one of the funniest things I had seen in a long time.

So to kick things of, the game doesn't focus too much on setting up a dungeon, since defending it is easy but by consistently sending troops above to go on missions. That is against the preference of some but I found it to be a satisfying strategy experience. Aside that the resource and upgrade systems are balanced while the units and factions presented(Demons and Horde) feel different, which is good.

Finally I believe the biggest positive aspect of the game is the campaign. Holding a satisfactory length, it is literally decorated by the game narrator(whose name evades me at the moment but you have probably seen him from Stanley's Parable where he was pretty much the star of the game) who offers scathing comments on everything, from the events that happen to reacting when the player does nothing(please do not do nothing for 5 minutes on the first dungeon mission, you will love the response).

As if that wasn't enough the campaign has tons of popular references concerning the enemies you fight and what they say, most famous ones stemming from Lord of the Rings and Warhammer to other games from the same developers. It even has a specific mission dedicated on referencing the Game of Thrones characters, each one in a unique and hilarious way.

Also worth noting the achievements are nothing hard and can be achieved by one multiplayer game and through the main campaign. After saying that I definitely believe the game is worth the purchase, now that it works properly you can enjoy the fun it offers to the fullest.
Heavily Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197973173473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5275, 'last_played': 1491621868}
review: I was skeptical at first but indeed this game is as much fun as DK2 ever was. I also find it a lot better than the ones I've seen from competitors. Good graphics, good mechanics, and a dedicated dev team come together to make a great game. If you're a fan of DK2 and are on the fence about this game, take then plunge -you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071755400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1509316568}
review: Ich muss sagen es ist ein gut gelungene Kopie von Dungeon Keeper :) Vor allem das man jetzt an der Oberfläche kämpfen kann ist eine Geniale Idee und bringt demn Spiel seine eigene Note. Mir würde es gefallen wenn die Entwickler mehr Spielbaren Klassen bzw. Fraktionen machen würden wie z.b. Untote oder der Allianz. Das Spiel kriegt trotzdem 10/10 Punkte :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047017332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1499106992}
review:
Como fan de la saga Dungeon Keeper, he de admitir que Dungeons 2 si me ha convencido completamente (a diferencia de primero, que creo que solo duré 30 min antes de cerrar el juego y no volver a jugar... Menudo chasco... :/ ). Por otro lado, el humor está presente desde el minuto 1 (ya sea en la generacion de los nombres tanto de los personajes, como haciendo referencia a juegos/series populares hoy en día). A mi me han arrancado mas de una sonrisa. :)

Lo único malo: la duración de la campaña, que es bastante corta. Aun así, estoy segura de que volveré a jugarlo en un futuro no muy lejano.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065756612', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1458962900}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004375557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 6073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1676233424}
review:
Much closer to the original Dungeon Keeper games than its predecessor!  Once again you play the role of the evil dungeon keeper and build up your dungeon, fight off heros, gather gold, and upgrade your rooms and creatures.

Pros:
- You get the visit the 'Overworld' above your dungeon and take the battle to the heroes instead of always waiting for them to come into your dungeon. 
- The graphics looks like its from WarCraft 3
- The dialogue of the narrator is humerous

Improvments over predecessor:
- Creatures can roam around the dungeon instead of being stuck in their spawn location and you can pick them up then drop them anywhere in the dungeon.
- You don't have to capture heroes to collect soul energy just kill them like the good old days of Dungeon Keeper
- You have to maintain your creatures by paying them gold and brewing beer for them to drink
- No other dungeon masters you have to fight

Cons: 
- Campaign is short
- Some missions could be long because your creatures need to have enough combat experiance to take out heroes in the Overworld

Overall it was fun to play this game and would recommend if you liked the Dungeon Keeper games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007447878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1464988870}
review:
If you’re interested in a deep review of this game going over pretty much all the features it offers and what it does right and wrong then I uploaded the review -> https://sithiousreviews.wordpress.com/2015/07/02/dungeons-2-review/ <- just for you.

What you should enjoy:
+ The art style, it's very well realized and is nice to look at, everything is well modelled and polished, the lighting and effects look great and once you get a huge dungeon built and fully working it just looks and feels wonderful.
+ Content. This game would suck without all this content so thank god there is a good hunk of it here to dig into! It's defiantly the highlight of the whole game. There are two factions to enjoy here and both are unique and have their own speed of progression, play style, unit and room appearances, upgrades and god powers. Each faction has three tiers to go up from starting at tier one with the basics going up to tier three with the most powerful upgrades and units you can get, requiring to do some kind of super evil act to tier up like killing lots of unicorns so it's not just something you can do and toss away you have to earn it, making the tiers feels special and important. Alot of work went into making all this content and it's easy to appreciate since it makes the game last ages if your and upgrade hog like me and simply have to get everything before steam rolling the enemy, it feels great.
+ Fun gameplay. The game doesn’t expect too much from you most of time, giving you plenty of time to get started and dig in each mission before heroes start attacking your lovely dungeon and distracting you. The over world is a great new feature to this genre, the added RTS is a great distraction and makes the game last way longer then it would without it and makes it truly feel like you’re fighting back and eliminating those nuisance heroes once and for all.
+ Polished experience. You want a bug free dungeon game that runs fine, hardly crashes, goes pretty smoothly and doesn’t really ever let you down or block its own progress? Then look no further, I could never find a single bug in this game that ever effected gameplay, progression or caused frustration. The only thing it does is start up slowly, that's about it.


What's not that enjoyable at all:
- The RTS combat has to be the first thing, as original as it is added to a dungeon builder game it's clear these devs just don't know how to make satisfying RTS gameplay, which is a shame but you can't expect them to when they make dungeon games. The combat is way too simple to be fun or engaging for long, after your first few fights your already over it, then it just becomes a necessity not something you really want to do more of. Unit abilities and the 'god powers' you have to select from generally make a fight quicker by only afew seconds and it's easier to just not use them all, making them kinda irrelevant but it's nice they are there anyway. It's like they are there almost to distract you from the fact the combat is so super bland.
- Annoying narrator, yea I did put him in the plus section for being quirky but hes also really overdone. Anyone that plays this game will either ignore how naggy he is, not like him for it or just flat out hate him, there is no true in between here he is just that naggy and hand holding your just like, ugh, please just stop nagging me and let me do my thang. I guess if the devs paid for him they are going to use the crap out of him aren't they? And that they did. 
- Ugly graphics choices. Although the graphics style looks great it could have done so much better with another graphics engine that really let all their hard work shine like it should do. The unity engine they are running it on must be freaken old cas the AA options are abysmal, only FXAA as an option should never be a thing, it's not even well done FXAA as it blurs the game to the point all detail and fidelity is lost, it's better without it on but then you have to put up with insane jagged edges everywhere on everything. It will drive you insane if graphics matter to you at all, seriously, it's a real shame.
- Awful performance. Yep I’m gonna say it, this game runs like arse, totally and complete arse. It runs fine at the start where your dungeon is simply a throne room and nothing else but as you inevitably expand, more effects show up on screen, more units, more models, more stuff in general it runs worse and worse to the point where you can barely get over 20-30fps. Anyone that says under 60fps doesn’t effect gameplay doesn’t know what they are talking about or are blind cas under the 50fps mark and a game becomes less responsive and fluid, directly effecting how much you can interact with the game and thus effecting experience, it's that easy. You think turning all the graphics down to low will help too? Pff good luck, it will probably give you another 20 frames max but that’s it, if it runs like crap to begin with it will still run like crap. I have an average computer that most people will have if you’re wondering.
- Way too easy. The game is abit tricky at first when your units are low levelled, not upgraded and you have few of them, but then when you build a big army and beef them up the game is a total breeze. At mid game there is no longer any intensity or worry your throne room is gonna get destroyed because you can easily call back all your units with one simple spell and stop the enemies anyway. After the start there is no challenge or depth to this game, the enemy waves stay the same as they started and never get hard or frequent enough to give you any concern, even then some well placed traps will kill most of them. A simple difficulty setting for the campaign would have easily fixed this but oh well I guess.
- Hard to manage your dungeon. It's silly but sometimes you forget where your rooms are and have to keep looking for them... the god powers are binded to really weird keys like k-7, and k-1, what the hell does that even mean? You never know what your workers are actually doing, if they are mining gold for you or not, how much income they are actually making, how to make them bring it in faster, no way to make them prioritize tasks, no way to set different minions to different tasks so they are more effective, nothing. If you want management there is none in this game, you just build a pretty dungeon, build units to run it and watch, yep that’s what you do. Occasionally you'll send combat units out to fight then boom you win. The game is so simple sometimes you swear it was made for kids...
- Very linear gameplay and  storyline. Your evil, you got killed by heroes, you want revenge... yep that's it. If your looking for storyline then wow you are so in the wrong place, lol. Each missions is pretty straight forward, do the usual, build up your dungeon, steam roll enemies along a super linear path all the way to enemy base and destroy it, boom done, go to next mission, rinse repeat. It's about as interesting to read as it is to play.
- The game doesn’t take itself, or the fact you are supposed to be evil, seriously at all. This... makes it feel like a kids game most of the time and I’m not a kid so yea. It's pretty clear dungeon games where you being an evil sadistic a-hole ruining what’s supposed to be a happy, perfect world should never a kids game, it should take the evil thing more seriously and make you feel truly evil not like you’re kind of just acting like you are. I think the devs probably got this now... maybe.
- Multiplayer. What multiplayer?! If you got this game for playing with friends you made a bad buy my friend, the multiplayer is simple and sucky, just play the single player.


Overall this is a 6.7 out of 10 for me. I can't recommend it because of all the badly executed mechanics, graphics options and the sheer amount of negatives this game has that are so bad they are easy to point out and explain. Get it on sale, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988148511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1519338124}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966076599', 'num_games_owned': 2908, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1435765169}
review:
Auch wenn Manche evtl. anderer Meinung sind, mich hat durch dieses Spiel wieder das alte "Dungeon-Keeper-Fieber®" erwischt. Für mich der bisher Beste DK-Klon/Remake (hatte um einiges mehr Spass als mit "War for the Overworld"). Und das Ganze wird sogar mit einer kleinen Prise Warcraft 3 gewürzt...

- stimmige Grafik / Artdesign / lustige bzw. "knuddelige" Animationen
- toller Soundtrack
- extrem hoher Wuselfaktor
- toller Humor / viele Anspielungen auf bekannte Filme, Bücher & Spiele
- GRANDIOSER Erzähler!
- bugfrei (mir ist in der gesamten Spielzeit nur ein einziger "echter" Bug aufgefallen, nämlich dass die Soundeinstellung/Lautstärke sich selbstständig verändert. Merkt man daran, dass die Musik plötzlich leise ist - und das kann auch durchaus an meinem System gelegen haben. Abstürze: Fehlanzeige)

Auch der Echtzeit-Strategie Anteil hat seinen Charme - ist meiner Meinung nach jedoch deutlich zu leicht (wenn man mal die Zaubersprüche, Lazarett bzw. Defibri-o-mat, usw. ausgebaut & verstanden hat).

Etwas negatives fällt mir nicht ein - ausser dass die Schnodderlinge oftmals anfänglich nicht das getan haben, was sie sollten bzw, was ich wollte. Aber das lag möglicherweise an meiner Ungeduld bzw. meinem Drang zu Grossbau-Projekten... das hat die Kleinen evtl. etwas überfordert. ;-) Beispiel: mir ist immer wieder das Bier ausgegangen, weil ich davon ausgegangen bin, dass die Brauerei besetzt bleibt und nur die Schnodderlinge buddeln, die gerade nichts zu tun haben - dem ist aber nicht so. Wenn ihr -wie ich- gleich zu Beginn den ganzen Dungeon umgrabt, dann bleibt halt keine Zeit zum Bierbrauen. Das kann man aber umgehen, in dem man einfach etwas "sparsamer" gräbt bzw. immer erst auf einen kleinen Biervorrat wartet.

Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: ich bin mir ziemlich sicher, wer Dungeon Keeper 1 & 2 mochte, wird dieses Spiel lieben (99%) & kann bedenkenlos zugreifen. Auch der Preis geht, bei der Spieldauer/dem Umfang, mehr als absolut in Ordnung. 

In diesem Sinne - zugreifen & böse sein!

Böse Grüsse
Das ultimative Bö... Guenix

PS: Euer Dungeon ist voll Joghurt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038447830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1679321620}
review:
In my search for a worthy replacment for the much beloved Dungeon Keeper, I tried this game. I wanted to like it, I really did... but it's just not happening for me. 
Nice graphics? Check. 
Snarky moderator? Check. 
Dungeon management? Meh...not so much. 

The overworld is a nice touch, but gameplay is painfully slow. It takes forever to build up enough gold to do anything, and even then you're severely limited as to what you can do. Very few rooms, and even fewer minions to be had. And no real freedom. Sure you can turtle-up and take your time building a dungeon, but it's such a slog that you could literally walk away and do something else while waiting on it to happen. Plus, your minions will likely die from sheer boredom. 

Granted, I've only spent a few hours in-game, but I can't seem to force myself to play more. That's a bad sign since I still enjoy the playing original DK and DK2. (Thank you GOG!) 

It's not a "bad" game by any stretch, but I would wait 'til it's on sale to buy if you think you may want it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017189485', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1435800093}
review:
I picked this game up during the summer sale for $20 and I feel like I got my money's worth.  I enjoyed playing it overall, enough that I'll pick up the planned DLC when it comes out.  I have no interest in multi-player, so my review is based solely on my single-player experience.  Here are just a few bulleted items that came to mind while I was playing:

Liked
- Art style: cartoonish like DK, detailed, colorful, and original
- Voice work and writing: great work on the narrator; he's pithy and verbose, but doesn't become annoying.  Story is simple and about on par w/ the DK games
- Gameplay: I enjoyed the dual dungeon-digging and overland-conquest idea, I think it worked.  Even though neither was as deep as a game that just focused on one or the other, there was enough there to make a fun game
- Research and upgrades: there's quite a bit to dig into here as far as upgrading your units; if you're a completionist like me, it can be time-consuming to max everything out.  Even though it's fairly linear progression, there are obvious results in your units' competence from your research
- Multiple factions: although the second villainous faction doesn't come heavily into play in the campaign, there's great fun to be had playing as both villainous factions in skirmish mode.  I felt like this adds a bit of longevity to the game
- UI: everything in the game is fairly straight-forward and easy to navigate.  Aside from issues I had assigning spells to hot-keys, I think you'd have to try pretty hard not to grasp how to manipulate the game world here
- Developer presence on the Community page: this might seem stupid, but it's immensely gratifying to have people involved w/ the development present to field questions.  Many games I've purchased have no dev presence here and it's often incredibly frustrating working w/ other players to figure out game issues.  I had several questions that I posted  here and they always got dev attention eventually


Could Use Improvement
- Adjustable difficulty: much of the game was too easy for my tastes, the campaign needs difficulty options
- More reward for exploring: this was a big thing in the DK games, digging out out every nook and cranny yielded interesting rewards. Similarly for the overworld. I felt this was lacking a bit here
- Campaign could be longer and more free-form: there's a tad too much hand-holding as you go through   
- Mission variety: I'm on the fence w/ this one b/c I see where the devs made the attempt.  There are several missions where you make forays into opposing dungeons and a mission where you have to ambush overworlders while they're en route to a meeting; however, I would like to have seen this variety pan out more. I like the fighting between dungeon concept, I wish it had gotten more screen-time and more robust gameplay instead of the simple set-piece scenarios we got.

As I said, I enjoyed this game enough to keep an eye out for the DLC.  I didn't play the first Dungeons game; I was scared off by the negative press it got.  However, I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed DK, despite its flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077926109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1444434547}
review:
DK 3 - и этим все сказано. Поклонникам серии мастхев. Но не ждите чего-то особенного, на мой вкус DK все таки покруче будет. Если в ДК2 компанию я раз 5 проходила, то тут 1 раз - и на полку.
Плюсы:
полная русская озвучка в сочетании с не плохим юмором
приятная, привычная по всем знакомым играм, графика
появился (в сравнении с дк) режим военной стратегии, как в варкрафте: с непосредственным управлением юнитами и микроконтролем
Минусы:
ну очень казуальненько. Юнитов всего 5 типов, их всех можно просто взять и купить. Золота в каждой миссии овер 9000, маны тоже всегда предостаточно. Не помню, чтобы были особенно сложные моменты в компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992866082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1435468306}
review:
まず操作性が悪すぎて話にならない。
チュートリアルが意味不明で、適当にキャラクターを動かしているだけで終わってしまった。
キャンペーンはステージミッションをクリアしていく形だが、２面でいきなりダンジョンに放り込まれて、宝物庫を作るという目的が提示される。チュートリアルが全く役に立たない上に、何をどうしていいかわからない。
サウンドもグラフィックもチープ。
最初のハードルを超えてプレイし続ける気は全く起きなかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561197987134207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1437145358}
review:
최근에 했던 수작중하나입니다.
게임 자체는 수작과 평작의 중간정도의 애매한 위치지만.. 한글 변역이 상당히 잘되어있습니다.
유머스러움도 느낄 수 있고 게임의 전반적인 인터페이스나 클릭감도 지나치다고 생각될정도로 쉽습니다.
기존 던전스보다 좀더 RTS 성향이 가미되었고 전반적으로 좋은그래픽과
출시초기에는 어떨지 몰르겠지만 현재의 버전은 버그나 최적화 문제도 찾아보기 어렵습니다.

디펜스, 건설시뮬, 전략시뮬, 아케이드, 캠페인 좋아하시는분이면 충분히 구매할만한 가치가 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018444495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1434934934}
review:
Boring.

The game moves at a glacial pace. Then when you finally get EVERYTHING and are ready for a serious challenge it ends. 
Everything is superficial, the main unit mechanic is beer which you get just by building a brewery, no harvesting you just build it and bam there it goes. 

Overall the game is simple and boring, you can "defend" your dungeon with traps if you want but you'll do just as well picking up every unit and just setting them on the enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000707720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1494778856}
review:
Einfach zu träge. Dauert ewig, bis mal was in die Gänge kommt. Wortwörtlich.

Auf keinen Fall 45€ wert. Auch keine 22,50€ im Summersale. 10€ wären wären wohl ok.
Werds mir selber wohl aber erst wieder holen, wenns mal in nem HumbleBundle verfügbar ist.

Direkt der Anfang der Kampagne war gut, danach flachte es ab.
Aber wie bereits gesagt. Man hat das Gefühl dass das Spiel auf 50% Geschwindigkeit läuft. Als wäre man in nen Kaugummi getreten.

review:

But for anyone looking for a new dungeon keeper this is a close at it gets. Would never recommend buying at full price (took me about 17 hours to complete the main campaign and I played so slow so slow)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970666411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1697642059}
review:
Ich kann das Spiel in seinem jetzigen Zeitpunkt nicht empfehlen. Es hat zwar eine Große Menge an guten Ansätzen, aber diese Skalieren von Nerfend bis total Sinnlos in allen Richtungen.
Grob zusammengefasst:
- Singelplayer viel zu kurz
- Spielsysteme die nichts bringen / das Spiel künstlich in die Länge ziehen
- MP-Maps lieblos
- Zu klein

Details:
Der Singelplayer kommt mit 12 möglichen Level auf 11 Karten
1. Karte ist Intro, gefolgt von mehreren Tutorialkarten. Dazu darf man 2 mal die 2te Fraktion spielen. Die Finale Karte kann mann dann ebenfalls 2 mal mit jeweils beiden Fraktionen durchspielen.
Für mich persönlich waren von den 12 Missionen 5 Mal "Vollwertige" Missionen dabei. 
Dabei wird ziehmlich direkt auf "Mehr" angesprochen, siehe all die "Winter is coming" ausrufe, da das Spiel seinen Humor Größtenteils aus GoT raushohlt (Was nicht schlecht ist)

Spielsysteme:
- Räume: Theoretisch kann man eine riesige freifläche bauen, und auf diese die Räume verteilen. Es gibt zwar effizienzboni, die aber so gering sind, weil Gold und Moral (Bier, Anbetung) der einzige bremser sind.

- Fallen: Größtenteil sinnfrei. Die erforschung ist so teuer, das sie gar nicht lohnt, lieber 1-2 Monster mehr. Ausnahme sind die Eier der Dämonen, die sind wiederum sowas von Effektiv, das ich mit denen knapp 3/4 der Angreifer aufhalten kann..ok KI ist eh nicht vorhanden.

- Moral: Durch Bier oder Anbetung. Bier ist sehr classico...aber total daneben. Da die Arbeiter ihre festgelegte Prio haben, kann man nahezu nie mehr Als eine Brauerei aktiv haben. Lieber gehen 5 bekloppte Arbeiter den Bigboss anbeten. Das führt zu moralmangel, einziger Ausweg: Oberwelt

- Ja die Oberwelt. Ist sozusagen der Easymode oder Cheatmode. Die Armee brauch keine Moral mehr, und Gold bekommen se direkt überwiesen. Kann man jedem nur anraten. In der Zeit kann der eine Bierbraucher einen Vorrat anbrauen :)
Der Echtzeitstrategieteil oben funzt aber gut. Ok ist eh kein Komplexitätsmonster. 

- EInheiten: 4 Stück jeweils 2 Mal aufwertbar. So hat man zwar schöne 12 Einheiten, aber die 8 Aufgewerteten brauchen keinerlei Räume als vorraussetzung, wodurch der Dungeon doch wieder ein Stück kleiner bleibt.

Dungeons 2 hat theoretisch einiges zu bieten, nur es bringt kaum was. Der aufbau des Dungeons benötigt keinerlei intelligente Planung, Spielsysteme harmonieren nicht. Oberwelt wirkt aufgesetzt und unfertig. Der Singelplayer spielt sich wie ne Beta die einfach mal aufhört.

Für die Aktuellen 45 Euro ist ein so kleines Spiel in keinster weise zu Empfehlen. Da hatte ich ehrlich gesagt mit Impire mehr spass, und das wurde auch schon nicht der Tolle bringer. 
Daher verstehe ich auch nicht all die positiven Bewertungen, da Dungeons 2 in seinem Jetztigen Stadium in keinster weise an ein DungeonKeeper rann kommt.
Wenn micht die Tutorialmissionen nicht mehr als 2 Std gekostet hätten, wäre das Spiel zurück gegangen.
Hab mich da von den Bewertungen etwas blenden lassen. Leider.
Es gibt zwar hir und da Aussagen, das da noch was kommt. Dann soll man ein so "halbes" Spiel aber auch dementsprechend verkaufen. Und mit Versprechen habens leider nicht viele Entwickler in der letzten Zeit :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198027916235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1435511026}
review:
Das Spiel ist sehr Lustig aufgezogen und hat ein sehr gutes Tutorial. Gekauft im Summer Sale für ~20€

+ Der Erzähler (Sehr sehr gut gelungen)
+ Multiplayer (LAN  Modus)
+ 2 Fraktionen (war mir vor dem Kauf garnicht klar)

- Man kann nicht weit genu heraus Zoomen, was die Übersicht leider recht stark reduziert. Man gewöhnt sich zwar dran, dreht aber dennoch ständig am Mausrad.
- Rotieren geht auch nicht, stört aber so gut wie garnicht.


Trotz der Minuspunkte kann ich es empfehlen. Ich habe ein paar mal Herzhaft gelacht und durch die Gesamte Kampagne nicht einmal die Lust verloren und auch der Multiplayer macht Spaß, auch wenn hier etwas mehr Geschwindigkeit gefragt ist ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197986943203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1489198231}
review:
A fun but ultimately flawed game. I picked this up on a steam sale for 20 bucks and enjoyed the hell out of the single player campaign. Will multiplayer or skirmish be as good? Not sure.  I just played the campaign. I just don't know how multiplayer or skirmish will work. There are a lot of things that can be improved upon. 

Positive
+ Wonderful atmosphere and narration. I cracked a smile enough times I was waiting wondering what the narrator would say next.
+ Good Dungeon Management game play. I feel it could be sped up somehow but overall it was an enjoyable experience.
+ Graphics are goofy and fit all aspects of the game. I was a little concerned about this part but the more I played it the more I enjoyed the look. 

Negatives
- Unit control was clunky and not a whole lot was explained.  A lot of people compare the overworld part to playing Warcraft 3. It's true to an extent but creating groupings and general control felt very clunky. 
- Room control.  I enjoyed all the additional aspects of the rooms but I feel like they could have better managed how you switch between them.  I was constantly looking for my armory or my tinker shop. Even my hospital was hard to find in a large dungeon. They really needed an extra menu to control these rooms without looking for them. 
- Gameplay pace.  I play a lot of strategy games but the campaign took me forever to complete when it probably should have taken me half the time. Even the narrator told me to speed it up. 

Overall 7.0 out of 10.  It's a very good addition to the genre but I have a personal bias for WFTO. If you want a Dungeon Keeper experience, get that game(be aware it's got a lot of issues). If you want something similar and done professionally, get Dungeons 2.  It's far and beyond better than the original. They honestly should have called it something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983274454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1435088518}
review: A very well made game in the same vein as Dungeon Keeper. If you enjoyed that game way-back-when, you'll love this one. Dig for gold and space, construct production facilities and defenses, and fend off invasions from the surface. Very much like Dungeon Keeper, with some added above-ground RTS-type gameplay. 4 out of 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969425273', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1435373867}

A+ worth my dosh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051223847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1435093196}
review:
This game is a worthy successor to the Dungeon Keeper franchise, incorporating many great elements of creature training and management.  It delivers exactly as advertised in this regard, and if you enjoyed DK, you will enjoy this as well.

For myself, the game shines in the same place as its inspiration- skirmish mode, where you are free to sandbox until your heart is content, complete with the old gem nodes for a modest but endless stream of gold.

Dungeons 2 expands on the old Dungeon Keeper model, by allowing you to venture on to the surface, and take a much more direct hand in controlling your creatures, more akin to a traditional RTS framework.  While not as elegant as a mainstream, big name RTS, it is more than serviceable and provides a nice addition to the game, as well as additional tactical situations.

There are two factions you can select from- a familiar, wacky feeling pile of goblins, orcs and the like, or a darker pack of demons.  While playing somewhat similar in a broad sense, they differ in enough ways to impact dungeon planning and creature selection.

This is a very solid, enjoyable game, and worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051409388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1633109872}
review: Игра была бы замечательная, есть много хороших отзывов, с которыми я согласен. Но всю игру портит лишь то, что персонажи зависают и топчутся на месте, после чего, спустя несколько секунд, игра вылетает, обнаружив ошибку. И так каждый раз. Самое частое автосохранение - 15 минут, но за это время можно сделать многое, после чего потерять из за "обнаруженной ошибки". Все впечатление от игры портится лишь из за этого, и играть больше не хочется.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995257791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1494673559}
review:
I was expecting a game as similar to and as good as or better than Dungeon Keeper Gold.  Long story short: i didn't get it.  The similarity was there but the fun and gameplay wasn't.

The game looks good, has some good mechanics and has obviously had a lot of effort into polishing it to look really nice but really failed to grab me and i got bored an hour in. Maybe i just have higher expectations as i absolutely loved DKG but I think my boredom was mainly due to it being really slow and based off the few missions i played far to easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056098438', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1508003723}
review:
4/5 Sterne gebe ich dem Spiel.

Die Grafik ist richtig gut geworden. Ebenfalls die Effekte und die Reaktionen der "Diener".

Die Geschichte der Kampagne ist sehr spannend gestaltet und der Erzähler dazu ist einfach klasse :D 

Was mich ein wenig noch stört ist das gegenüber dem Spiel "Dungeon Keeper" eine wichtige und lustige Funktion fehlt.
Innerhalb des eigenen Dungeons könnte man noch die First Person funktion einführen so das man seine "Diener" mit einem Zauber selber steuern kann.

Desweiteren stört mich das man seine "Diener" erst in die Hand nehmen musst um Ihre genaue Statistik zu sehen.

Schön wäre es außerdem ein paar mehr Räume hinzuzufügen. (Kasino, Friedhof, Kerker, Foltergrupe, u.s.w., halt alles was so in ein Dungeon passt)

Alles in allem ist das Spiel eine recht gut gelungene Tat gegenüber dem Enttäuschenden Vorgänger "Dungeons".
Daumen hoch an die Entwickler.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen
Pandalas

author: {'steamid': '76561197971782141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1496468901}
review: A bit slow at times, a bit easy, but I thoroughly enjoyed the dungeon building aspects and the narrator. The overworld content does get harder later thankfully, but defending in the dungeon is as easy as filling it with traps and immediately zapping the bard that disables traps. There's really no fear of the heroes actually destroying your throne room.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989433743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3498, 'last_played': 1435184156}
review:
It's difficult to review a game like this without making reference to the Dungeon Keeper series, since this game is effectively a Dungeon Keeper clone with a twist. It breaks with the classic Dungeon Keeper formula in a few key areas, which is sometimes for the better, and sometimes for the worse.

One aspect of the game I enjoyed the idea of was being able to send your creatures to fight on the overworld, something I always felt was lacking in Dungeon Keeper. In the overworld, the game switches to a more traditional RTS control scheme heavily inspired by Warcraft 3 (a game it makes reference to multiple times; more on this later), but lacking the polish of a proper RTS. This is where I felt the game was lacking - controlling units is clunky, and selecting individual units is difficult (you have to be VERY precise with your mouse clicks and it's hard to tell where your cursor is actually pointed because it's a big fat hand), which is a pain, since most units have active abilities (like Warcraft) which help them and their allies in combat. Overworld combat therefore often degenerated into two blobs of units ramming into each other, with the strongest unit blob emerging victorious.

Another aspect of the game which I like in principle, but which was flawed in execution, is the ability to choose from two different factions - the Horde (another Warcraft reference) consisting of various green-skinned races, and the Demons (also referred to as 'The Flaming Legion'... yes, they did it again). In terms of mechanics, both factions play quite differently, however, the Demons require more micromanagement, are more difficult to use, and are just not very fun to play with in my opinion, which leaves me coming back to the Horde every time. There have been hints floating around that the devs are planning to bring in the Undead as a third faction. Watch this space.

The underground aspect of the game plays like a simplified version of Dungeon Keeper. I like that you can now fill in areas of the dungeon you've mined out (so now my obsessive-compulsive tendencies are satisfied by perfectly shaped dungeon rooms and corridors. Researching upgrades is clunky, as you have to go to the appropriate room to do it; research takes places in three different rooms, two of which have multiple sub-menus for research, so it's difficult to tell what's yet to be discovered. Spells are, for the most part, not that interesting or useful.

For me though, the worst part of the underground game is how easy it is to defeat waves of invaders after around the 15-20 minute mark. The difficulty of the waves doesn't really scale into the late game, and the top tier traps (like the Horde's Red Alert-esque Tesla Coil, and the Demons' giant tentacle) feel a bit redundant. The other thing I dislike about the game is the lack of replay value. Once you've played through the campaign, you've experienced everything the game has to offer. There isn't much strategic choice or flexibility in the game, so once you've figured out a winning formula for building up an epic dungeon from scratch, the game simply consists of following that same formula every time until you have an army big enough to stomp the overworld do-gooders.

In terms of style, it's clear that the game is made by a German developer, since all rooms have an 'efficiency' rating, and beer is now an important resource that you must ensure a constant supply of, and your breweries are decorated with little Bavarian flags. In contrast to the grim, grainy visuals and dry, dark humour of Dungeon Keeper (hallmarks of its British devs), Dungeons 2 is bright and cartoonish, and its sense of humour is silly in a very Monty Pyhton-eqsue way. Most of the jokes come from the game's narrator, whose voice will be immediately recognisable to anyone who has played The Stanley Parable, which the narrator himself references in one of his many, many, fourth-wall-breaking moments. 

There are also multiple references to many other aspects of nerd popular culture. It's clear the devs are gigantic geeks from the things they make reference to. 80% of the references are related to Game of Thrones or Lord of the Rings, I also picked up references to general pop culture (Two of my Nagas were called Kardass'shian and Kanyay'Wst), the Warcraft Universe, Warhammer, Gamergate and The Quinnspiracy, a couple of youtube videos I haven't seen in years (including Trololo and They're Taking the Hobbits to Isengard). I chuckled at a lot of the references, although the relentless Game of Thrones stuff started to get stale.

All in all, this is a game I would recommend. It certainly brings back feelings of Dungeon Keeper nostalgia and despite being quite formulaic and lacking replay value, you'll get a good couple of dozen hours of fun gameplay out of this game before it starts to get dull. For those who miss the way strategy games used to be, despite all their flaws, Dungeons 2 will fill that gap while it lasts.

Now to move on to War For the Overworld, which I've heard such good things about.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859512', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1435000757}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1437309593}
review:
Dungeons 2 to strategia czasu rzeczywistego z rozbudowanymi elementami ekonomicznymi. Grę opracowało studio Realmforge, czyli ten sam zespół, który wyprodukował pierwowzór oraz Dungeons: The Dark Lord. ( który był strasznym stolcem ).
Każda z 11 misji składających się na kampanię misji toczy się bowiem nie na jednej, a na dwóch lub więcej mapach. Mapą pierwszą są oczywiście podziemia, drugą - powierzchnia. Do tego dochodzą rozmaite jaskinie, wnętrza twierdz czy lochy należące do konkurencji, niekiedy równie rozległe. Między mapami przełączamy się swobodnie i w każdym momencie. Różnice nie sprowadzają się tylko do widoczków. W zależności od tego czy znajdujemy się w swoich podziemiach czy poza nimi, gramy tak naprawdę w dwie różne gry.
Podziemia przekopujemy i rozbudowujemy w charakterystyczny, uwielbiany przez fanów Keepera sposób. Wielką, złą łapą pełniącą rolę kursora zaznaczamy więc kolejne bryły ziemi do usunięcia, by służące nam Gnojki się ich pozbyły, każemy im też wydobywać złoto, żebyśmy mieli za co tworzyć kolejne pomieszczenia i rekrutować stwory. Na oczyszczonym obszarze (którego nie musimy już przejmować) budujemy sale pełniące rozmaite funkcje.

Co ciekawe, samo ich wybudowanie najczęściej nie wystarcza - musimy je jeszcze urządzić. W browarze wznosimy więc ogromną kadź do produkcji piwa, w szpitalu stawiamy kolejne łóżkai pozwalające wskrzeszać poległe stwory defibrimaty, a w goblińskim miejscu pracy, nazwanym grotą majsterklepki - kreatomaty umożliwiające opracowywanie nowych technologii i produkcję skrzynek z narzędziami za pomocą których m.in. stawiamy pułapki.

W dodatku sale pełnią często więcej niż jedną funkcję. Kryształowa komnata pozwala nie tylko na produkcję many, ale też opracowywanie nowych zaklęć, arena zapewnia stworom zarówno rozrywkę, jak i możliwość wbijania wyższych poziomów czy przekwalifikowania się na jednostki elitarne, a kuźnia chaosu pozwala ulepszać broń i odblokowywać umiejętności specjalne jednostek.
Do tego sama eksploracja podziemi jest ciekawa - co rusz trafiamy na komnaty opanowane przez wrogie stwory, skrywające jednostki sojusznicze, albo artefakty pozwalające przypisać wybranemu stworowi nowe cechy, takie jak zwiększona efektywność pracy czy skuteczność obrażeń krytycznych, ulepszony pancerz, podwojone zdrowie i tak dalej. Na lochu zabawa jednak się nie kończy - po krótszej bądź dłuższej fazie przygotowań ruszamy siać zamęt i zniszczenie na powierzchni. Płynące mlekiem i miodem krainy pełne są osad i zamków strzeżonych przez rycerzy, baśniowych stworzeń, gdzieniegdzie szwendają się też demony, którym nie w smak jest współpraca z nami, albo istoty które bez wahania decydują się do nas dołączyć. I mam tu na myśli zarówno jednostki podstawowe, jak i potężnych sprzymierzeńców.

Także i tu znajdujemy artefakty, zazwyczaj po wykończeniu większej grupki przeciwników. Na terenach pod gołym niebem nie stawiamy za to żadnych konstrukcji, kierujemy jedynie poczynaniami armii. W podziemiach stwory łażą samopas, a nasz wpływ na nie jest niewielki i ogranicza się w zasadzie do rozdawania plaskaczy, przenoszenia pojedynczych poczwar z miejsca na miejsce i przymuszania ich do stadnego stawienia się w miejscu wskazanym przez czar formowania hordy.Za to na powierzchni mamy bezpośrednią kontrolę nad każdą z jednostek. Możemy przemieszczać je w dowolne miejsce i w dowolnych ilościach, a także wykorzystywać ich umiejętności specjalne. A tych jest cała masa. Podobnie jak jednostek, które występują w kilku różniących się wyglądem i skillami odmianach.

Gobliny awansowane na skrytobójców potrafią stać się niewidzialne (chyba, że przeciwnik dysponuje jednostkami zdolnymi je zdemaskować) i zadawać druzgoczące obrażenia ciosem w plecy, z kolei gobliny w pancerzach kroczących podsmażają pobliskich przedstawicieli cnotliwego trybu życia miotaczami ognia. Nie brakuje też jednostek leczących. Umiejętności te w późniejszych misjach nabierają ogromnego znaczenia i często decydują o wygraniu lub przegraniu potyczki. Podobnie zresztą jak odpowiedni dobór jednostek, atakowanie wrogów w odpowiedniej kolejności lub sposobem czy korzystanie z zaklęć. W przeciwieństwie do War for the Overworld nie wystarczy tu po prostu zalać wroga chmarą stworków.

I teraz najlepsze - gobliny, orki, trolle i podobne im stworzenia to tylko przedstawiciele jednej frakcji. A mniej więcej w połowie kampanii odblokowuje nam się druga, posiadająca inne jednostki, budynki i czary! I choć misji, które możemy nią rozegrać jest wyraźnie mniej, to już w trybie potyczki i multiplayerze stanowi ona pełnoprawną stronę konfliktu. Oczywiście do tego wszystkiego dochodzą nasi ulubieni, słodziutcy ludzie, których tępimy przez całą kampanię.
Produkcja RealmForge zaskakuje świetną oprawą. W lochach kursor jest jednocześnie źródłem światła, więc obserwujemy elegancką grę cieni. Usuwane bryły ziemi rozsypują się na dziesiątki grudek, uwijające się jak w ukropie Gnojki biegają w pocieszny sposób gubiąc błyszczące monety, a stwory, które aktualnie nie mają nic do roboty żłopią piwsko, albo zajmują się opukiwaniem ścian.

Na powierzchni jest jeszcze lepiej. Gdy nasza armia przechodzi przez jasne, kolorowe lokacje niszcząc oddziały przeciwnika, okolica zmienia się w scenerię rodem z koszmarów. Liście na drzewach tracą kolor, albo zupełnie opadają, tu i ówdzie pojawiają się sadzawki wypełnione kwasem, ziemia rozstępuje się ukazując płynąca pod powierzchnią lawę, a bajkowe stworzenia zastępują rozmaite poczwary. Czasem zmienia się nawet ukształtowanie terenu, otwierając nowe trasy. A wszystko to dzieje się płynnie, na naszych oczach, niczym w teatrzyku kukiełkowym.

Oczywiście ma to swoją cenę - gdy na ekranie dzieje się dużo, nawet na mocnym sprzęcie prędkość animacji spada o kilkanaście klatek. Z jednej strony szkoda, z drugiej gra i tak działa dużo lepiej niż brzydkie jak noc War for the Overworld. No i błędów zdarza się tu znacznie mniej.Laurkę wypada też wystawić ekipie odpowiedzialnej za napisanie kwestii narratora. Jego głosowi daleko wprawdzie do genialnego Richarda Ridingsa (narratora serii DK i WftO), za to jeśli idzie o ilość i jakość tekstów Dungeons 2 kładzie konkurencję na łopatki. Snute przez naszego przewodnika monologi pełne są kapitalnych odzywek, absurdów, zamierzonych pomyłek i wisielczego humoru. Twórcy na każdym kroku cisną z „Władcy Pierścieni” i „Hobbita”, dostaje się też „Terminatorowi”, popularnym serialom z „Grą o Tron” i „Jak poznałem waszą matkę” na czele, a jedna z misji toczy się na Wall Street. Oczywiście, jak to z niemieckim humorem bywa, poziom żartów jest różny - po usłyszeniu jednych gęba śmieje się sama, po niektórych człowiek czuje z kolei potrzebę uzupełnienia płynów w organizmie - w ogólnym rozrachunku jest jednak bardzo dobrze. Ma w tym zasługę także polskie tłumaczenie, przygotowane z odpowiednią dawką luzu i kreatywności.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052616132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2565, 'last_played': 1509215934}
review:
Now that i have played over 40 hours in the game andfinished the campaign  i feel that i can give an honoust review about this game.

For starters...to all of those that are looking for dungeon keeper 2. Go buy dungeon keeper 2. This is not dungeon keeper 2 but this is a very fun game to play.


So the pro's. 
The game is genuinly fun i had a blast playing it. Yes there is a campaign and the narrator willkeep informing you about that if you daddle around too long but you can take all the time you want to build up your dungeon and troops and place some defences if you desire so,
I personally like the narrator's humor. The closer you get to the end the more insulting he gets.
I also like the style of graphics, yes it is cartoonish but i like that style.

There are however a few things that are a bit annoying at times.
Mostly the loading times. It takes ages to start a new level.
And maybe this was just me but in the later levels for some strange reason sometimes units just get stuck in one place while they are in the overworld. For some reason they do not understand that they can walk around a tree or a fox or whatever it is that is in theyre way but they just stand there and do nothing.
Neither of these con's are so bad that they break the game in my opinion.

In conclusion i give this game a big thumbs up and do hope that the guys and girls that worked on this game are planning to make another one cuz i really enjoyed myself it was a blast. So a big thank you to the developers of this game en keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059743609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1438490901}
review: It was a fun game brought back some memories of dungeon keeper.  There are a lot of simularities.  The campaign is lacking took around 16-17 hours to complete it and that was at a slow pace.  The narrator isn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be.  Yes there's a few adverts and several puns but I laughed at all of them.  I grabbed it at the 50% off sale and was def worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006780411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1471837986}
review: Amazing! Loved every minute of it! I missed Dungeon Keeper from back in the day and this was not only that and then some, but also extreamly funny. The WoW, LotR, and GoT references from the narrator were great, tons of puns! I highly recomend this game if you are looking for something to relax with and you have your small dungeon kingdom to micro manage, can raid the surface world and all while enjoying the comical story. The Horde / Chaos flip is nice, sets the stage for more to come and with the non "Litch King" figure they've set this up for some great DLC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012664163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1435516289}
review:
trop facile durée de vie trop courte. 
points positifs plein d'humour et pas de prise de tête...
que le jeu parodie game of thrones ok c'est marrant mais là c'est trop il s'en inspire complètement... on a quelques vagues rappels à d'autres mondes mais trop peu/trop vagues. non le jeu aurait du s'appeler game of throne 2....
mode campagne durée bcp trop courte ; une dizaine de map et c'est fini. on a les améliorations d'unités quà la dernière.... 
je l'ai acheté en solde et je trouve que le prix était encore trop cher payé.....
je ne le recommande clairement pas à > 10euros

author: {'steamid': '76561198076702942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1655493662}
review:
Hi! First of all, Dungeons 2 is awesome!!! I loved the concept, arts, interface, humor touch, campaign, the level of customization of each unit seriously congrats! :D 

I think that the reason why people criticize so much this game is because they are not used to the ideia of it, but i loved! I been searching for a game like this for years and i'm extremely happy that i finally found! 

To make it completely perfect i would only allow the player to make his units fight against each other and have some way to make gold and mana unlimited (like one gold ore on the map that never ends) 

I bought, i Loved, and i strongly Recomend!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076397083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1457206626}
review:
Вот решил таки чиркнуть несколько строк дабы есть что сказать :)

Касательно самой игры геймплея, вопросов нет, выглядит шикарно играется приятно. Компанию еще непрошол но надеюсь что она долгая.
Теперь казательно реализации, к сожалению недостатки присутствуют, впечатление от игры больше что это поздняя бета версия и тестили на скорую руку, все проблемы небольшие но неприятные портящие общее впечатление в процессе игры и недающие вволю расслабиться.
Мой конфиг средненький Athlon x4 640 3GHz 4 ядра, оперативной памяти 4Гб, видеокарта GTX 285 с 2Гб памяти
и тормазов от игры такого плана даже на минимальных настроках ну никак неожидал :( К слову Diablo 3, StarCraft 2 идут на максимуме на ура без запинки. Вобщем несчитаю что эта игра имеет право тормозить.
 Вот то с чем столкнулся я:
1) При количестве юнитов больше 10 начинаются микрофризы что крайне печалит так как в некоторые отыетственные моменты просто неуспеваешь сделать нужные действия а в неответственные попасть кудато в нужное место затруднительно.
2) Залипающее меню выбора персов перекрывающее пол экрана и несворачивапемое хоткеем только мышкой
3) правктически незаметная разница между минимальными и максимальными настройками
4) наги постоянно отказываются работать в хрустальном зале
5) отсутствие поворота карты и управления масштабом, что существенно затруднает манипуляции на карте
6) Вобщем игра больше для фана чем для серьезных продуманных быстрых четких манипуляций
7) Неудобная манипуляция с юнитами тоже неспособствует всеобемлещему контролю ситуации
8) Может это и следствия геймпадной какойто оптимизации, но меня как обладателя ящика с клавой и мышкой мешание всего в одну игру печалит.
9) по прошествии 14 часов игры все вот эти недочеты начинают раздразжать т.к. большая часть времени ухлдит на тупое гоняние за юнитами по карте и на выяснение того чтоже надо, чего нехватает и что еще недоделанно.
Резюмируя: игра 10, удобство 6.
За полную стоимость яб брать нестал, а со скидкой 50% вобщемто можно.

review: Много хороших, полезных отзывов было написано, поэтому повторяться не буду) Игра очень красочная, напоминает старый добрый Warcraft 3 с мега реалистичной мультяшной картинкой. Расссказчик с прекрасным чувством юмора не заставит Вас скучать) Слышал проблемы насчет оптимизации-не знаю, у меня таких проблем не было. В общем эта игра самая лушая в своем жанре. Я долго сравнивал игры данного жанра, искал, знакомился и как раз Dungeons 2 самая лучшая! Покупайте пока есть скидка) Очень рекоменую) Надеюсь мои друзья ее купят, чтобы вместе бегать по подземельям))

author: {'steamid': '76561198031503456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1471194192}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043059925', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2579, 'last_played': 1596283606}
review:
Was für ein tolles Spiel! Es lohnt sich auf jeden Fall. Die Grafik ist ansprechend. Wenn man Dungeon Keeper gespielt hat, wird man sich sofort zuhause fühlen. Es ist sehr liebevoll gestaltet und vertont und super witzig. Im Vergleich zu Dungeon Keeper hält es ein paar interessante Neuerungen bereit (die Oberfläche!) und kombiniert wunderbar mit Stategiespielelementen (Warcraft III) 
Und natürlich: Es war ab Release für Linux verfügbar, was ich natürlich besonders gern honoriere! :-)

Nachtrag nachdem ich es durchgespielt habe: 
Es war von Anfang bis Ende hervorragend gemacht. Lange hat mich kein Spiel mehr so gefesselt. Herrliche Dialoge, schöne Animationen, eine schöne Geschichte. 
Echten Strategieveteranen wird es zu leicht sein. Allerdings liegt hier der Spielspaß im Vordergrund denke ich. 
Ich habe mir bei einigen Leveln viel Zeit gelassen weil ich den Dugnon ausbauen wollte. Das wird nicht langweilig. Es gibt eine Menge Technologie zu erforschen und Schnodderlinge (Arbeiter) zu vermöbeln. ;-p 
Ich wünsche jedem viel Spaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057836703', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1430178694}
review:
Terrible game. Far too easy and kid friendly. I have much higher hopes with [i] War for the Overworld. [/i]

The narrator also has a horrible script to work with, and his lines are played again and again until you are forced to mute his voice. This is done in an attempt to force you to your objective, making enjoying the game at your own pace disallowed by the developers.

Gameplay wise the game is just boring. Nice dungeon building mechanics, but taking over the surface world is a piece of cake, as is defending your dungeon.

Recommend it as a game for kids but.. Long time Dungeon Keeper fans? No way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154571454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1434370632}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996379906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1434746607}
review:
I wish I could recommend this game - it has a solid, fun set of core mechanics, and the narrator is quite funny.

Unfortunately, the control scheme and interface are too obnoxious. In the dungeon you have one control scheme, and another on the over world. On the overworld you can select your units in a traditional RTS fashion (drag over them to select everyone). You can't do this in the dungeon however, meaning that if you want to move many units to the overworld, you have to select each on individually, and then drag them each on the dungeon exit. Considering how often you'll want to go back and forth between the dungeon and overworld, all of this micromanagement gets old quite fast.

In addition, the dungeon can get pretty crowded at times, making it difficult to click on the unit/room you're actually trying to access.

Also, there are a number of annoying bugs. At one point I had to quit to the main menu and reload my game because one orc stayed in my hand, preventing me from dropping it or doing anything else. Another time an orc on the overworld suddenly woudn't attack, and no enemies would attack it (but his friends could still attack). 

This is a game I really wish was better. If they fixed these irritations it could be quite fun.

Edit: as one commentor pointed out, you can use the group hotkeys you set on the overworld to select units in when they're in the dungeon. This helps a bit, but when you select units in the dungeon, it automatically moves you to the dungeon view, which gets obnoxious if you're trying to send them to the overworld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010006612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1434694423}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006666597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1435633685}
review:
I really liked this game.

A solid dungeon keeper like experience with some interesting takes on combat with the overworld playing like an RTS.

The story mode is pretty fleshed out and entertaining with it being focused on referencing other fantasy universes in a humorous manner every level. However its a bit short and the campaign only features a couple levels of the other faction which arguably is more entertaining to play as then the default.

The levels reminded me of playing warcraft more then anything, and it felt really good, I just wish there was MORE.


The player vs player isnt well put together in the sense theres no server/game list, simply a code you type in to join eachother or to que up for a "matchmaking" system which doesnt seem to work unsurprisingly and most likely because of lack of players queing.
You can't play online with AI sadly so its either pvp or pve.



All in all worth it on a sale, really entertaining if you like silly references and parody humor and of course if you are in to dungeon keeper like games.
