author: {'steamid': '76561198005899964', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1439308892}
review: I want to love this game, but to do that I'd need to be able to play it for more than 10 minutes at a time, without my PC overheating due it running all 4 cores and the graphics card at 100%. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197993697139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5870, 'last_played': 1473471872}
review:
This is the best game in a long time of gaming. If you loved the Dungeon Keeper series and have been looking for an updated 'better' version to play, this is IT. I have played a few 'clones' of Dungeon Keeper and found them all a bit 'mah' this one however is everything you want in a dungeon management simulator game. It's updated enough to be new and fresh, but keeps to the base of the old game enough to still hit those nostalgia cords.

It does have a few issues performance wise but few and far between, easy to overlook in a game of this quality. 

Definitely a must have for any fan of Dungeon Keeper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 5835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4702, 'last_played': 1590154411}
review:
As a casual RTS fan (Red Alert, StarCraft, 0 AD), I really like this game. I can spend all the time I want building rooms and passageways, or focus more on upgrades and battles. 

Pros:
[list]
[*]Fun to play (isn't that all that matters?)
[*]Evil Obliterated achievement is hilarious ... I went for multiple deaths to hear the narrator complain
[*]Achievements keep you playing (like replaying one of the campaign missions)
[*]Perfection in gameplay/style/strategy not required
[*]The last campaign mission can be played as horde or demon
[*]After playing this enough hours, the value is there
[/list]

Negatives:
[list]
[*]Mouse pointer "hand" is a little clunky
[*]Campaign is shorter than I would prefer
[*]System requirements seem high
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024391681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1608994719}
review:
Slow slow slow slow slow. Takes FOREVER to make progress and that progress is shallow because your hand is held all the way through. 

This game feels like one long tutorial - when oh when am I going to be allowed to make my own decisions and choose how I want to develop? Evey level I've played so far is simply a 'Do what you are told' situation.

I really tried to like it - but I'm just bored of wearing handcuffs. I'm off to play Dungeon Keeper 2 instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971133988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1503532697}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052589717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1434108628}
review:
Es lässt leider die Tiefe vermissen die ich mir gewünscht hätte von einem "Nachfolger" von Dungeon Keepers.
Natürlich ist es sowieso kein echter Nachfolger, sondern eher eine alternative Story im selben Universum welche Elemente von Dungeon Keepers mit "World of Warcraft" und dem Warcraft Universum vermischt.

Augenmerk liegt aber auch vor allem auf den Holzhammer Humor im Spiel und es verarscht so einige Videospiele und Fantasyfilme der letzten 10 bis irgendwie so sicherlich 30 Jahre.

Für jene die nach einem Nachfolger lechzen der ihnen etwas Dungeon Keeper Feeling gibt ist es sicher gut aber erwartet keine Langzeitmotivation. Da fehlen doch eine Menge Features. Es gibt zum Beispiel nichtmal einen Map Editor zur Zeit.
(13.06.2015)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021525299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1435102660}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981341022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1699961744}
review:
Ну что сказать... по Сравнению DK2 DLC (сама последняя версия игры) игра сильно упрощена, чем то напоминает варкрафт со смесью DK2.
Не понравилось:
- маленькие карты
- малый набор войск (4 основных типа + по 2 подкласса у каждого) + копатели (которые стоят денег)
- размер армии ограничен
- нет захвата территори в подземелье и соотвественно укрпеление стен, и проход напоерхность сразу открыт
- манна не может сама по себе добываться, нужны войска
- добыча золота ведеться одним работником на клетку а не 3-я как в DK. Это сильно тормозит процесс.
Понравилось: 
- обновляемые ловушки в авто режиме
- каждый воин, личность со своими характереистиками, и может быть раскачен
- неисчерпаемое золото
- конечно же выход на поверхность
- трансформация земли в антуражл абсолютного зла
- общий антураж DK
- расказчик со своим юмором и веселостью
- графика симпатишная
Итог:
Это упрощенный вариант DK со своими заморочками. Это просто еще один взгляд на владыку подземелья. Вся игра очень какая то не серьезная и веселая. Не хватает ей сложности и черной глубины. Вспоминаю DK карты с зимой, вобще ШИК был.
Да кстати иногда на автосохранении вылетает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013055491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1434025534}
review:
That's a scam, a real scam!

Edit after playing it 2 hours (couldn't have it refund, so I tried to play it to make my money worth the loss a little...
It's even worse than I though, an insult to Dungeon Keeper which I loved:
Graphics are nice but Artwork is not, creature look like poop
Controls are horrible, hitbox sometimes too large, sometimes just can't find it
Can't give order to creatures, no flag of war, no patrol zone, you must micro manage
The narrator must be muted in order to prevent ears cancer (seriously)
Creatures are so ineficient, they want to drown into alcohol all the time, cause money isn't enough
Strategy side on the surface is a mess, past a few units in action, they no longer obey orders and start running amok, fighting like they want.

Couldn't have played more, my will-to-play run out of mana

The game could have been fun if the humour wasn't this bad, the gameplay so clumsy (as oposed to the fun but sharp gameplay of DungeonKeeper)

Go buy Dungeon Keeper if you don't have it yet
Watch gameplay on youtube of this first, like I should have done....

author: {'steamid': '76561197990648012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1527215252}
review: So, this is a game that, through the rough road that Dungeons followed, has ironically come full circle to become a partial shameless copy of Dungeon Keeper. Now you might be saying to yourself, "why buy a game that's a copy of an older game," and normally I would be saying that to myself too, but try playing the old game on a current pc. The reality is that, when Dungeons came out, everone started comparing it to the old masterpieces, and mostly unfavorably. Kalipso seems to have taken the hint, swallowed some pride, and went all out to bring the fun of Dungeon Keeper back to life with a full slate of new and challenging features into the bargain. They had big shoes to fill; we look back at the old games of the good old days, and they seem to have a golden sheen. I believe they actually had to move to a bigger size for this one. The humor is just as good, factoring in the slight nod they've given to a somewhat younger crowd (16 vs. 18 or 21, depending on how prudish you may be), and the style is familiar without being exactly the same. Fighting across different maps makes it challanging and new. They involve the world in the gameplay in ways that DK never could have, and the cute vs. darkish tension makes me laugh, and maybe you too. I look forward to DLC and see hours of playing this in the future. It's just a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003213131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 591, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1495227590}
review:
Alors dungeons 2, je l'avais précédement évalué il y a pas loin de ... 2 ans, et mon évaluation ne le recommandais pas car à l'époque il y avait de nombreux bug récurrents qui m'avait totalement gaché le plaisir et j'avais précisé que je ne réevaluerai ce produit que si, avec le temps passant, les devs les résoudrait alors j'y rejouerai afin de m'en refaire une idée.

Après de très nombreux commentaires de ceux qui me lisent me disant que le jeu avait évolué j'ai finit par trouver le temps de le refaire et me voici donc avec cette évaluation positive cette fois-ci :)

Donc dongeons 2 me rappelle énormément dungeon keeper, à ceci près que le jeu est BIEN TROP COURT ! est-ce une volonté des développeurs de nous mettre du contenu additionnel dans des DLC PAYANTS, ou bien un manque d'inspiration peut-être ... ? Le jeu avait clairement la possibilité de nous emmener bien plus loin que là on l'on arrive à la fin. Fin qui plus est qui peut se jouer avec deux camps différents mais qui, peut-être encore pour des raison de budget, ne bénéficie que d'une seule cinématique étant pour le coup hors propos avec le deuxième camp.

Parlons des mécaniques de jeu, comme dans ma première éval, je regrette que le panneau de recherche soit si LOURD et CHIANT, une fenetre sur la droite/gauche de l'écran qui se miniaturiserai via un onglet et qu'on pourrait agrandir à la volée afin de donner les prochaines recherches se serait TELLEMENT plus simple ... mais ça fait peut-être moin fantasy pour le coup ... enfin bon.

Les soucis de plantages que je rencontrais fréquemment il y a deux ans ont quasiment disparu, un seul retour windows et deux plantages à l'écran de chargement de la mission suivante.
Le souci avec les autosave à disparu, tout fonctionne impec et on peut les mettre toutes les 15 minutes.

Par contre comme à l'époque, si vous avez blindé votre pool de créatures, que vous avez fait toutes les évolutions de populations de créatures via la chambre à mana et que ENSUITE vous explorez le terrain et qu'ainsi un nombre croissant de créatures vous rejoignent et font gonfler votre pop la faisant inévitablement exploser, alors il y aura une baisse de framerate assez considérable, le seul moyen de passer ça est donc de sacrifier les créatures inutiles.
Je regrette que la partie management des créatures soit aussi simple, du moment qu'elles ont à boire et de l'or elle font pas chier, là où dans dungeon keeper il fallait gérer le sommeil, l'ennui, la bouffe, l'or. Je ne demandais peut-être pas quelque chose d'équivalent, mais bon ... bouffe et or quoi ... m'enfin ...

Idem du coté des salles à construire, il y en a trop peu et pas moyen d'être vraiment méchant en torturant des prisonnier jusqu'à ce qu'ils nous rejoignent par exemple, ou trainer les cadavres en décomposition afin qu'il en ressort des squelettes ... en fait grosso modo tout viens du moteur à mon avis.

Celui-ci n'est pas prévu pour gérer un grand nombre d'unités afficher, quelque soit votre config, donc où serait l'intérêt de mettre 50 unité différentes à recruter si au delà de 70 unités au total en comptant les lutins le jeu se met à ramer comme pas possible. Donc on réduit le nombre d'unité différentes, ainsi que les salles qui leur serait utile, on simplifie le tout et on sort le jeu tel quel en faisant semblant que le moteur graphique est incroyable.

Dans l'ensemble le jeu est sympa, il est joli, il est agréable à écouter pour les musique/son, la narration est sympatoche avec le narrateur qui s'énerve quand on ne fait pas ce qu'il dit, franchement je recommande le jeu tel quel.

MAIS ! 

Mais le jeu aurait pû être tellement mieux avec plus de salles, plus d'unités, plus de maps, plus de micro-gestion, PLUS PLUS PLUUUUUUUS !!!!!
Le jeu aurait pû être un incontournable comme le tout premier dungeon keeper, là c'est juste une copie sympa mais sans plus.

A bon entendeur ... ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960494776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1433589437}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007048214', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1433699729}
review:
The game for its current price of 45 euros is to high.

It is a very slow game, not just performance wise ( a lot of slowdowns under 30 fps )
The campaign can be done within 5-6 hours.
The Skirmish maps are a total of 5 and some are direct copies of a campaign map.
The game is very easy, even on immortal ( highest difficulty ) it is far to easy. (v1.2)
A lot of features are to powerfull or no point in using ( Traps of 5 give or take is enough to beat Immortal waves of mobs ) and since its so easy, spells are hardly used or useful.
The story of the campaign is heavely influenced by Game of Thrones and other known series, not much original sides to it.
The Narrorator is to much on the foreground, you can change it but that kind of shows the issue..

I had a much larger and more depth review but it won't post it, you can find it on metacritics.

Played on a Played on Max settings, 1080p 4790K, AMD R9 280x/ATI 5870, 16 gig ram and SSD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044002252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1431844209}
review:
Want a game that tops Dungeon Keeper in comedy?

This is your game. Play as the evil being that destroys all the forces of "good".

Will you be truly evil and decimate your foes or fall prey to fluffy unicorns that fire laser beams through their horns.

Note: This game doesn't have fluffy unicorns that fire laserbeams through their horns. They are just horses that got horny *pun intended* with a rhino.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984935784', 'num_games_owned': 2240, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1439663815}
review:
Боже мой, Dungeon Keeper вернулся!

Тьфу, нет, не так. Dungeon Keeper 3 вышел! Обратите внимание на цифру. Угу. Рогатый не смог выбраться на поверхность в своей линейке игр, но зато восстал в Dungeons 2. 

Забудьте про унылый тайкун из первой части, забудьте про унылое декорирование подземелий. Только наступление, только строительство, только юмор, только хардкор!

Две злые играбельные расы, куча смешных отсылок к фэнтези (найти ледяную Стену и прийти на Красную Свадьбу? Легко!), эволюция юнитов, смешные и опасные ситуации, прекрасная русская озвучка, ПИВОООО. 

Фанатам DK – покупка не рекомендуемая, а принудительная. Людям с чувством юмора тоже. 

Потрясающая игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 4461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1462456452}
review:
[h1]Dungeons 2 vous donne l’occasion de jouer une chevalier noir maléfique[/h1]

Dungeons 2 est tout simplement une merveille !

Vous en avez marre de jouer un héros, beau, gentil, fort, droit, ... et bien, vous n’êtes pas le seul.

Avec Dungeons 2, vous jouez le Maître du mal. Vous commandez aux orcs, aux goblins, aux trolls, etc. Vous avez une chambre aux trésors, une brasserie, une salle des magies, des pièges, etc, bref, tout ce qu’il faut pour gérer votre propre donjon sous-terrain que vous devez protéger contre les aventuriers héros.

Sans compter que vous voulez vous venger et comme tout le monde le sait, la vengeance est un plat qui se mange froid !

author: {'steamid': '76561198049460298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2708, 'last_played': 1521026835}
review:
I loved the original game.  I do love this one - with a few exceptions:
*I miss the jail and being able to create skeletons
*I miss a "Functional" torture chamber where you can turn your enemies.
*The quest is rather short (or I played it so often that it went too quickly.  :D )

I was thrilled when Dungeons 2 came out.  There's  a learning curve (as there is with any new game) and there is not an exact line up with the old game.  Overall, that's good.  It's a new adventure with new fun.  

The text has been "fixed" tho' the info above the heads of the demons is still too tiny to read.  The hints could be a bit more extenstive.  But if you've played the old one, you should really enjoy this one.  

I'm glad I bought it.  I'll keep my fingers crossed for any add-ons or fixes that make that torture chamber useable.  [hint ,hint]

review: 취향을 탈만한 게임  누구나 좋아하진 않을것같다 인터넷에서 미리 게임의 스샷을 보고 결정하길  개인적으론 이게 왜 39.99 달러나 하는지  의문  요즘에 나온 게임 답지않게 그래픽이 후지고 플래이 할수 있는 맵도 스타나 워크3 같은 다른게임 보다 너무 빈약하다 그래도 한글화가 되있는게 쓸만하다 한마디로 이게임을 요약하면 재미없는게임 외국유머 어쩔;;;;;  진심 너무 재미없어 유머맞나;;;

author: {'steamid': '76561198017409605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1604, 'last_played': 1636044614}
review:
I'm in love with this game, it's absolutely amazing and super-fun! 45Euros well spent!

PROS:
+ the art-direction and the animations are superb and who miss Warcraft III will find it very familiar.
+ two factions: Horde (trolls-orcs-goblins) and the demons.
+ the narrator is funny. if you don't like his reminds you can kill this features in the options.
+ awesome dungeon management, it reminds me DK2 (of course). 
+ nice and simple RTS part of the game, when you are outside your dungeon.
+ RTS and Dungeon Management are well balanced, so you don't become mad looking outside of your dungeon and inside it. 
++ even if the game is inspired by dungeon keeper, it's really a great and fun game by itself, with personal mechanics and pros. 

CONS:
- the firsts levels in the campagin are easy, but this is not bad for everyone. In skirmish you can choose the difficulty and there's also the Multiplayer, that I have not tried.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043985256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1509235926}
review:
A modern version of a classic Bullfrog title "Dungeon Keeper", this game is surely to be very entertaining, however, the new version skimps a LOT on the tutorials, expect to be peeved or disappointed because of ambiguous goals and how to attain them.

GREAT modern remake of a classic! I'm still learning how to play the dang thing. Recommended for those who like to slap snots off their lazy butts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065198551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1460892187}
review:
Um es kurz zu machen:
Für Dungeon Keeper Fans ein muss !

Seit der ersten Kampagne schmunzel ich über die Sprüche des Erzählers oder Namen der Monster,
die aus Filmen, Büchern, Serien oder sonstigem kommen, genau den Charm den so ein Spiel braucht !
Die Grafik is mit viel liebe zum Deteil gemacht und ist wirklich nett zum anschauen.
Das Gameplay an sich ist sehr langsam, also KEIN schnelles aufbau Spiel und gleich volle Kampf Aktion,
wobei man immer wieder seinen Dungeon vor Helden Gruppen verteidigen muss, was aber relativ simpel
mit ein paar gut platzierten Fallen erledigt ist.

An sich wär das Spiel ein genialer Dungeon Keeper Nachfolger geworden aber:

- Zu wenig Spiel Inhalt, wenn man darauf Wert legt seinen Dungeon & Monster immer aufs Maximale zu Upgraden ist man mit der Kampagne und den derzeit vorhandenen Maps in 20-30 Stunden durch.
(ohne DLC) 

- Wozu es 2 Fraktionen (mit DLC 3) gibt ist mir auch Schleierhaft, im Original hatte man eine Fraktion und dafür doppelt wenn nicht 
dreifach so viele Einheiten, Räume, ect. zur Auswahl.

- Multiplayer ist zwar vorhanden aber nur mit seinen Steam Freunden ?
Da hätte ich mir erwartet das es einen Server gibt wo offene Spiele gelistet werden und man Weltweit gegen andere Spieler spielen kann und nicht nur über die Steam Freundesliste, echt Schade.

Fazit: 
Dungeons 2  ist es seit mehr als 15 Jahren endlich wieder ein anständiges Dungeon Spiel,
dass mal wieder richtig gut war und lustigen Humor hatte. 

Edit:
Mit den neuen DLC´s, die echt günstig sind, einfach nur noch genial. 
Vorallem Fans der Serie Game of Thrones werden das neue Winter DLC lieben.
Dieses Spiel muss man einfach gespielt haben und gehört in jede Spiele Sammlung !

author: {'steamid': '76561198052831659', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1433057278}
review:
던전을 건설하고 용사들을 막아낸다는 독특한 컨셉을 가진 던전 키퍼 시리즈의 뒤를 이어 가고 있는 던전스 시리즈, 그 두번째 작품입니다. 지난 작품에 비하여, 보다 던전 키퍼에 가까워졌으며, 게임성 또한 크게 향상되어 높은 평가를 받고 있습니다. 향상된 그래픽과 기본에 충실한 게임 구성을 가지고 있으며, 던전 키퍼부터 이어온 특유의 미국식 유머가 아주 잘 반영되어 있습니다. 게임 전반적으로 우수한 게임성을 가지고 있지만, 게임에 포함된 RPG 요소가 미흡하여, 몬스터를 성장시키는 재미가 부족한 부분이 조금 아쉬웠습니다. 던전 키퍼 게임을 좋아하셨거나, 악의 편에 서보고 싶으신 분 그리고 건설 컨텐츠가 포함된 전략 시뮬레이션 게임을 좋아하시는 분들에게 추천해 드립니다.

장점: 독특한 개그 및 유머 요소, 잘 짜여진 시나리오 구성
단점: RPG 요소에 대한 성장 컨텐츠 부족

author: {'steamid': '76561198048367109', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1433060935}
review:
던전 키퍼 시리즈의 후속작 던전스,던전스2
앞에 작들에 비해서 없어진게 너무많고 게임이 너무 간단해져서
딱히 재미를 못 느끼겠음 방 종류도 엄청나게 대폭 줄었고 크립 종류도 엄청나게 줄었음
스펠또한 전체적으로 많이 변했는데 기존작의 스펠들이 999999999조배 나음
캠페인 조차 내용이 확 줄었는데 비해 기다리는 시간은 더럽게 길게 해둠
던전키퍼 시리즈 던전스 의 후속작으로 나왔는데 앞에 작들보다 시스템 최적화 컨텐츠 스펠 유닛
맵 모든게 존나 줄어들었으며 좋았던 점들은 모두 삭제시키고 안좋았던 점들은 그대로 다 가져온 희대의 쓰레기작품 중 하나로 꼽아드림
추가로 버그가 겁나게 좆같이 많음 ㅡㅡ
앞에 작품들 재밋게 했는데 이건 진짜 도저히 쓰레기라고밖에 표현을 못하겠음

author: {'steamid': '76561198033465200', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1489299478}
review:
Что нужно для того, чтобы игра считалась хорошей? Если судить, по отзывам многих игроков, то это:
1. Мега реалистичная графика (и отдельное обновление для графики шерсти и волос).
2. Юмор, который будет понимать лишь узкая прослойка населения.
3. Сюжет, по сравнению с которым Война и Мир покажется детским лепетом.
И т.д и т.п. И для этих игроков второе Подземелье не подойдёт. 

А для тех, кто с упоением играл в 3 WC, 2 DK и просто старые стратегии 90-х, эта игрушка будет прекрасным подарком на много и много часов. Мультяшная графика ни капли не портит общего настроения. Юмор  в игре ненавязчив и лёгок. А русская озвучка –выше всяких похвал (давно вы вообще играли в игры с полной локализацией от разработчиков?).
Сюжет – прост и незамысловат – Вам необходимо уничтожить всё то, что мешает Злу жить и радоваться подземной жизни. За пони на вертеле, кстати, разрабам можно смело поставить памятник. Это шикаааааарно (с)
Моё мнение – 9.5 из 10 сопляков (0.5 за то, что несмотря на невысокие требования, игра довольно сильно грузит систему (хотя это уже претензия к моему компу, который давно пора менять)).

author: {'steamid': '76561197996247758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1431725915}
review:
I would only recommend this game if it's being sold dirt cheap.

The Narrating is great and funny. The gameplay is fun.

The only problem is the very short campaign.

The gameplay and choices in minions isn't that much compared to Dungeon keeper 2. Also, exploring around in the dungeon isn't that rewarding.

Another negative is when playing the campaign, you never run into rival evil doers. Just boring waves of mobs. You can go on the surface aka warcraft 3 simplified mode which is rather boring but unfortunately needed to finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040628088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4237, 'last_played': 1563942151}
review:
I decided to buy this game because I love the Dungeon Lords board game made by Zman Games and Czech Games.  I had heard from a friend that Dungeon Lords Board game was based on a  computer game.  After watching trailers for this game I realized it is either based off an early version of this game or based off a predecessor to this game.  In Dungeon Lords board game you build a dungeon as the evil Dungeon Lord and you have imps to mine gold for you, build tunnels, etc.  The Imps are your snotlings or Minions in Dungeons ii.  You also can build traps in your dungeon and hire monsters like Trolls, Goblins , Dragons, Vampires, Ghosts, etc.  The games are basically the same game almost but in computer format as compared to board game format. 

 As a whole I absolutely love Dungeons ii.  I have completed the campaign and every map including the new ones just added.  I have every achievement except king of the hill and a friend is supposed to help me with that one tomorrow or soon since it's multiplayer.  In dungeons ii which is an RTS (I normally don't like RTS games and prefer turn based strategy so this game is really good for me to like an RTS) you hire snotlings if you are the horde or minions if you are the demons to build tunnels and rooms for you and to mine gold, set traps, admire demons, etc.  You can then do research with goblins or Trolls or nagas or the demon equivalent in their respective rooms.  You can upgrade your dungeon, adventure out into the above world to wreak havoc and mayhem.

After I played the game a lot I decided to read others reviews to see what they thought of the game and I had the same experiences as many of them.  Treasure chests as one person said and I agree are the best trap and they are the lowest level trap.  The reason for this is because the stupid adventurer's in their mad rush for gold will go right after them and not wait for their bard to disable them.  This is not true of any other trap as they will wait for the bard to disable them before adventuring further.  I do like the Rolling stone trap but I think the develops fixed the fact that it could roll over even bards who are immune to other traps.  

The demons as I agree with other reviewers are not as good as the hordelings and here is the main reason why.
The fire demons at the low level are not as good as orcs which are the equivalent.  The other problem is that for the demons the admiration chamber is the same as the hospital and that is where they heal.  With the hordelings you only have to throw beds in a hospital and they will lay down and heal.  However with the demons they have to go to the admiration chamber to heal and it requires a minion to sit there and admire them for them to heal.  Also you have to sacrifice a minion to upgrade the demons while you only have to train the hordes.  So clearly the demons are not as good as the minions must dig for gold, dig tunnels, set traps and do everything else the snotlings have to do but they also have to be a sacrifice to upgrade demons which means you have to spend more gold to replace them and they have to admire demons for demons to heal which means they have more duties than snotlings and slows down their other tasks.  They are clearly inferior to the horde which others have also said.  

I also feel it would be nice for the campaign to be longer and more maps available as well.  Also I was very disappointed in the fact that you don't get an undead dungeon.  When you go through the campaign and get the nagas to join you, then the trolls it adds them to your army capabilities and when you meet the demons you get to play the demons.  However when you fight the undead in the campaign I figured that you would get to play the undead and then you would be able to build Skeletons, Ghouls, Ghosts, Zombies and Vampires in your next dungeon but you never get the option to build those types of units.  Maybe an expansion in the future will introduce this? It would be fun to get that 3rd faction.

All in all I absolutely love this game.  I have heard references to Dungeon Keeper and maybe that is the predecessor to this game and what Dungeon lords is based on but I don't know as I've never played it and didn't see it on steam.  Because of this game I did buy Dungeons i and The dark lord sequel to it but have not had a chance to play them yet but am looking forward to it.  

I would love to see a map creator in this game so that everyone could create their own maps to play.


All in all though I have a few complaints about this game I absolutely adore it and it was totally worth the $39.99 I paid for it.  Or who I am kidding the $39.99 x 3 as I bought it for 2 of my other friends as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978035874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1434609936}
review:
After receiving good feedback from the developers, I've been asked to post this as a review.  

I just bought this wonderful game today and i've put in a few hours already and i'd like to point out a few minor issues i have, and hopefully something can do be done about them.

Issue #1: During the Campaign i went to pickup a unit such as the Orc, i tried to drop him on the guard room so he would be assigned to guard, the demon-like hand was hovered over the guard room area however, the Orc fell on the outskirts of the room and by that happening he was not assigned to the guardroom. I had to re-pickup the Orc and place the hand over the room in a few different directions because i couldn't tell exactly where he would drop, this was more of an annoyance than an issue i suppose.

Issue #2: I really enjoy the narrator-theme-humor, but some objectives are not as easily completed which causes the narrator to constantly repeat the same line over and over again, becomes a bit annoying - specially when the narrator is semi-insulting me for taking my time, again its more of an annoyance than an issue.

Issue #3: The population cap in the first few missions during the campaign really hindered me when it came to progressing my dungeon - I had to sacrifice workers just to build Orcs to defend my dungeon, and then during the naga mission (which i am currently on) I had to go back several times to either sacrifice workers to build more soldiers, or i had to sacrifice soldiers to build more workers, it was a little hindering on progressing, but nonetheless i got through it.

These so far are my only issues, overall excellent game, I'm a big fan of dungeon management games (I've been playing them since the first dungeonkeeper came out before 2003), I'm very happy about this installment to continue the dungeon-like series, the best part is that it combines RTS with dungeon management.

EDIT: The developers are currently working on all of the issues I've listed here, so props to them and appreciate the hard work they're doing. I sure wish other game developers cared this much about their games.

TL;DR

From an avid RTS and Dungeon/resource management gamers point of view, 9.5/10 highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198039618113', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1474959050}
review:
Me termine la campaña en 9 horas, y para colmo descubrí todo en todos los mapas. O sea la hice lo mas lento posible y me duro 9 horas... MUY CORTA y MUY FÁCIL. Nunca perdí una sola misión ni tuve un solo problema de seguridad en la mazmorra, es todo realmente simple, con las trampas solas, ya defendes sin necesitar criaturas.

Me gusto pero es mas un Warcraft en modo fácil... no vale los 40 dolares NI CERCA. Me decepciono bastante la campaña. El Multiplayer  no lo probé pero al ser tan acotado en salas y formas de juego, debe ser bastante básico.

Si hay algo que si rescato y me encanto es el comentarista en Español, es lo mas divertido del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009600535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1588399256}
review:
A beautiful game visually, gameplay and content however are rather lacking.  This game lacks content to the point where it feels more like a demo than a fully-fleshed game.  DLC (hopefully free) would fix this, but at this point I simply could not recommend a game that has barely 15-20 hours of gameplay in it for a whopping $39.99.  The gameplay, although fun whilst dungeoneering becomes tiresome and frustratingly slow once you are forced to leave to the above ground in order to explore.

TL;DR - too short, poor value, great potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015390097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1431992259}

review: Als Fan von Dungeon Keeper 1 und 2 suchte man lange nach einem Spiel was ähnlich gut und Spaß macht. Mit Dungeons 2 hatte die Suche ein Ende. Das Spiel ist sehr gut gelungen, auch wenn es hier und da ein wenig verbesserungswürdig ist. Trotzdem eine Empfehlung für alle Keeper Fans!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968649157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1430286306}
review:
All in all, it's just not fun. The game is split between trying to be a dungeon keeper-esque experience and an RTS, and it fails miserably on both fronts. You're getting a half-assed experience from two conflicting genres and it really bogs the game down.

I also found the style of humor to be pretty dry and unappealing, but I dunno, maybe that part is just me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971974454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1578296882}
review:
If you loved the Dungeon keeper games back in the day you'll love this just as much, its very similar in all regards with minor twists like Horny for the ultimate evil, dungeon heart for the dungeon glowing pit thingy. You can place doors, traps, use magic spells, and 3 different versions of orcs, naga, trolls and goblins to play and toy with. 

Lets not forget the fact you can leave your dungeon and go above ground corrupting the lands as you walk thru them and destroy towns, buildings, kill unicorns and other magic and wonderful things with your evil horde :) .

I would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes to put some hurt on the heroes and wild beasties of the lands.

Awesome Game, Defo worth buying in my books :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198144070572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1431120609}
review: Really fun game I enjoyed it a lot, the mixture of being a dungeon master mixed with RTS based base building and Tower defense style trap making work so well together. The only things I found annoying was the narrator after a while he just repeats script and although it's funny after the 5th or sixth time it gets boring hearing it, Also I wish the game was a bit longer you get the best units later in the game then it seems like 1 more quest then done. But yeah overall I really enjoyed it and if you like these kind of games I'm sure you will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005018437', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1431838665}
review: Game has a solid amount of polish, voice acting is good. The style is very Kalypso, which if you've played Orcs must die you know the art style. Problem is the game just isn't fun. The fun part of dungeon building games is actually building the dungeon. Every map you play comes with pre excavated rooms, and your treasury is determined by where the infinite gold veins are. It's slow, so very slow. Wanted to like it, but it's just so meh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005439390', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 3957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3957, 'last_played': 1482340744}
review:
The game is finally fixed! By Jeebus it took long enough though! I've deleted the old negative review since it's no longer relevant, but this game launched with some real issues and it took a loooong time for the devs to fix them. It's a good game, but maybe wait a few years before buying a Kalypso game in future, apparently that's how long it takes them to fix their bugs... still, kudos to them for coming back and fixing it, I honestly thought they had abandoned it! Great game now!

Some Really Good Things:

=*= Rebind-able Keys!

=*= Runs at a fairly solid 50+fps on max graphical settings in a full dungeon, which is quite serviceable for a management game.

Couple of other gripes, they don't destroy the game but it would be nice if they were fixed:
there's no option to turn off mouse scrolling, so there is a tendency to scroll across the map when trying to select the spells on the bar at the right.

The animations on the lust demons seem to break allot, and are just plain bad most of the time, the way the whips are animated is particularly derpy.

Very occasionally it seems to stop letting me click to mine tiles, it's only happened a couple of times but it's kind of annoying when it does.

Still a really good game though, and I hope they keep updating it to polish out the rest of it's minor flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004496189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1515029693}
review: I just need to say that the game will not even start on a very recent and powerful computer.  Support is baffled and has not responded with a fix for over a week.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997352921', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1436221432}
review:
I tried to like this game, I really did, and in some parts, it was quite good. I liked the old dungeon keeper-like gameplay, such as building rooms, making traps and looking after minions. However, there are a lot of problems with the game, chief among which are the bugs- this game CTD's like no other I've played. Every ten minutes or so in the campaign, it would crash, to the point where I almost gave up altogether.

There are more problems. The campaign itself is too short, the time taken to mine [i] anything	[/i] is tedious to the point of ridiculousness, you only get 5 types of minions per faction (which admittedly can be specialised into 2 further types, but I would have liked more), and the overworld RTS is basic and awkward to get through. The most annoying part of this game, however, is the humour- dated, obnoxious, groanworthy, and all personified in the intrusive and completely irritating commentator.

There are some nice ideas, but they do seem ill-thought out and underdeveloped. I wouldn't recommend buying this game full-price. Wait for a sale or a bundle offer, or better yet play Dungeon Keeper 1 and 2, both of which have better gameplay and atmosphere.

review: I have played many dungeon keeper type games however this one is by far the best. It isn't exactly like dungeon keeper in every aspect however I feel that is why it succeeds. It does a great job at just being its own great game with the same basic concepts of dungeon keeper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000233601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1512160206}
review:
This is a great game. And it certainly brings back some old skool DS1and2 feelings.
Instead of focussing on the good. Because this game is worth a purhcase. i`m going to focus on the bad. You`ll work your way around it from there.

1:  Turtle game. This game is incredibly SLOW. You need atleast 45 min at least to get some sort of base + units going. Because of this. i`d really like it if there was some sort of fast forward or "speed up time" option.

2. Little variation:  Sure the monsters are great. And they Morph/Evolve into stronger versions of themselves. Although I find this a tedious task..it`s the lack of monster variety that does it for me. Wish there where more creatures.

3. Rather short. The campign is about 10 levels long if I remember correctly. Each level takes a while because of Point 1. However it still feels rather short. A second playeable faction is introduced into the game. But they only get like 2 campaign levels.  which...is just sad :( because they are awsome.

4. No end game. Once you complete the campaign. And beat the 3 (yes...only 3)  skirmish maps. The game is really just DONE. There is no reason to go back once you`ve done every level and every achievement. (if yoùre into that. No replay value.

now now...DON`t let these issues bring you down. It`s still a wonderful game and I thoroughly enjoyed playing it.
So I do recomment.  Just wish my feels lasted a bit longer and a little less slowszzzzzzz

author: {'steamid': '76561197969232791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1431718863}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983191722', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1429904481}
review:
Dungeons 2 - Достойный представитель жанра «симулятора бога», с интересной идеей наземного мира и приятным сказочным сеттингом.

Realmforge Studios действительно вложили в Dungeons 2 душу. Это ни в коем случае не Dungeon Keeper 3, разработчики не задумывали делать клон Dungeon Keeper 2, а старались изобрести что-то новое. По большей части – у них получилось. Идея с добавлением наземного мира и разбавление менеджмента элементами классической RTS вызывает одобрение, но к сожалению, не совсем себя оправдала. Однако механика в подземельях выполнена достойно, визуальный стиль и атмосфера фэнтезийной сказки очаровывает, болтливый рассказчик хорошо справляется со своими обязанностями, наставляя и вызывая улыбку, а шероховатости технического плана старательно исправляются разработчиками. Это достаточно простая, но приятная игра, за которой можно с удовольствием провести свободное время. В конце концов, в подобном жанре давно не выходило достойных представителей

Полный обзор можно прочитать здесь: http://ageofgeeks.com/games/dungeons-2-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561197972219840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1696187211}
review:
Incredibly disappointed. Does not live up to being Dungeon Keeper 2's successor. DK2 was much better. I still have it and I'd rather replay it than finish this game.

Why? The pace is VERY slow and boring. This game needs to be fixed. Population of workers and fighters are mixed and the cap is VERY low. 3 orcs does not a horde make. And when you have 25 tasks+ in your dungeon at any given moment 4 workers is not enough. But you can't waste more population cap on workers because you need to defend your dungeon. Everything is incredibly expensive and the pace never picks up.

Don't you tell me about patience. This is a video game but instead of being fun it's a boring drag that wastes up my valuable free time.

It was a good effort. But this is a critical flaw and until it is fixed I wouldn't recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052496875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1444423404}
review:
Very fun, but short game; Even if you take your time through the campaign. Must play for Dungeon Keeper fans. Or fans of god mode dungeon play. I recommend waiting for a sale, cause $40 is double what i would play after giving the game a once through.
Positives:
Similar fun to dungeon keeper. Can go outside of your dungeon to wreak havoc against the outside world. Love that addition. 2 different evil groups to play with. multiplayer option. Cool traps. Warcraft like RTS above ground, and classic dungeon keeper underground. Story was amusing. Taken from Game of Thrones with little to some tweaks in storytelling. "Unique" minion/ henchmen naming made me smile. Glad to have had a newer version of dungeon keeper. just with there was more to it. 
Negatives: 
Overpriced IMHO. After finishing the campaign mode of this game, i would probably pay $20 for this game. Added a lot of cool elements to this game, but as far as replay value, I dont think i'd play this game again anytime soon. Not as much enemy interaction as dungeon keeper besides killing. Spell casting is annoying. Cursor calibration is needed. sometimes, the "click box" on something is impossible to get in a second or 2. Spent several seconds trying to find a block's click zone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147989673', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1675575417}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011051348', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1359, 'last_played': 1478595690}
review: The demon faction is an imitigated disaster. They are incredibly needy, with them slowly trudging to a place for adoration and waiting minutes for someone to come and adore them rather than just chugging a beer like the normal faction. Their system of advancing troops is bugged as well as being poorly designed as is and overall seem like a tacted on afterthought that got very little thought at all. But the real reason this isn't getting a recommendation is because the normal faction isn't much better. Your minions are so slow and so needy that by the time they go and grab their pay they're thirsty and so then they go get a drink and then they slowly make their way back to work where then it is once again payday and the cycle begins anew. I had to build breweries and treasuries right next to each work place if I ever wanted any work done and I didn't want to constantly be ferrying my minions around manually. Good game, poor design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979949701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1474869739}
review:
Simply put, this game is not worth the money, it's maybe worth $5-10.  There is very little replay value, and the single player campaign takes maybe 5 hours to complete.  While it looks like I have 24 hours played now, 15 of those hours are setting at the "Match Making" screen waiting for the non-existent multiplayer aspect to kick in.  The single player campaign has a neat narrator, but again, it's very, very short.

Multiplayer is plagued by terrible design.  There's no lobby selection.  If you want to "Join a Game" you have to somehow magically know the "Game ID."  It doesn't show a list of available lobbies.  It's like match-making circa 1996 when you needed a third party application like GameSpy to connect to anything.  There is "QuickMatch" and by "quick" they make 5-miutes to 10+ hours.  I literally sat in a "quick match" queue for over 10-hours once.

So basically, they game is 5 hours long, and there is no viable multiplayer.  I've managed to play 3 games, and one of them I spent about 40 minutes building before I invaded his dungeon and realized the other player was AFK the whole time.  Likely because he had fallen asleep after being in "Quick Match" queue for some long.

Short story:  Needs more single player content.  Needs match making technology from this millenium.  Matchmaking technology equivalent to cutting edge 1990s games, might as well support IPX for LAN play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995034196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1431536619}
review:
This is a very fun - for a while. However, like many of the other reviews, i'm disappointed in the lack of content for the price of this game. After you play through the campaign of a RTS game, what do you do? Usually head over to multiplayer. This is what I did with a friend, only to find out that there is no AI support so we have to play against eachother. Other than finding two other random people, there is no way for us to be in the same team and start a game. It's so disappointing that AI has not been added in and that has pretty much ruined the game for my friend and I. 

The gameplay is great and I love the idea of having two "worlds" to control - your base back underground, and the battlefield in the overground. Being able to create your own rooms and populate them with workers creates a great sense of customization within your base. 

If you enjoy single-player RTS-like games then I would recommend it, however the campaign is not gigantic and as others have stated it takes only between 15-20 hours to complete, then you're stuck for choice on how to carry on. 

If you and a friend are looking to play this together, do not purchase this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966686661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1431888122}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027044190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1555131410}
review:
This is a brilliant game with good humor and fun gameplay. HOWEVER; If you lose connection with the server for any reason you will be kicked out of your game without saving. 

The message they give you when you get disconnected "Sometimes bad things happen BUD"

EDIT: okay so the error message is just badly phrased and you don't need to be connected to any servers, it's just a crash message. A dev has replied to my review stating that a patch will come out soon fixing the issues.

Oh and the game crashes when I try to save and when I try to load the saves that crash me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996546844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1431888099}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995634822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1487543282}
review:
Много кто пытался сделать свой DK, но это мало кому удалось(про подделку от EA на планшетах даже не говорю). Был Impire, который вышел красивым но ооочень скучным по геймплею + плоский и деревянный как доска юмор. В 2015 вышел в ОБТ War foк the Overlord. Но он тоже не предложил чего-то то более нового кроме духа DK в новой обёртке. Игра хоть и дорабатывается, но механика уже приелась ещё со времён предыдущих частей DK. Первый Dungeons был провалом. Этакий SIms про подземелье. А 2-ой стал капитальной работой над ошибками. Игра хоть и основана на концепции DK, но достаточно самобытна. Но ребята постарались на славу. Есть Орки, есть Хаос, чуть чуть механики DK. + Юмор, много юмора и пасхалок(для внимательных). В русской локализации, озвучивается прекрасным голосом Влада Коппа. А так же приятная графика, хорошая анимация, увлекательная компания и геймплей. Который сочетает капитальное развитие подземелья с стратегией. Без хорошей армии не выползешь на поверхность, иначе дадут "по щам". И каждая миссия не похожа на предыдущую. В итоге это самое достойное продолжение и развитие серии DK.
Моя оценка 9,1/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1430411076}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZrHno7AICLk

The Dungeon Lord is back – and this time he’s serious! In Dungeons 2, fulfil the Dungeon Lord’s insatiable quest for vengeance by recruiting fearsome new monsters from all corners of the underworld in order to undertake his evil bidding. Taking over the underworld isn’t enough though – this time The Dungeon Lord will extend his dominion over the puny humans and attempt to conquer the overworld too! 

Take control of the mighty Dungeon Lord and craft a network of unique and terrifying dungeons, recruit an army of fearsome creatures and command two new factions. Prepare to defend your Kingdom against those pesky heroes, go above ground to wage war on their human cities and use the ‘Hand of Terror’ to take direct control over your minions, issue commands, and even dish out a swift slap to keep them in line. 

The extensive campaign story mode is packed with even more of the dark humour which made the original Dungeons a hit and is peppered with numerous references to various fantasy books, movies and TV shows.  - Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007463342', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1431726050}
review: Humorous, funny and entertaining! I love the narrator, the silly names (the naming-staff must have had a ball coming up with some of the names) and the nudges in virtually every direction to other famous games and the jokes. Things you might consider annoying, like paydays, timers, when to research what, how big rooms you need etc, are a part of the challenge. If you didn't have to think, and sometimes rethink, your strategies it would be rather boring. The pace of the game is perfect in my opinion. I love tinkering with my dungeons, which annoyes the crap out of the narrator (which in it self is funny), and I don't mind the occasional visit from the heroes to test my defenses. This is a properly fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997176611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1431222276}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961522034', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1471338693}
review:
Dig a dungeon. Hire minions. Upgrade your dungeon and units and conquer the overworld. The mechanics and atmosphere are great. I love the concept and the game play itself is pretty fun.

However, the game's performance is abhorrent. It needs serious optimization attention. Normally I get a new game, put it on max settings, and get somewhere between 30 and 60 FPS. Sometimes I have to tweak a few settings to get 60 FPS consistently. In this game I get 8-10 FPS on the lowest settings. It's terrible.

Since the game involves quite a bit of micromanagement to upgrade your units, defend your dungeon, etc., poor performance is super crippling and tedious. Also, there's a ton of input lag and the cursor is very unresponsive and hard to use. Unfortunately these flaws make the game as a whole not fun to play. I think the devs are aware of the performance problem and I hope it gets fixed, but I can't recommend buying this until these issues are resolved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034860623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1494424506}
review:
장점
-적절한 한글화(다이렉트 게임즈). 나름 어색하지 않고 재밌게 번역하려고 들인 노력이 보입니다.
-재밌는 패러디 요소들. 곳곳에서 수많은 패러디를 발견하실 수 있습니다. 포확찢!
-전작보다는 나아진 게임성. 과거 던전키퍼의 느낌을 나름 열심히 살리려 노력한 게 보입니다.

단점
-그지같은 조작. 칼립소 게임들의 공통적인 고질병입니다. 매끄러운 UI와 인터페이스가 있었으면 정말 편하게 했을 듯.
-나름 새로운 요소라고 만든 야외전투. 정말 귀찮습니다. 개인적인 취향일 수도 있겠지만 던전을 지킨다는 개념을 넘어서려다가 오히려 게임을 망친 기분. 게다가 야외전투 느낌은 워크래프트3와 비슷한데 조작감이 몇 배로 구립니다.

총평
-위에 언급한 단점들이 멀티플레이 등 자유도 높은 게임을 하는데 방해가 될 가능성이 높습니다. 그러나 게임을 재밌게 만드려고 시도한 여러 가지 요소들이 이 게임을 돋보이게 합니다. 5점 만점에 3.5점.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029229638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1430885398}
review:
[h1] [b]注意！これはダンジョンキーパーとは似て非なるゲームです[/b][/h1]

[h1]冒頭[/h1]
私は中学生の頃に初代ダンジョンキーパーを購入し、そりゃー熱中しました。
やっとの思いで我がダンジョンにお越しいただいたホーンドリーパー様に少しでも快適にお過ごしいただくため、
あの手この手を使いましたが、戦闘の最中に図書館で味方のウォーロックを惨殺しているホーンドリーパーのアホを見てマネジメントの重要さを中学生ながらに痛感し、なんとも言えない気持ちになったもんです。

しかしながらこのDungeons2というゲームは上記のような気持ちにさせてくれるゲームではありません。


[h1] 概要[/h1]
本件レビューはダンジョンキーパーとの相違点を主に記載したいと思います。

[olist]
    [*]ゲームの目的について
　　ダンジョンを運営し、力を蓄え、侵入してくる勇者たちを蹴散らすところまでは同じです。
　　Dungeons2では、それに加えて地上へ侵攻し征服するという目的が加わります。
　　また、後述しますが運営と侵攻では操作方法が全く異なります。
　　
    [*]ダンジョンの運営について
　　自由に地下を掘り、区画整備の上施設を敷設する。これは両者に共通するところです。
　　しかしながらプレイフィールは全く異なります。
　　まず、ダンジョンキーパーにあったようにユニットに憑依するなどして直接操作することはできません。
　　Dungeons2では、プレイヤーは主人公の手のアイコンとして表示され、ユニットを持ち上げて目的の場所に移動させるか魔法で招集をかけるかでしかユニットの行動を制御することができません。
　　（ユニットをひっぱたいて作業効率を上げさせることはできますが・・・）

    [*]登場するユニットについて
　　ダンジョンはオークやゴブリンなどといったグリーンスキンが主体となるものと、デーモンが主体になるものが用意され、
　　それぞれに５種族ずつが用意されています。
　　この５種族の内ひとつは労働専用のユニットであるため、残る４種族を用いて戦うことになります。
　　これらの種族は予め用意されており、キャンペーンを進めることによって雇用可能になります。
　　Dungeons2では雇用はすべてダンジョンの心臓部で行われるため、ダンジョンキーパーのように特定の種族を召喚するために環境を整える必要はありません。

　[*]侵攻パートについて
　　Dungeons2では人間が侵入してくるダンジョンの出入口が人間界のマップとつながっており、画面両端に表示されています。
　　この人間界側のマップにユニットを移動した場合にユニットの直接操作が可能となります。
　　操作についてはお馴染みのRTS方式で、ドラッグアンドドロップとポイントクリックを合わせて操作することになります。
[/olist]

[h1]感想[/h1]
[olist]
    [*]ダンジョン運営について
　　まず、施設の数が少なく、さらに異なる２つのダンジョンにおいてもほぼ共通していて代わり映えがありません。
　　相性の悪いユニットと部屋が近いからといって殺しあったりしませんし、区画がグチャグチャでも誰も不平を言いません。
　　これによりダンジョンを設計することに頭を悩ます楽しみも奪われてしまっています。
　　特に個人的に残念だったのは、ユニットの動きに特色がないことです。
　　ユニットはみんな真面目で、サラリーとビールさえもらっていれば機械のように働きます。
　　サボりも、共食いもせず、面白半分にニワトリを虐殺したりもしません。
　　必然的にプレイヤーがすべきことは、採掘、開発及びユニットの訓練、施設の建設、防衛・侵攻の指示の４点に絞られます。
　　ダンジョンキーパーにはそれぞれのユニットがそれぞれの個性や好みを持っており、それが様々な問題を起こしもしますが
　　それこそがユニットへの一抹の愛着を生じさせる大きな要因となっていたように思われます。
　　残念ながらDungeons2にはそれが全く抜け落ちています。

    [*]ユニットについて
　　せっかくグリーンスキンとデーモンの２勢力を登場させているのに、上記のようなユニットの個性付けがないことから全くと言っていいほど代わり映えがしません。
　　ゴブリンとインプ、ナーガとサキュバス、オークとフィーンド、トロルとカオスウィーバーと言った感じで、異なるのは見た目と、ほとんど使うことのないスキルくらいのものです。
　　それぞれに相性があったり整えるべき環境があったりということもありません。
    
　[*]RTSパートについて
　　侵攻の際のRTSパートなのですが、これでも勝手ほどに操作性が悪い。
　　UI周りについても、ちょっとこれホントにKalypsoが手がけたのかなぁというくらい使い勝手が悪い。
　　せいぜい数十体のユニットを動かしているだけなのに、ユニット単体を個別指定することすら大変。
　　特定の種類のユニットだけを動かしたい時も、いちいちショートカットキー使わなきゃいけないし、非常に面倒な作りになっています。
　　その上、上記のようにユニットの個性が薄い上、単位指定してスキルが使用しづらいことから、ユニットが雑多に殴りあうだけの極めて退屈なものになってしまっています。
[/olist]

[h1] 総評[/h1]
ダンジョンキーパーやAZITO、勇者のくせになまいきだ。のようなゲームを愛し、求める人には決しておすすめできません。
このゲームはプレイヤーが試行錯誤を重ねて、独特なダンジョンを生み出すというゲームでは全くない。
このゲームのダンジョンとは、愛すべきモンスターたちの息づくねぐらでも、プレイヤー自身が創りだした生態系でもなく
単にクリアに必要なユニットを整えるまでの間防衛すべき生産拠点にすぎません。
ユニット同士が織りなすドラマもなく、いちいち世話を焼いてやらなければならない手のかかる手下もいません。
見た目こそダンジョンキーパーのようになっていますが、長所はほとんどスポイルされています。
よって、このゲームはダンジョン運営ゲームとしてもRTSとしても選択する価値がないといえるでしょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027874703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4363, 'last_played': 1430933109}
review:
먼저 말해 두지만 이 게임은 확실히 취향을 탄다.

던전 키퍼류의 게임을 즐겨 했거나,
RTS 게임을 하더라도 '모든 자원은 다 캐버린다.' 같은 생각을 가진 사람은 즐겁게 할 수 있지만, 그렇지 않은 사람에게는 특별히 권하고 싶지는 않다.

처음 게임 정보를 접하고 내 취향에 딲인거 같아 바로 구입 했더니 생각지도 않은(사실 그만한 정보도 찾아보지 않을 정도로 충동 구매한....) 상태 였는데 인터페이스와 자막 한글화가 되어 있어 놀랐다.

게임 시나리오는 뭐랄까, 서양 게임이나 드라마, 특히 왕좌의 게임을 재미있게 봤다면, 노골적인 패러디에 많이 웃을 수 있을 것이다.

아래 다른 평가 글에서는 게임 작동이 불안 하고 버그에 관한 이야기가 있었지만, 최소한 내가 게임 하는데 치명적인 문제는 없었다. 아마도 최신 패치로 많은 개선이 이루어진 듯 하다.
일부 유닛의 상태가 마이너스 값이 되어 버리는 경우는 있었지만 세뇌 마법을 사용 가능 하다면 해결 할 수 있었던.... 일단 자동 저장을 끈 상태로 모든 시나리오는 완료 했으니 해당 부분은 이제 큰 문제 없을 듯 하지만, 단지 동일 객체가 다량 존재할 때 랜더링이 불완전 했던 부분은  최적화 관련하여 아쉬웠다.

그리고 가끔 폰트가 깨진다는 것은 스케일 폼이라는 uI 미들웨어의 버그라서 뭐라고 말하기가....

플레이 팁이라고 할까, 아니 나처럼 삽질하지 말라고 알려주기 위해 한가지 정보를 주자면.

자원 타일 중 '보석 포함 금광' 타일이 있는데. 이것을 다 캐겠다는 시도는 하지 않는 것이 좋겠다.
해당 타일 하나에서 정확하게 21만7천 까지 캐보고 포기했다....

author: {'steamid': '76561198012377818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1451147940}
review: Ich finde es ein sehr gutes Spiel. Anfangs habe ich mich noch gestört, dass man die Kreaturen erwerben muss, statt sie einfach wie im Klassiker geschenkt zu erhalten :). Die witzige Aufmachung in der Kampagne und die Upgrade Möglichkeiten haben mich dann aber vollends überzeugt. Ich würde es jederzeit wieder kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963410994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1430843866}
review:
Dungeons 2 has all the stuff for a good game, but the stuff hasn't been used to create enough content. I read somewhere that it has about 20 hours of campaign and I actually thought that it was a glitch when I couldn't continue after the last mission / 10hours of playing. I honestly felt like the game had only just begun. I tried some skirmishing after that, but it felt like playing exactly the same content over and over again.

I wouldn't rate the game as "not recommended" if the price tag was right, maybe something close to 10€, but 45€ is way too much to pay for this short game. It should have had 20 or so more missions with different races and with some sort of storyline between them, Frasierish narrator doesn't make up for all that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029312833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1477928684}
review:
This game could've been something good. The "campaign" is a long ass tutorial that ends when the cheesy story ends. The graphics and dialouge cannot decide if it wants to be campy, funny, dark, or terrible for the sake of being terrible. It is for sure immersion breaking. When you accomplish a task it doesn't feel like you did because the narrator has berated you to finish it and the rewards you get are more tutorials.

Besides the campaign being god awful, the dungeon management is terrible. Digging is the only thing that can be done with ease. Managing you minion pool requires picking them up and dragging them around with the bulky "cursor". The 45th time you accidentally grab a barrel of beer instead of a minion or click on a room you'll curse so loud your neighbor will pound on the wall. There is no list of your minions and everything about managing them is clumsy. Picking them up  or giving them books, to upgrade them, is enraging as they hustle about. There is no pause function to easily grab anything or to take a closer look at any dangers.

The 3 traps make for a terrible tower defense aspect of the dungeon management genre. The rooms allow you to stockpile whatever you want with ease and with no challenge. Upgrading random aspects of your minions is of no consequence and unlocking useless spell after spell is pointless as (that work only half the time and only in specific places btw) you have to cast them with the clumsy cursor. It doesn't require any strategy here, you can complete any mission by ammassing gold and mana and sending a horde of minions to roll over everything. Make a couple trap rooms filled with explosive treasure chests and you're safe as well!

This brings us to the overworld where it turns into a terrible RTS game instead of a dungeon management game. There is no way to select your minions by type or any other way than a click and drag box group or by singularly clicking them, making their skills useless as trying to click them (with the clumsy cursor) in the heat of battle is more trouble than it's worth. Send a bunch of minions up by taking 5 minutes to grab and drag them to the exit (which is a fun and engaging game mechanic), selecting them all and sending them on their way to pummel everything in sight is how this part works.

There is no reason for this game to cost 40$, if the publisher says anything about how they'll handle this game there will be many tiny DLC released with single units or missions that might flesh it out but I won't pay a single more red cent for this abomination.

How this got good reviews anywhere was either by pay offs or them not paying any attention to what they were playing. Do not get this game, it is the kind of game you'd get in a bundle, not something worth this price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960564628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1431282471}
review: This is my first time playing a dungeon manager/builder game such as Dungeons 2 but I am having fun in my first 20 hours. A quick read of a game review on kotaku prompted me to purchase this game after it mentioned Blizzard's Warcraft RTS series. If you’ve played other real time strategy games such as Warcraft or Starcraft, then the learning curve for Dungeons 2 should not be very steep at all. So far I've only played the single player campaign missions, and while the storyline is neither compelling nor immersive, it is entertaining nonetheless. While I have only played the campaign mode so far, most of that time has been spent designing, building, expanding, and making my dungeons look aesthetically pleasing while remaining efficient instead of going straight for the mission objective. With that being said, I found that both the room/building and the unit diversity to be a bit lacking. For example, there are eight different types of rooms that can be built once the third and final tier is unlocked. A room is either a production facility or what the game calls a “room”. Some “rooms” have multiple structures that can be built, but do not require a research path to unlock different structures. For example, when playing as the horde, a hospital can both restore health to units over time, and revive units that have died in the overworld (outside of the dungeon), but the revival feature is researched at the tinkerer’s cave so no investment into whether the hospital room will act as a recovery unit or revival center is required. Therefore it often feels unnecessary and excessive to have a hospital at two different areas of your dungeon. Similar to my opinion of room diversity, there are only five units to choose from (one of them being a worker unit). The other four units can be upgraded upon reaching the next tier. If you count the upgraded versions of the units as a new unit, then there are actually 13 different units in the game.  With that being said, and despite my criticisms of the game, I’ve still logged 20 hours of gameplay and they have been a fun 20 hours (keep in mind that I have never played a dungeon manager/builder game before) which is why I would recommend this game, especially to someone such as myself who has been eagerly awaiting the next great medieval fantasy RTS, but has never played a dungeon manager game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009124128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1431233996}
review:
first time writing a review but the game is good enough to warrent it.  I will try and be short and sweet since reviews that are pages long usually turn me off.

Pros:

- is what it should be! classic dungeon keeper like play and really brings the game of old alive with updated graphics and new interactions
- simple comedy and entertainment throughout the game in many forms absolutely add to the overall game
- INCREDIBLE support staff; i have never posted on the forums for the game be it a simple question on how best to proceed or technical issues i ran across and not have a dev or other helpful member of the community respond within 24 hours (honestly ive had a response within an hour every time)! for me this turns a great game into an outstanding one.

Cons:

- game is admittedly a tad challenging on user interface.  It can be a bit finecky over hot keys and accepting commands.  Ocasionally i go to cast a spell and the spell wont cast on the enemy becuase it thinks i am trying to cast it on the trap the enemy is standing on, this sort of thing.  
- does have some perfomance issues as well.  Get a "mono" error ocasionally that will cause the entire game to kick me out.  Also has some configuration issues with dual monitor setups and though i am a windows user myself have seen multiple issues if you are on linux systems reported.
- relatively short single player.  I am not much into these types of games for multi player so havnt even attempted multiplayer yet and probably never seriously will.  I am a fairly heavy gamer but also like taking my time with these games i rarely finish a campaign map without having researched literally everything there is to research and having nearly the entire dungeon mapped out, so at the time of writing this it says i have nearly 30 hours on record and im just barely about to beat the campaign.  For me though this is short i completely recognize if i was motivated to do so i would have finished the game easily in half that time.

conclusion?

great game, great support game, not more then what i expected.  I would give it a 9/10 mostly becuase of the support staff and doing what its meant to do so well.  All the cons i see in the game are cons that can be improved with time, and from my interaction with the developers i have full confidence in them being handled sooner than later.  They are saying new skirmish maps are about to be released in the next week or two and the game hasnt even been out a full week yet.  While i am sad the campaign isnt longer (maybe it was just becuase i was younger and less skilled but i remember dungeon keeper 2s campaign being WAY way longer) i have no reserves at all on spending money for an expansion/dlc if they release one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006497701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3643, 'last_played': 1703093190}
review:
Wer kennt das nicht?
Da will man einen Dungeon aufbauen und dann kommen elende Helden die einen die Stimmung versauen wollen.
Sei es im großen Dungeon Keeper oder anderen Ablegern dieses Genres, immer wieder sind sie angekrochen gekommen und wollten unsere Schätze klauen und haben dabei unseren Geschöpfen übel zugerichtet.

Nun haben wir die Gelegenheit uns an denen zu rächen.
Wir halten sie jetzt nicht nur mit unseren Fallen auf oder verprügeln sie in unseren eigenen Wänden sondern wir schicken unsere Monster an die ekelhafte Oberwelt voller grüner Wiesen, Einhörner und Gutmenschen um sie den Erdboden gleich zu machen.


Dungeons 2 spielt sich wie die meisten Dungeon Manager Spiele.
Man hat einen Hauptraum (hier den Thronsaal), buddelt sich Gänge und Räume, Schurft nach Gold, sammelt sich Monster an, verprügelt die Helden die sich in deinen Dungeon verirrt haben und Zahltag.

Jetzt allerdings kommen die Dinge die es von anderen Spiele des Genres abheben:

Die Monster werden über den Thronsaal gekauft und laufen dir nicht zufällig zu.
Die Räume die man Baut bestimmen allerdings welche Monstergruppe man kaufen kann.

Damit wären wir auch schon bei den Monstergruppen, es gibt insgesamt 4 (+1 für die Diener/Arbeiter) Monstergruppen.
Jede Gruppe erfüllt im Dungeon einen bestimmten Zweck, die einen stellen Materialen für Fallen her, die nächste ist für das Mana zuständig, dann gibt es eine Gruppe die Upgrades für die Monster erforscht und dann gibts noch eine Gruppe die andere Monster "motiviert" effektiver zu arbeiten.
Jede Gruppe wird durch ein Monster dargestellt, was erstmal wenig klingt aber jedes Monster hat 2 Stufen zu denen es ausgebildet werden kann (wodurch man pro Gruppe auf 3 Monster kommt).

Als Beispiel: in der Horde Fraktion (gibt derzeit auch die Dämonen Fraktion zu spielen) gibt es einen Ork (typischer Nahkämpfer), dieser kann zu einen Ork Hauptman (der ein paar Zauber bekommt) oder eine Ork Eisenhaut (sehr zäher Kämpfer) Ausgebildet werden kann.

Bei anderen Gruppen verhält es sich ähnlich nur mit anderen spezialisierungen (heiler, fernkämpfer etc.)

Auch ein großer Unterschied ist das wir diesesmal in der Lage sind unsere Monster an die Oberfläche zu schicken und dort der Welt zu zeigen was wir von ihnen halten.
Hierbei nehmen wir in ganz gewohnt unsere Monster in die Hand und werfen sie aus der Tür, ab da kommen wir aus unserer gewohnten umgebung an die Oberwelt und zur RTS (Real-Time-Strategie) Steuerung.

Dort lassen wir unsere Horden die Lager der Allianz zerstören, ist ein Lager zerstört haben wir den Teil der Oberwelt erobert und sie verändert sich (Flüsse werden zu Gift, Bäume verotten, die Erde bricht auf und Lava scheint hervor etc.)

Auf diesen Gebiet können wir auch unsere Zauber wirken und ggf. schon Heldengruppen dezimieren bevor sie überhaupt unseren Dungeon erreichen (sehr nützlich um diese lästigen Barden los zu werden die immer unsere Fallen entschärfen).

Soviel zum Gameplay


Die Kampange hat mir persönlich sehr viel Spaß gemacht, der Humor hat bei mir gezündet und hab teilweise Tränen gelacht zumal die Macher sich selbst manchmal nicht ernst nehmen.
Dieses Spiel kann man getrost als Satire an die Fantasy Welt sehen da es so ziemlich alles durch den Kakao zieht was Rang und Namen hat und der Erzähler hat einen Großartigen Job gemacht (wer "the Stanley Parable" kennt wird den Englischen Sprecher kennen).

Neben der Kampange wartet das Spiel auch mit einen Mehrspieler Modus und einen Skimrish Einzelspieler Modus auf.
Derzeit sind es noch wenig Karten aber die Entwickler wollen noch weitere nachliefern.

Dazu muss ich noch sagen das die Entwickler sehr eng mit den Spielern zusammenarbeiten und auch ziemlich aktiv in den Foren sind. Sie freuen sich auch über jede Anregung die sie bekommen und haben stets ein offenes Ohr für Wünsche und Vorschläge.
Sowas findet man derzeit selten und ich finde es ist definitiv erwähnenswert.

Aber am besten ist immernoch man macht sich ein eigenes Bild, also guckt euch evtl mal die Twitch Streams von den Entwicklern an (haben dort zu jeder Fraktion ein Video, dazu noch Mehrspieler usw.), schaut ein LetsPlay oder am besten kauft es euch und spielt es ;D

Hoffe es hat euch etwas geholfen und viel Spaß beim zocken.

P.S.

Winter is coming...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030693229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1500523021}
review:
Why do I recommend this game?

1.  The gameplay reminds me very much of the old DK series.  I know the comparison has been done to death but there it is.

2.  I love the somewhat cartoonish art style.

3.  As of this writing, the overworld RTS part isn't fully fleshed out control-wise as it's missing some pretty common controls (like subgroup selection).  That's supposed to be patched in soon.  Still, it's nice to not just sit in the dungeon waiting on heroes.  I like taking it to them for once >:).

There's been some complaints you've no doubt seen in negative reviews.  I will say this.  I like the narrator.  He's funny.  Does he nag me a bit too often sometimes?  Yes.  Do I mind?  Not really, no.  Does he advertise for other Kalypso games?  No.  I've heard that maybe once and it was clearly a joke.  Everything else he says is a joke so why would that be the one thing taken seriously?  Finally, I have had no performance issues thankfully.  I don't have a beast of a computer (low-end core i7, 12 GB RAM, R9 270X 2 GB card) but there's no overworld or dungeon lag for me so far.

Anyway, if you're looking for a fun and funny game that has you building a den of righteous evil from which to strike out against the so-called "good guys" look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021407401', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1509484127}
review: Не играл в первую часть, но игра понравилась своим юмором, хоть графика и на уровке Warcraft 3. Рассказчик, он же квестгивер, не даст свернуть с пути истинного. Будешь тупить - обзовет туповатым, сделаешь что-то раньще чем он прикажет - пожюрит) Напрягает, что каждого юнита надо вытаскивать отдельно, нельзя создать какую-то статичную группу и вывести на поверхность одним кликом, как это бывает в классических РТС. В целом, игра забавная и не требует уственных усилий, чтобы в нее играть, самое то для свободных вечеров, если таковые имеются. 9 сопляков из 10.
