author: {'steamid': '76561198047757892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1455099598}
review: First and for most if you are looking for a hard game then look elsewhere as this is a very easy game with only one difficulty setting. However if difficulty isn't your focus and you would like a creative, fun, interesting take on a dungeon builder game than this is the game for you it is well polished and though simple game that gives enough diversity to keep things fresh. all in all its a very well made game and i enjoyed my time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034238518', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2989, 'last_played': 1451234559}
review:
Epic Fail.

Thats sad to say but its true, i was looking out for a new Dungeon Keeper game but this aint it.

This game is very fun for about 1-2 days, then its trash.

Why its trash??

The multiplayer thats why.
We live in 2015 where online gaming is a standard.
And then this game development team comes up with the most idiotic multiplayer mode.

You can only create games for friends and join games with an ID nummer :D.
Really?! Yes really.

Ooh no but thats not true you have a Quickmatch option, oooh goodie so we are safed??

No, you're not.
The Quickmatch option knows only 1 map ( ALWAYS the 1vs1 map)
I can dream that map by now.

And trust me this game is SO easy skirmish and campain are only for kids.

So unless the lazy game crew start fixxing the multiplayer, you can throw this game outside the window. 

Nice try but this fail proves AGAIN an most undesired fact, they just dont make games like they used to..........

author: {'steamid': '76561197969420586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1457246809}
review:
Great game and I highly recommend it.   The company made good on bringing back Dungeon Keep or a clone of it.   Don't read the IGN review, the reviewer didn't play the game or was really really stupid.  It’s nothing like he said in his review.     The best way I can sum it up, is the "underground" part is just like dungeon keeper.  You break out the ground and make rooms, mind gold and later mana and build your army and protect your base with doors and traps while building your army.  Then you send your troops to through the entrance(s) and you attack other army’s or bases above ground.   The game play is very much like Warcraft 3.  You have a small army and they have different abilities etc.   So think of a mix of Warcraft 3 for the above ground and a great clone of dungeon keeper below.   Also as a bonus you get to play the good guys AND the bad,  there is multiplier,  AND skirmish.    

I wish the campaign was a little longer (10+ hours and I didn’t rush and had some big army killing setbacks )  but the developer seemed to state that there will be more,  so let’s hope they don’t rip us off for DLC like every greedy ass game company does these days.    The other small grip is you have to keep leveling up multiple times (your dungeon and your “monster” population cap) and it takes time away from doing the other fun parts.   You get 4-5 different “type” of monsters,  and then get to level them up to different versions.   I have mixed feelings about that but it didn’t detract to much of the game, but plays more like an RTS where you ramping up your army before sending them to kill the enemy or get slaughtered. 

Overall a GREAT game and if you’re on the fence, just buy it, it IS a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962719678', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1430611311}
review:
Kurz: 
Das Spiel ist genial.

Lang: 
Ich möchte eine pro und kontra Liste vermeiden, diese wird dem Spiel nicht gerecht.

Zur Technik sei gesagt, dass einige Leute Probleme mit der Performance haben, ich selbst konnte mit voll ausgebautem Dungeon mit 30-45fps spielen. Da muss noch ordentlich nachgebessert werden.

Die Bedienung an sich ist an einigen Stellen etwas "unfreundlich", aber die Entwickler haben bereits angedeutet an Verbesserungen zu arbeiten.
Sonst sind mir weder gravierende Bugs, noch abstürze aufgefallen.

Wer englisch spricht, sollte das Spiel auf Englisch spielen, die Stimme des Erzählers stammt von Kevan Brighting, die Stimme wird den meisten aus dem Spiel "Stanley Parable" bekannt sein. Auch hier hat er einen sehr guten Job hingelegt.

Das gameplay an sich ist relativ langsam, und dies ist auch ein Grund warum es vielen nicht gefallen wird. Wer auf Aktion getrimmt ist, wird sich hier schnell langweilen da das gameplay immer gleich abläuft: 
Gold sammeln -> Aufbauen -> Gold sammeln -> Upgraden -> Gold sammeln -> alles ausgebaut -> Angriff.

Wer sich 1-2 Stunden damit beschäftigen kann alles auszubauen wird seinen Spaß haben.

Das Beste für mich persönlich ist allerdings der Fakt, dass ich viel lachen konnte. Dungeons 2 schmeißt mit Parodien auf andere Spiele/Bücher nur so um sich. Dazu nehmen sie sich selbst auch ein wenig auf die Schippe.

Die meisten negativen Stimmen im Steamforum führend entweder auf die Technik, oder schlicht auf den Grund das die Leute nicht mit dem gameplay klar kommen (Da viele nicht mehr das "langsame" gewöhnt sind).

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad könnte durchaus stärker sein, ich hatte keine Situation in der es mal "knapp" wurde.

Für das gesamte Spiel habe ich 14 Stunden benötigt. Allerdings habe ich auch immer komplett ausgebaut.
Es sollte durchaus möglich sein in 8 Stunden fertig zu werden.

Wenn man sich auf das langsame gameplay und den Humor einlassen kann, lohnt sich Dungeons 2 auf jeden Fall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007292634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1461474669}
review:
Everything I could have hoped for in a Dungeon Keeper sucessor.

For the most part it moves at a good slow pace, allowing you to craft the dungeons to your liking before being forced too deeply into the overworld portion of the game (which plays like a WarCraft 3 style RTS).

The campaign is fleshed out, with very few bugs, and is funny as hell!
It is a love letter to plenty of fantasy tropes and fantasy pop culture, while also having an art style and narrative charm that stands on it's own.

Overall, I would say it is a deep and satisfying experience!
Can't wait for more!

P.S.  "Winter is coming..."  ;p

author: {'steamid': '76561198006732351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2537, 'last_played': 1514676427}
review: Its so good to see someone pick up the mantle left abandoned when BULLFROG games went under. I have missed the "dungeon master" genre of games very much and this one kept up with every aspect of the games I loved when I first got into them. Dungeons 2  is a dungeon builder that is extremely balanced and has a solid line of progression from one level of play to the next.  There are a couple points where the narrator gets a little testy when you dont follow the games line of progression, but that's a minor thing.  Using the traps takes a little practice, but when you finally get the hang of them.. its fun to watch the heros waltze into your house of pain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038808269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1430587469}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197990214857', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1456315646}
review:
Currently the game is poorly optimized, I've not a big laptop (i5, 8Gb RAM, GT635M with 2Gb), but usually works fine on the 200+ games I've on Steam, but this one is unplayable even at lower settings. 

And be the way, don't try to post the official support forum about the issues if you don't want be trolled by some people, quite disapointed to see the lack of moderation on a support forum. 

Interseting to see the dev give more support to someone who can run GTAV on his rig but using a cracked Dungeons 2 game instead of a legit customer. 

Will change my review if the fix the optimizacion issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046815611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1453230394}
review:
gran candidato para continuar la saga donde dungeon keeper lo dejo, muy logrado desdeluego. 
las escaramuzas con el mundo exterior le hacen ganar muchos puntos sin duda, las mazmorras estan de lujo y el añadir una segunda raza no esta nada mal.

vamos con las pegas...
como enorme fan de dungeon keeper y ya que sin lugar a dudas este juego aspira a ser el "nuevo dungeon keeper" me permito el lujo de criticar ciertos aspectos que creo que le fallan.

en primer lugar el precio, despues de ver su contenido que no es gran cosa, es increiblemente excesivo en mi opinion, no merece pagar por el mas de 25€ ya que aun con las notables mejoras, la campaña es realmente corta y el multijugador no es precisamente expectacular...
la jugabilidad e interaccion con el juego, aunque por poco, sigue sin estar a la altura del original... y se hecha muchisimo en falta el poder poseer a las criaturas y manejarlas en primera persona...
una gran carencia de las mazmorras respecto a dungeon keeper son varias de las salas a las que se daba muchisimo uso y aqui no existen o carecen de sentido.
la carcel, para castigar a tus criaturas o encerrar a los enemigos vencidos
la sala de torturas, solo la posee una de las 2 razas y se a degradado a ser mero entretenimiento para que las criaturas no se aburran, carece de otros usos como torturar a tus criaturas como castigo o a los enemigos para convertirlos o sacarles informacion.
y mas salas que hecho en falta pero no me resultan tan importantes para su mencion como las 2 anteriores.

en definitiva es una gran base que merece mi atencion para ver como evoluciona, pero de momento es solo eso, una base... por lo cual no recomiendo su compra amenos que se rebaje su precio drasticamente.

solo espero que continuen con el proyecto y lo mejoren asta el punto de poder superar al fin al dingeon keeper original que aunque van por buen camino aun no lo an logrado en mi opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970724472', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1430517330}
review: If you ever played Dungeon Keeper back in the day, then you must play Dungeons 2! Absolutely the spiritual succesor to Dungeon Keeper!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010704360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1475668175}
review:
Let's start to describe the game, in Dungeons 2 you are an evil overlord who controls his creatures and minions to build a big underworld dungeon and your goal is to take over the surface and wipe out the good guys. In your dungeon you will be building different types of rooms to satisfy the needs of your creatures, do research and improve your spells, weapons, abilities, rooms, traps and a bunch of other stuff to help you defend your dungeon and take over the surface. You can pick up and slap your minions and of course mine through the underground and build rooms to manage your dungeon.
Once you get to the surface the game turns into a RTS (real time strategy) game. You will have complete control over your minions and their abilities. Having a good unit composition and formation is key to taking over the surface and wiping out the Alliance (good guys).  

The campaign is fun and introduces you to the game and its mechanics in a nice and steady pace. There are a bunch of campaign maps and they all feel different and fresh enough to keep you interested. What truly makes the campaign shine though is the narrator in my opinion. It's the same narrator from the Stanelys Parable so you might know him. His voice is very clear and he really makes the script looks better than it really is. The humor, jokes and references are all pretty much spot on and got me laughing multiple times during my playthrough, but this will of course be subjective.

Once you have finished the campaign you can jump into skirmish or multiplayer. Unfortunately I haven't played the multiplayer so I can't comment on that. The skirmish is really fun. You are going to play against one AI who inhabits the surface and sends units down into your dungeon. Note that you CAN'T play against annother dungeon lord in skirmish. You will be able to choose from two different factions, the demons and the horde (orcs). They both are well made factions who play differently and have their own distinct strenghts and weaknesses. All rooms, units and spells are unlocked in skirmish after you have researched them of course. 

Now onto some bad parts of the game. The optimization is kind of poor at the moment, once the majority of the map is discovered you will most likely drop frames and changing the graphic options doesn't help. This will of course vary depending on your pc hardware. At the moment the skirmish mode has only three different maps to play which is dissapointing. The developers has told the community that they will release more free maps later down the line though. I have also noticed some people are complaining that the narrator throughout the game advertises other products from Kalypso Media. I personally don't mind it because it happens rarely and it is done in a comical form and there are a lot of jokes and references in the game so I naturaly take it with a pinch of salt.

All in all Dungeons 2 is a very enjoyable game if you are into strategy and/or management games, and it will only get better once a few patches who will adress the optimization and the small map pool will be released.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988180926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 3350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1478529253}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046983828', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1437238345}
review: Für alle die seit Dungeon Keeper 2 auf der Suche nach einem würdigen Nachfolger sind, so wie ich es war, gibt es eine ganz große Kaufempfehlung! Damit nicht genug, dass einige Features eins zu eins übernommen wurden, Dungeons 2 geht noch ein Stück weiter und zwar an die Oberfläche. Hier zerstört man Dörfer, metzelt Heldn und brennt Burgen nieder. Und auch der Humor des Spiels, der gelegentlich auf einen gewissen FTP Titel anspielt oder auch den eigenen Publisher auf's Korn nimmt, bringt einen immer wieder laut zum lachen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062930115', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1508061913}
review:
*In this game, you don't invade dungeons - the dungeons invade you!!!*

Ok, guys. to start with, let's face it, this is a game that DOES NOT take itself seriously. There is so much goofyness, jokes, jibes, pokes and references to other franchises, that it is insane. And in pure goofy fashion, as a game that does not take itself seriously, you are allowed to make the narrator as angry as possible, so that he starts calling you names or take a commercial break just because - HE DOESNT HAVE ANYTHING BETTER TO DO. Sounds fun? To me it does. Add to this the research system, fun dungeon layouts, tons of barrels of beer and you got yourselves a great visual experience and fun gameplay.

The good:
1. Player friendly atmosphere - new and old players will enjoy the goofyness just as much. Like kill your OP hero in a tutorial. LOL. Wait, did I get an achievement for this? Like for realzzz?
2. The art style is gorgeous and very well executed.
3. The easter eggs and references will make you ROFL. Like King's Ending "from" Game of Thrones and Peter Relish the Lord Middlefinger(s)... Add to this references to pop stars, LOTR, shows, etc. and you will be enjoying the other side of the game as much as the game itself.
4. I will repeat myself - angering the narrator has never been more satisfying. Or pleasing him and forcing him to sing your praises.
5. Microing is good, but refer to Bad 3.
6. The Narrator - he did a great job in the Stanley parrable - he is back with the goods (or shall I say goofs!) once again.
And most importantly: 6.1. This game does not take itself seriously, people. Dont take it seriously too. Enjoy the commercial breaks, the narrator getting confused, or quoting franchises that are irrelevant to the game (LotR, GoT), etc.
7. Smiles and laughter. And lots of it :D

The bad:

1. The narrator does commercial messages. While I find it goofy, people may find it offensive.
2. The Narrator can be offensive. You you think he is, go play War of the Overworld.
3. Basic micro wins the game. Like, if you can micro 3 units in starcraft1 or 2, you can win the game.

Conclusion:
While the game is on the pricy side now, I would still recommend it. It is a must buy as soon as it goes like 33-66% off. As a great game that loves goofynees, jokes, and fun, you only need to let it in and enjoy it to the fullest. Accept the game for what it is - GOOFY AND FUNNY. I have never had more fun doing the exact OPPOSITE thing that the narrator wants of me just to piss him off and get him to call me names. If you are a troll, you will like this game. If you want a relaxing game for fun, you will like this game. If you want a very serious game, better go play WotOverworld. It does look more serious, but also misses out on a ton of fun and laughter.

Comment: It is very weird that we get two Dungeon Keeper-esque games one after the other. Could be corporate spying, could be a coincidence. As if I believe in coincidences. No wonder WotOverworld came out first. It is the serious one. You go in, you do you stuff, you win. WotO's narrator is also way more serious. It is the spiritual successor of DK2, even reuses some stuff. On the other side, D2 opts to win you over with goofyness and smiles all around. You choose what you would like best.

Guys play this game. Missions could be mundane at start as if sucked out of the fingers of the creators. Not much ingenuity, but still good fun fun to win. Do not ever doubt that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029895697', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1509398891}
review:
OK, this game is a HUGE improvement compared to its predecessor. It adds the Strategy components that were necessary to make a new-original-on-its-way Dungeon Keeper. Forgetting any resemblance with DK, I can say that this is a good Dungeon Manager, with lots of micro and macro managing, fun campaign that guides you through the basic concepts of the whole game and a multiplayer that shines for simplicity... BUT the main problem that has made me stopped from playing has been the proportional performance drop as your dungeon and creatures grow. My PC is a med-high system that can run almost any other high requirements game in High settings but this game...even setting EVERYTHING off and EVERYTHING to Low, some maps are unplayable from some point where your Underground is Huge and things are happening in the Overworld and other sub-dungeons. 

TL;DR: 
-I'ts a good Dungeon Manager game,but still not Dungeon Keeper.
-I'ts a fairly simple RTS micromanaging game, but not as deep as others.
-The main problem is the performance, that drops as the game goes further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971208048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1508102184}
review:
Dungeons 2 se aleja completamente del planteamiento, un tanto flojo, de la primera entrega y se asemeja mucho más a lo que los fans pedía: conservar la esencia de la extinta saga Dungeon Keeper.

Sin grandes alardes técnicos, una interfaz mejorable, gráficos normales, y falta de contenido, se presenta este Dungeons 2 que sin embargo no es en absoluto mal título y añade cosas tan interesantes como poder salir de la mazmorra y dirigir tus tropas como si de un RTS se tratara.

Posiblemente a día de hoy no valga ese precio, hay formas legales de adquirirlo por mucho menos dinero, y seguro que te ofrecerá unas cuentas horas de diversión. Aunque los chicos de Realmforge Studios deberían afanarse en crear más contenido -y no estoy hablando sólo del de pago-, porque adolece de falta de mapas sandbox y de más tipos de salas y esbirros.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KjUHWaTvk4U

Más información en www.simcitycoon.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198074357605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1503832314}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987934492', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1430044661}
review:
Having played through the campaign and zero amount of multiplayer, I can say the following.

The Good:

1) It's a game that doesn't take itself seriously. Filled with pop culture references, narrated by the Stanley Parable guy (which alone makes it worth buying), the game had me laughing several times.
2) It's a good mashup between a Dungeon Keeper/Overlord type game with a healthy splash of RTS. The unit count you end up controlling is low enough to where you don't get overwhelmed, but still great for those that enjoy group unit control.
3) Great game to stream or record for youtube. People are interested in it, but not a whole lot of coverage.

The Bad:

1) Much more RTS than Dungeon Keeping. If you're just looking to build an automated dungeon, this probably isn't for you. A lot of unit micro-management is needed. This is partly because of my biggest gripe in the game - 

2) Bard render your traps completely pointless. Traps are pretty effective if they go off, however probably like 90% of waves of enemies coming to your dungeon will have Bards who are immune to traps, and disable them in an aoe. The rest of the troop hangs back and just waits for the Bard, and then they just romp through like the traps don't matter.

I have had people say oh, just use spells to burst him down, except that's multiple clicks and usually takes 4-5 hits to kill a Bard (and that's if they're not healed). Regardless of how you can finagle to kill him off, here's the bottom line: Traps are not nearly as cost effective in the game as just spending your money on units and unit upgrades to murder your dungeon invaders, and that's about as disappointing as it gets. About halfway through the campaign I stopped researching and creating traps, and then the game really just turned into a full on RTS instead.

Still, game is worth it, especially if you can grab it on a Steam Sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090589404', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1494548373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025909601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1576959043}
review:
As stated several times, this is a combination of Dungeons meets Dungeon Keeper.  I have played for almost 12 hours, finished 7 missions in the campaign, and still can't get enough.  I do enjoy the game.  That being said, here is what I find that could use some work and/or polish:

1)  Floating hand accuracy is inaccurate - When trying to pick up units in a crowded area, be it tools, beer, or several creatures, it is difficult to grab or highlight the exact creature I want.  The hand "pointer" seems to be around the lower part of the pointer finger close to the palm.  Hard to grab units easily and quickly.

2)  Narrator - While I have found the narrator's humor to be exceptional, there were times I wish he was shut up because he was the one being the "arse".  I like to play out my campaigns over hours, trying to research everything and develop my entire dungeon, and I felt the narrator was trying to keep me on the game's timeline instead of my own.  Also, the advertising for Kalypso games, while funny and original, did get old after the 6th to 7th one.

3)  Unit selection in the dungeon vs. the overworld - I really wish I could select my units in the dungeon as easily as I can in the overworld.  I may be missing a shortcut or other function for selecting in the dungeon, but as of now, having to pick up every unit I want to send to the over world, one by one, is very frustrating.  Especially when I have units set in a guard house that wander over to get beer or pay and I pick them up accidentally and send them to the overworld mission.  It would be nice to be able to shift+double-click on the population count icon to pick up all units of that type into the "hand" and deliver them to the overworld.  Or, let me set the rally banner in the overworld and have the units automatically go to the overworld tunnel from my dungeon.  However Kalypso wants to fix it, I feel it is an issue that should be addressed.

4)  Pay vs. thirst frequency - I found I had no problem keeping up with the thirst demand (experimenting with only 1 dispenser, then 2, and finally 3) and after setting up the 3rd beer producer for a heavily populated dungeon I had excess beer production with no thirst issues, but the pay frequency seems to be, well, too frequent.  I haven't timed it yet but I do know that I was setting up a tinkerer's shop right after a payday hit and it couldn't have been more than 2 or 3 minutes when the next one hit.  With the slow rate of gold acquisition from the "snots", i feel the payday frequency should be lengthened slightly between pay days.

5)  Unit pathing - I noticed when I sent units into combat, more often than not, my orcs at the front of my army would begin moving toward the enemy, come within a few feet of the enemy, then stop for approximately 2 to 3 seconds (while being damaged), then continue foward and engage the enemy.  It has happened on every campaign map I have done and is quite annoying.  I don't know if it's pathing or just a bug, but I feel it could use some attention as it does affect my game play and game enjoyment.  Like I said, it does get frustrating, especially when encountering a large opposing army.

Well, that about sums up what I can remember so far regarding the issues I have found that I feel should be addressed.  Now, on a positive note, I feel the game has been beautifully designed.  I do love the narrator's humor and story telling.  Very unique.  The graphics, though cartoonish, are very visually pleasing and gorgeously done.  The sound is clear and helps me transport myself as if I am really in my dungeon or the overworld area.  Other than the interface issues above, I had no problems adapting to the controls.  I am still working on memorizing the hotkeys for everything (as there are many too remember), but overall the controls are easily learned.

I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys dungeon builders and RTS type games.  If Kalypso could keep giving this game attention and polish in future patches, I believe this game could be a very reliable and popular sequel to the previous dungeon builders many of us have come to enjoy and value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971081191', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2021, 'last_played': 1431090835}
review:
The Good:
-More "Dungeon Keeper"-like than the previous "Dungeons" and more simpler concept.
-Dungeon Management and Warcraft style RTS component.

The Disappointed:
-Limit for EVERYTHING, Monsters reach population limit so easily because minions are including in monster population which it's NOT suppose to, Gold limit is literally limit, in otherhand it increasing the challenge in resource management skill.
-Overworld RTS (Warcraft controlled style) is nothing more than gang your mobs and using skills all the way with the highly limited number of monsters, which each tier have it own skills. So, you have to group every monster type seperately just to manage to use it skills efficiently.
-And the bad news for grouping every type of monster is... very lacking key responsive, which many times have to press more than twice.
-Very low responsive key is hurting magic skill usage too.

Overall:
If you love Dungeon Keeper 2 and capable to tolerate or managing the highly limited resource, this game is a good choice to remember the good feeling the Dungeon Keeper 2 is.
If not, and you love sandbox-like side of DK2 then, this will annoy your shit off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072993279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1430349431}
review:
The spiritual successor to Dungeon Keeper . . . or it tries to be.

On the good side, the game is a dungeon manager.  The theme and graphics are what you'd expect.  Unfortunately, that's where my good experience stops.

So many issues . . .

First off, I was able to beat the entire campaign in 25 hours, and that was with a lot of dithering around and trying to figure out some elements of the interface.  I would not be at all surprised if folks finished up in 12 hours.  For a game like this, I certainly expect a lot more than 20 hours of gameplay in the campaign.

The interface.  Don't get me wrong, the interface itself is fairly easy to come to grips with, but mechanically, the interface doesn't do a good job at all of communicating what it is happening.  For instance, your minions can get upset with you and go on strike . . . ok, fine, it's not a new mechanic in this genre.  But . . . why are they on strike?  I can't click on them, they just stand there.  Just one example.  Upgrading units is another real trial.

The challenge level is the worst offender however.  The game is just dead easy.  I remember having to really rush to keep up in Dungeon Keeper.  I always felt like I was just on the verge on falling behind and being run over.  Not an issue here.  Take all the time you like, and when you feel like the entire deck is stacked in your favor, attack.  Attack falls apart?  No problem.  Just revive your troops and try again.

There are so many problems with this game, a game I really, really, really want to like.  The game has the appearance on the surface of being exactly what folks would want in a game like this.  It just doesn't deliver.  Had I spent $5.00 on it, yea, ok, I'd be like, cool.  Wait for the sale, pick it up, and enjoy it at the price it really needs to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139492415', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1699, 'last_played': 1451830915}

review: So far this game has been a lot of fun. It is a nice mix of dungeon building games (DK clones) and RTS. It is blended together really well. The single player campaign also has a well written and witty narrator. I am only on the fifth level, but at this point I am really enjoying it. If you are on the fence at this point I would say go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988223097', 'num_games_owned': 1352, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1485278150}
review:
If you're looking for a fun and stylish dungeon simulator with some simple RTS mechanics on top, this may be the game for you. This game is not an ultra challenging RTS or fast paced micromanagement dungeon simulator. It is however an extremely stylish and fairly polished playground with excellent voice acting and fantastic animation. Everything about the dungeon feels alive, with creatures amusingly waving to your evil hand as it passes over them, doing yoga in the gym, and generally delightfully cavorting about. The world even changes as you conquer things from ultra-flowery heroic scenery to brooding and mysterious dark fantasy. 

This is a game I come home to play to enjoy a fun and well crafted experience. The campaign is short and there are only a few skirmish maps, but the entire experience is refined and enjoyable. There is no grind or absurd number of side quests. When I come home from work I don't have 100+ hours to sink into some massively padded RPG or sprawling 4x game. This isn't a game made to strain your strategic skill to the breaking point. And I absolutely love that about it. I can create a beautifully crafted dungeon and simply watch with fascination as it operates.

I was a huge fan of Dungeon Keeper 1 and 2 and I've been looking for a similar game for some time. The big question now is, War for the Overworld or Dungeons 2?
War for the Overworld was ultimately a buggy disappointment which entirely failed to capture the personality and style of the Dungeon Keeper series. It's focus on very faced paced competitive game play resulted in the grim dark creatures lacking any sort of style or flair. They don't struggle in the air when you grab them, they don't interact with your hand amusingly, they just act like robots. Every bit of the clunky UI is geared towards facilitating a competitive experience. The "sandbox mode" is literally just a giant blank map with no enemies. Your creatures are boring. Your dungeon is boring. The game is boring.

Dungeons 2 on the other hand is dripping with style and humor. Your creatures interact in amusing ways, are beautifully animated, and generally give a sense of life to the dungeon you create. The narrator is also genuinely funny. The RTS mechanics are simplistic and I believe that is a plus. They don't distract from the dungeon keeper sim and if anything simply act as an additional neat feature. It feels very much like simplistic Warcraft. You spend time below ground making a big horde then unleash it on the world up top to crush up everything. It' s a jolly good time.

I recommend this game heartily to anyone who enjoys excellent animation, style, and relaxing dungeon simulators.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056602136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1933, 'last_played': 1430653996}
review:
Habs jetzt komplett durch und mit einer Spielzeit von 18 Stunden gibts nen daumen nach oben wegen hohem Spaßfaktor, guten Ideen und extrem flachen Witzen :D. Was ich mir  allerdings gewünscht hätte wäre so was wie ein "Unterschlupf" für Monster gewesen, mehr Monstervielfalt da bei 5 Kampfmonstern die Variation massig leidet auch wenn man sie upgraden kann, dass der Schwierigkeitsgrad ruhig hätte schwerer sein können und dass man die Zauber jeder Zeit nutzen darf und nicht erst dann, wenn man das Gebiet eingenommen hat. Zudem hätte das Spiel ruhig eine längere Story haben können wo einem nicht immer gesagt wird was als nächstes zu tun ist.

 Hoffe trotzdem stark auf einen dritten Teil wo all dies beachtet wird, damit man auch als Spieler gefördert wird und sich nicht einfach nur in der Höhle mit Fallen verschanzt und wartet bis man zu stark für den Gegner ist.

Spieleinschätzung: Lässt Kindheitserinnerung wieder aufleben

author: {'steamid': '76561198019364473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1439406462}
review:
[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Dungeon Keeper 2 remeniscent gameplay, what's not to like?
    [*]The narrator does a great job at making fun of the genre, other fantasy games, Game of Thrones and basically anything else he happens to come across.
    [*]Easy to get into.
[/list]

[h1]The Meh[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The game's economy feels very wonky. Lacking Dungeon Keeper's infinite gem sources near your throne room means that the longer the game goes on, the more spread out your gold is going to get. With frequent paydays, this means that your slower creatures will quite literally walk from their work spot to the far end of the dungeon, get their gold, walk back, then by the time they get back they are hungry/craving worship, a bit bored, by the time their needs are filled it's already payday again, causing them to never actually do any work unless you manually transport gold to a central location.
    [*]The campaign isn't very long. The demon campaign feels rather hastily tacked on with only two missions, but then again...
 [*]The demon faction as a whole feels poorly streamlined. Especially the evolution part where you toss a minion into a sacrificial pit and then toss your demon on works very wonky. While the concept is cool, demons tend to get bored/hungry/payday-y while they are evolving and simply wander off. While horde creatures will return to their training after taking care of their needs, demons will refuse to go back, forcing you to toss them in again and start the entire process all-over. This is especially brutal for the third tier creatures, where it can take up to 2 minutes (with improved evolve speed) for them to evolve. I eventually just gave up because they would consistently wander off.
[*]Certain options in the game feel vastly inferior to others. For example, you can turn gold into mana as a demon. Why you would do this is anybody's guess, as it is incredibly easy to get mana, as opposed to gold. Then there's the guard room, which feels like it was added just because Dungeon Keeper had it, yet where in Dungeon Keeper you had to worry about multiple points of entry and you couldn't be everywhere at once, you see enemies coming from miles away in this game thanks to the overworld map, making it a rare day indeed where you can't simply scoop up a handful of creatures and toss them at the entrance to block their entry.
[*]Overworld combat feels incredibly clunky. You can only use a few skills like Entrench and Stealth when you have an entire group of creatures selected, but you can't actually 'subselect' inside this group. So you have to deselect the entire thing, then select only the minions with the skill you want to use, then use it. Which is all a lot of effort when basically the best way to deal with overworld combat is to just zerg in with a huge group and not bother with skills at all.
[/list]


All in all, it's a fun game, but it could use some polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040111339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1516567866}
review: Fun and cheesy, but challenging enough past the first levels. Dungeon Keeper Plus, with an overworld map, and a dungeon map, you can swap between, with stuff to do on both. On the overworld map, you basically play an RTS, sending minions from your dungeon who you control directly. In the dungeon, your creatures have a mind of their own, like in most god genre games. This is not at all like Dungeons gameplay wise. This is much more a dungeon keeper gam in an updated version. Loving it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097616105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1525451573}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993628820', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1430215896}
review:
Its hard to give this game a good review after just playing the first one.

Pro's: 
Good art style, 
Loved the more RTS feel
More rooms

Cons:
No dungeon master persay, no character you directly control.
A lot more childish than the first.
The narrator is annoying as hell.

I would like this as a stand alone game, but after playing the first, I feel like this was lacking.
If it goes on sale, buy it for something to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982793230', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1430371651}
review:
Entertaining but could have been so much more. 

Graphics are good and the story is entertaining enough. There is even a glimpse of good dungeon management but underdeveloped. The overworld RTS elements are pretty weak though. Overall there are a bunch of good ideas but none of them has been followed through. 

Don't get me wrong, this is not a bad game and if you want to play something like dungeon keeper this might be a decent option. But in general there are better ways to spend your money on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976860937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1430044004}
review: This game may be good if you have never played the original. But I would gladly play the original Dungeon Keeper over this any day. To me this is an extremely poor effort at trying to make a sequel and this does no justice to the original game. If you really enjoyed Dungeon Keeper go back and play that as Dungeons 2 may have a similar look but feels like you are playing a baby's game.The narrator is horrible and the overall game play feels like it was put together over a weekend

author: {'steamid': '76561197971723812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1430277150}
review: With a few more steps in the right direction this will be the successor to Dungeon Keeper 2 we have all been waiting for. The only drawback with the game that I have found in my short play time is the lack of creatures in the game. There are only 5 creatures at your disposal (just different skins for Demons and Horde). This is a real disappointment compared to the 12 or so creatures in DK2 as well as the plethora of rooms it had. I love the artwork and sound effects as well as the new item additions for rooms. These were all steps in the right direction, along with the venturing into Hero territory to earn EVILNESS lol. Still though, the game is sorely lacking right now in characters and scenery. These could be very easy additions though so im not giving up hope. An addon, DLC, mods, etc could solve this issue one their own or together. I thuroughly enjoyed my first few hours but once I saw that the 5 creatures and a similar small handful of rooms were all that were at my disposal I was very let down. I quickly jumped into skirmish mode to check that I wasn't worried for no reason, but my suspisions were correct in that I had already seen all that the game had to offer within a few hours. (There are more rooms than creatures but they don't bring more creatures or do anything that much more exciting). There are also only a handful of traps. For a game made 17 years after the last (well this is the one closest to reaching DK2s greatness) there should have been a ridiculous amount of minions, rooms, and traps. More than its predecessor or even approximately the same (within a couple)! But only 5...I really can't repeat that enough. I was having an absolute blast when I hoped in the game a began the path to ABSOLUTE EVIL! It was a big letdown when I saw that it offers maybe a third of DK2s creation content. It's still a lot of fun at first. I can't recommend the game at its current price and with this severe lack of minions and rooms. (Yes the rooms do more...but come on. By todays standards this feels like a smartphone game's worth of content). It is very well done in the amount of things it does, I will say that. The same narrator is back on board and he is hilarious even now. Even with it tapping into that bit of nostalgia perfectly, it was fleeting due to the aformentioned lack of unlocks. This has all the potential in the world but right now I can't recommend it. This really saddens me...feel like I keep repeating myself but 5 minions!? Come on...5!? Wow you can upgrade their armor and weapons and levels. You could do that in 1998. The furniture in the rooms is amazing...but a handful of rooms that half don't unlock anything new? There is really no room for extensive creativity and the lack of MINIONS lol, means that building little plots for rooms is the most eficient way to go. No more sprawling badass dungeons with Black Knights and Bile Demons, Fireflies, Wizrards, Goblins, Imps, Mistresses, Rogues, Salamanders and more!!!!! (Not to mention being able to turn the heros through the torture chamber which was so much fun to collect a few of each of them). Nope, you get an Orc, a Troll, a ...hmmm they aren't very memorable- wait a....NAGA- thats it. A NAGA... and a goblin. Maybe something else. Who gives a shit. The more I type the more I am saddened that they shortened the most enjoyable aspect of the game for me and many others. Look at any rts/city builder and there are ridiculous amounts of units. Not so here. Kalypso, what were you doing!? You had this beautiful game you created with amazing voice acting and artwork. Wonderful sound effects and a logical, exciting campaign (at first). And then you just kind of stopped. Did you run out of money? 5 more units minimum to make it 10 or so total would have been the bare minimum for any game like this. Any RPG in this day and age has more unit types. Hell even Call of Duty has more unit types. It's because this game is so fantastic with what it has that I am so let down by such a gigantic misstep. A huge non-step? I dunno but they had everything going with this game and then just didn't take it further. They laid all this gorgeous, wonderfully executed groundwork, and then they just stopped. I have got to stop..WTF Kalypso!? You broke my heart! Fuck it, I'll recommend it but get your shit together.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997326384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1433640991}
review:
The Dungeon Keeper series has been crying out for a sequel ever since gamers were left hanging with the tantalizing view of Horny walking into the sunlight.  This game has the look, but falls frustratingly short in the execution.
The developers decided to compensate for inability to design a discoverable UX or write a decent manual by having the narrator yell at the user.  Repeatedly.  For example:
You're instructed to build an Arena and drop in a creature.  You do so, it happily flails away, gaining experience points.  On to the next bit of dungeon management...except the narrator is still complaining.  You train the creature again, train another, nothing is good enough.  GET OFF YOUR ARSE, YOU ARSE!!!
Repeated.  Every few minutes.
You exit the game in annoyance and search.  The Dungeons2 forums are down, and naming a game this generically doesn't help in search results.  Eventually you find a review complaining about the issue and discover that all the narrator's yelling about dropping the creature somehow neglected to mention that you also must deselect and then right-click on the Arena to choose a previously-hidden icon that levels the minion.  Brilliant!
(For extra fun, you then complete the level and save.  When you return a few days later to give the game a second chance, it has lost your save and has you back in the same level.  With no creature trained yet and the announcer yelling about it again.  Repeatedly.)
There are other interface issues, and the overworld play seems to be basically "Build big army, abandon dungeon, steamroller foes."  Wait for a 50% off sale if you want a little DK nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970846477', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1430210230}
review:
ไม่ใช่ว่า่ไม่สนุก แต่ยากที่จะให้กดแนะนำ

หลายคนคงคิดว่าเกมนี้คงจะเหมือน Dungeon keeper หรือ Evil genius
ใช่แล้วครับเกมนี้เเหมือน DK1+DK2 เพียงแค่มันเหมือนแต่รูปภายนอกเท่านั้น
ถึงแม้ Dungeons 2 จะพัฒนามาได้เล่นสนุกกว่าภาคแรกแต่มันก็ยังมีอะไรหลายๆอย่างที่ขาด(และเกินมา)

อันดับแรก จะไม่พูดถึงเลยก็คงไม่ได้ก็คือ ไอ้ narrator หรือไอ้คนที่พากษ์คำแนะนำให้เราต่างในเกมตัวดี
มันจะโผล่มาพูดจากวนใจว่าเรายังไม่ได้ทำตามที่มันบอกหรือสั่งทุกๆ 5 นาที
พอเรายังไม่ไป มันก็เริ่มเปลี่ยนจากให้คำแนะนำ(?) เป็นคำดูถูกเหยียดหยามแล้วด่าเราไปเรื่อยๆ
ไม่รู้ว่าเราเป็นเจ้านายมันหรือขี้ข้ามันกันแน่ ซึ่งนอกจากจะกวนใจและกวนตีนสุดแสนแล้ว
เสียงพากษ์กับบทพูดมันก็ ห่วยบรม ห่วยขนาดถึงกับต้องเข้าไปหาดูว่ามีวิธีปิดมันมั้ยเลยทีเดียว ขอบอกคำเดียวว่าเหี้ย

เรื่องต่อมาก็คือเรื่องจังหวะต่างๆในเกม ซึ่งสำหรับผมแล้วมันรู้สึกว่าน่ารำคาญมากกว่าสนุก
ใน intro เกมมันบอกไว้ว่าพวกฮีโร่ขยันบุกเข้าไปในดันเจี้ยนทุกวี่วันจน Supreme Evil หรือตัวเราปรี๊ดแตก
จนในที่สุดก็ททนไม่ไหวต้องยกกองทัพออกมากระทิบพวกอาณาจักรพันธมิตรออกมาเป็นเกมภาค 2 นี้

ตอนแรกฟังดูก็ตลกดีครับ พอมาเล่นจริงเสือกเป็นอย่างที่มันบอก ไอ้พวกผู้กล้าขยันแห่มาทุกๆ 5 นาทีจริงๆ
ไม่รู้จะขยันมาอะไรนักหนา แถมมาไม่ได้มาแบบปาร์ตี้ไร้สมองที่โดนกับดักเราตายหมดระหว่างทางด้วย
มันเสือกมาพร้อมโจรซะ 9 ใน 10 ครั้ง กับดักทั้งหลายที่วางไว้ก็เลยใช้ไม่ได้ผล
กลายเป็นว่าต้องมานั่งสั่งในลูกน้องไปตบคีกับฮีโร่ในดันเเจี้ยนทุกๆ 5 นาที วุ่นวายมาก
มิหนำซ้ำ ไอ้ payday หรือวันจ่ายตัง มันก็อยู่ราวๆ 5 นาทีอีกเหมือนกัน(มึงจะเร็วไปมั้ย?)
ก็เลยกลายเป็นว่าทุกๆ 5 นาทีนอกจากต้องมากังวลกับพวกฮีโร่ที่ขยันมากันแล้ว
ยังต้อง ขุด ขุด แล้วก็ขุดหาทองในแผนที่เพื่อหาเงินมาจ่ายเงินเดือน ต่อเติมห้องใหม่ และวิจัยพัฒนาด้วย
แรกๆก็ผมยังมานั่งเล็งขุดเป็นห้องสวยงามอยู่หรอก
แต่พอหลังๆไม่ล่ะ กดลากขุดทั้งแผนที่ไปเเลยไม่งั้นไม่จบไม่สิ้นซักที

ต่อไปเรื่องความยาวเกมกับเนื้อเรื่อง
เกมมันก็ไม่ยาวมาก เล่นไม่เกิน 20 ชม ก็ควรจะจบได้แล้ว

แต่ไอ้เรื่องความยาวเกมมันไม่สำคัญครับ ที่สำคัญคือเนื้อเรื่องเสือกไม่จบ....
มีแค่ครึ่งๆกลางๆมาก ศัตรูตัวเอ้จัดการได้แค่ 1 แต่อีก 2 ตัวยังยืนรอเราอยู่ซะงั้น
นี่กะรอเข็น DLC มาขายดูเลยนี่หว่า... คือเกมราคา 40 ยูโรเนี่ยมันไม่ควรจะทำกันแบบนี้นะ จังไรจริงๆ

เรื่องที่เหลืออย่างกราฟิกที่ดูสดใสน่ารักที่ไม่เข้ากับเกมเลยซักนิดก็ดี
หรือเรื่องที่ตัวโมเดลต่างๆโดยเฉพาะศัตรูออกจะขนาดรายละเอียดและความน่าสนใจก็ดี
ต้องบอกว่าอยู่ในระดับที่พอกล้ำกลืนฝืนทนได้คือไม่มีอะไรจะชม แต่ก็ไม่ได้ถึงขาดต้องหยิบมาเขียนบ่นอะไร

สุดท้ายคือข้อดีของเกมนี้ เขียนด่ามาเยอะแล้วมาฟังข้อดีกันบ้าง
- เป็นเกมแนว DK ที่นานๆจะออกมาซักที พอใช้เล่นให้หายคิดถึงได้
- เกมสั้น ทำให้ไม่ต้องทนฟังไอ้คนพากษ์ในเกมมากว่านี้

สรุป ถ้าคุณคาดหวังว่าเกมนี้จะทำให้คุณได้นั่งดูเหล่าผู้กล้าที่หลงเข้ามาในอาณาจักรสุดชัวร้ายของคุณค่อยๆถูกคุณทรมาณสารพัดอย่างเหมือนลูกไก้ในกำมือล่ะก็ ขอบอกเลยว่าไปมองหาเกมอื่นเถอะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198117695860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1641326034}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992636789', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1468635800}
review: If you liked the original Dungeon Keeper series, you'll like this game. The witty comical comments throughout this game as you're playing are quite "refreshing". Just under 25 hours of total gameplay in the campaign mode. Lot's of pop culture references, TV references, other game references, and stabs at some of the aforementioned, are present.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003784297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1438902089}
review: Loving the mix and the pacing. Some may complain that it takes too long to set up before you send your hoard out to destroy the overworld, but that's kinda the point of the whole thing. You're like Mordor, slowly building up before the unleash and the end of all things good. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197998740808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1430334450}
review:
Slow and boring...

The game is just dull, build this, ok now go here and kill this. Spells dont mean anything. The "invaders" into your dungeon are non-existent. The roam in all stupid like and die. I never feel like my dungeon is in danger. The narrator was meant to be funny but is just freaking miserable to listen to. I get having some quirky statements and the game trying to be funny. The whole game is the narrator being overly simple and blunt. Constantly mentioning other games and dropping names of popular culture favs. 

The game is nothing, just sit there and build up some stuff and then order your minions to fight by right clicking. There are some spells but there is no easy way in battle to use them. As far as I can tell no one thought making it easy to pick up minions by just clicking the potrait was a good idea and I find it tedious to order them around. 

Basically day 1 I was kind of meh about the game. Day 2 I got bored and I came back for a third day to find myself not even wanting to play. A waste of $40. A huge waste of money. 

I would rather go play dungeon keeper than this nonsense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132572586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1431691413}
review:
하아.. 이 글을 쓰는 지금 총 플레이시간이 5시간이다.몇 번을 팅겼는지 모르겠다. 5시간 하는데 3일이 걸렸고 ...버그로 인해 게임이 종료되면 잠시 다른 행동을 하고 다시 돌아와서 게임을 하는 것을 무한 반복했다.

내가 돈 주고 산 게임... 무슨 버그 테스트 하는 것도 아니고 5시간 게임하는 동안 총 10번은 팅겼다.

한글 패치되는 5월4일에 많은 분들이 구매를 하실지 모르겠지만 아마 게임을 하는 도중 나처럼 속상해 하지 않았으면 한다.

덜 팅길 때 와서 평가를 수정하겠다. 오늘 2015년4월29일까지 엄청 팅기고 있음.1시간 했는데 3번 팅김

author: {'steamid': '76561198009943537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1449439443}
review:
Kurz und knapp: Für 20€ wäre bei mir der Daumen hochgegangen.

Ich finde es fast schon dreißt so etwas für 45€ zu verkaufen. NUR 2 Spielbare Völker, von denen die Dämon deutlich schwächer sind, außer man nutzt gekonnt die Fähigkeiten, aber dazu müsste das Handling der einheiten schon an Starcraft heranreichen, was es aber bei weitem nicht tut.

Aber was ich die Krönung an frechheit finde ganze 3!!!! Karten für den Gefechtsmodus, da hätte ich mir deutlich mehr erhofft bzw. vorausgesetzt.

Ein paar mehr Einheiten, wären auch klasse gewesen, so hat man nach wenigen Stunden alles gesehen, alles Ausgebaut alles platt gemacht *gääähn*

Ich finde es auch schade, dass das alte Prinzip nicht übernommen wurde....Helden in den Dungeon zu locken und sie dann zu töten wenn sie "glücklich" sind, es hätte so genial sein können, wenn das balancing besser gewesen wäre im ersten teil, und die Helden nicht irgendwann einfach zu mächtig waren weil der Lord mit Stufen und fähigkeiten nicht hinterher kam.

Fazit an die Entwickler, fasst euch mal alle an den Kopf, und entscheidet selbst ob ihr für sowas 45€ ausgeben und lange zeit spaß daran haben würdet

author: {'steamid': '76561198006267993', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1430271466}
review:
The game tries very hard to be like old DK, but frankly it is not challenging. 5 hours in and i have nearly finished the whole game. $45 USD for 5 hours of gameplay is insaine. 

Additionally, unless you are willing to sign up to their online service (which goes down and throws you out of the game) you wont be able to save your progression other than manual saves. Even the original DK let you play on from unlocked levels for crying out loud. 

GG welcome to the new age. Strongly disappointed. bah!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046010655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1430304389}
review:
Edited for after I was able to find the last 2 levels....

TLDR: Get Dwelvers it's $14.99, and in beta has more content than this "completed" $40 game.

I'll start this review with what I did like. 

1. It's a faithfull Dungeon Keeper clone. It's fun being a bad guy and fighting the forces of good.
2. I loved the artwork, graphics, way the characters look, etc.
3. The story is fun and well written.
4. It is a fun game overall, at a price point of say $15, I would give it a thumbs up. 

Now for what I didn't like.

1. Too much handholding. For example "you are going to be attacked in 3:45 and counting, get ready here they come" on every single level for every enemy. "Here is a big exclamation of where you need to go and what you need to do" and the narator relentlessly pesters you to go there at a rapid pace, or "build these unit because you need them". I would prefer to be surprised when I explore and not have the game lead me through every minor step.

2. Way too easy, with no way to increase the difficulty. Build a trap chest at the end of a 4x6 room, preceeded by a swinging mace, and 2 tar pits.. and you can defeat about 90% of the enemies that enter your dungeon.  There are a couple levels where more enemies come in, oh but they warn you well ahead of time so you just prepare for that. They do have an interesting mechanic where the enemies will send the bard in first to disable your traps, but if you put the trapped chest behind your traps the greedy good guys will bypass this and not wait for the bard because they want to get the treasure first, and they all die, every time. I would much prefer a color system, like a green bard can disable x and y traps, a blue bard can disable y and z traps, and no trapped chest that bypass the bards entirely. That way you would have to actually have an assortment of traps to handle different party configs. But no, the level 1 traps kill everything and there is no reason to even upgrade to the level 2 or 3 traps unless for fun and to just see how they work. 

Surface creeps are equally easy, you pretty much just steamroll everything. I think the original concept was you should only bring half your crew and leave the other half in the dungeon to continue working? But you quickly find out that in every encounter, the 1 or 2 of your army that die are resurrected (with zero penalty) inside your dungeon and start working anyway. So anyone playing quickly finds out that you just take your entire army out and the few that do die can get the dungeon in working order for your return. The one exception to this rule and was an interesting surprise, in that your level 2 healers actually STOP healing when they hit level 3 and turn into pure DPS chars. So I did get decimated once and I was unable to ressurect everyone before they decayed and had to rebuild my army from scratch. But I quickly learned my lesson to just leave my healers at level 2 and never upgraded them the rest of the game.

3. Almost zero control over your troops. Example.. So you can make these cool assasins, they can turn invisible and with 2 or 3, pretty much kill a high value target. They get a a high DPS sneak attack when coming out of stealth. So let's say a group of enemies comes into your dungeon and you want to assassinate the bard. Is there any way to do this? Nope sorry! You either sound an alarm bell and watch your troops come in 1 at a time, or you manually pick them up drop them near the enemies and hope for the best. Zero control, they just kinda duke it out and occaisionally use the skills they have. Now the game is simply easy (to the point of trivial) so this is really a small complaint, but if there were any challenge associated with battles, and you wanted to actually kill specific high value targets in any kind of order. Like let's say kill the healers first... You can't. Now on the surface you get a little more control over your troops you can manually click the unit and position it, and use it's special ability. But when you have 12 units in a fight, clicking on each one giving it a command as it's running around is kinda pointless with such short battles. The only micro control you actually do is move the tanks to the front, healrs and dps in the back, and wade into the enemy and it's over very quickly. Ideally you would not have to click on each single unit. I would rather select my entire army, hit tab to select the blood orcs, have them summon wolves, hit tab to select my asassins, have them turn invisible to get a bonus attack from stealth, etc. But combat was seriously overlooked and as a result they just opted for short combats with 6 "good guys" against your 12 "evil" horde. It's simply a steamroll because there is no combat functionality built into the game. 

4. Game sounds and narrator. At first when you start out it's very enjoyable. The narrator is a dick and yelling at you to do stuff. It's wonderful! But after the 19th time the narrator tells you to "Go make 3 orcs and go to this spot on the map I'm sick of waiting for you" it gets old. This also ties into the handholding. The narrator is better muted so you can explore the game and have fun. instead of constantly yelling at you and telling you exactly where to go and what to build next. The Demon mana generators also make the most annoying noise I have ever heard in any video game in a long long time. Mute, mute mute.. Ahh much better... The game noises are gone and play some Pandora, much much better. 

5. Not enough content. If I didn't play through it 2x looking for the last 2 levels (small bug just click on the skeleton icon and it takes you there). I would estimate the game can be completed in 15 hours. For $40, I expect to get between 30-60 hours of gameplay from it for it to be a good value. Compared to their competition, a game named Dwelvers, which runs $15 and I have 30 hours into it on beta, this is not a good value IMO. 

6. Spell system. With the exception of "recall to base" troops and the "go here" spell. The remaining 25 spells are useless and the entire system is not even worth bothering with. For example you shoot a fireball and it does virtually no damage. Shoot a metoer storm? Oh yeah area effect virtually no damage also. Again this is a minor complaint since a level 1 exploding chest does 90% damage to most units. But why even put it in there? The only use I could find for the spells is like a would see a fairie with 2 health left limping into my dungeon, and I wanted to shut the narrator up screaming "enemies in your dungeon!" and I could not be bothered to pick up an orc to kill them? Yeah I'll shoot a fireball to do 3 damage and kill that limping fairy who somehow magically managed to survive the 4 level 1 traps who usually dispatch most most enemies. But most of the time you just ignore the fairy, she will run into something and get one shotted soon enough. But yeah, it was nice to just to shut the narrator up and have him stop screaming at you I guess. But magic on the whole is innefective and useless. 

Closing thoughts....

If there was maybe a way to make it more difficult so you don't just blow through it so fast and more of a challenge. It would have a lot going for it, particuarlly the enjoyable art and great dungeon building tools they have in place. I would also like to see an enemy evil guy to compete with, who breaks into your dungeon from a random place, but instead the enemies always come through the main door, 6 every time with zero challenge, run into your traps and die. Also when digging inot a new room full of spiders, have them get mad and charge in to to kill my guys, not just stand sit there until I can get around to farming them for expos. They had some great ideas, just a sad implementation and were probably on a limited schedule for release. It shows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009717593', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1450213193}
review:
比想象中的好玩的多，是个值得玩一下的游戏

现在没玩多人模式，但是玩了剧情模式

1.游戏整体难度不是很高，循序渐进，很能享受当年DK2 那种慢慢设计自己地城的感觉

2.地城氛围分为2个阵营，都各具特色，兵种，陷阱也不同，玩起来很有意思

3.对于不在自己领土不能释放魔法的这个设定，总觉得很中二啊...

4.剩下就是人口的设计，很大程度上限制了前期的发展，兵种一律2口人，大部分升级都是3人口，对于混沌恶魔(chaotic evil）来多，前期比终极恶魔(ultimate evil)要困难的多，虽然也给游戏增加的一定可玩性...

author: {'steamid': '76561198127075173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 14399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7564, 'last_played': 1511367555}
review:
Если первая Dungeons была как вампирша-проститутка рекламирующая пылесосы, т.е. сосала во всех смыслах, D2 - шикарная весчь полностью оправдывающая потраченных средств. Моя личная оценка не смотря на незначительные минусы 9/10, и то только потому что я из принципа никогда не ставлю 10.
З.Ы. И да-да-да.. это не DK3. И это хорошо! Пичальный War for the Overworld мне в свидетели.
З.Ы.v2.Обращение к игрокам: Товарищи пираты, я сам обычно сперва играю в пи-(цезура, так ее)-ратку, прежде чем купить игру, дабы ненароком не спустить деньги на кал (к слову, первую часть я не купил... ( *)_( *) ). Но если эта игра вам понравилась , то обязательно приобретите офф-версию. Хотя-бы таким образом сказав спасибо от русско-язычного контингента за чудесную офф-локализацию. Нас не так уж часто ими балуют, тем более такого качества!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970039317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1432966992}
review:
Ein wirklich schönes Spiel mit viel Liebe zum Detail.
Man muss nicht alles mögen, aber man merkt dem Spiel an, dass es mit viel Herzblut entwickelt wurde.

Die Bedienung ist etwas umständlich, trotzdem macht es mir einen Heidenspass auszuprobieren, Neues zu entdecken, und manchmal auch einfach nur zuzugucken. 

Ich hatte etwas Angst vor übertriebenen, zwanghaften Humor, aber so schlimm ist es garnicht. Im Gegenteil: Habe mich bislang doch öfter beim breiten Grinsen ertappt. Wenn der Sprecher etwas seltener kommentieren würde, wäre es noch angenehmer.

Also trotz der vorhandenen Macken von mir eine Kaufempfehlung. Vor allen Dingen aufgrund der Detailverliebtheit und des großen Spielspasses den ich mit diesem Game habe. 
Da entwickelt sich für mich ein würdiger Dungeon Keeper Nachfolger, der nicht einfach nur kopiert, sondern auch neue Ideen einbringt.

Der Preis ist vielleicht etwas am Limit, aber das reguliert sich ja bekanntlich schnell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075540073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1458753076}
review:
Казуальная ртс-подобная игра на 20 часов геймпея. Наконец-то зло победило, задолбали эти герои со своими рейдами за лутом и экспой... ворвуться, натопчат, убьют любимую животинку, разграбят сокровищницу, а потом ищи их...

В меру юмора. 10 из 10: 1 королева наг по имени Лед Гага, её подруга медуза Кин Кардашан -- 1 штука, 1 полубог Катос, 1 волшебник Гаршильд и по мелочи: Шнак, Шнык, Шна, Шныр, Шнус и главной среди слабаков -- Шнух.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017080678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1472919765}
review:
Brilliant game, great humour. Some people say it tries to sell you things, they don't understand jokes. But anyway, tons of references, great gameplay if you are into slow dungeon building, if you try to rush levels you can have a good fast paced close calls game too. Currently it's quite new so only 2 playable factions, single player campaign is good, about 30 hours of gameplay and skirmishes are always nice.

I give it a 8/10, great game, hope they improve it, get rid of bugs like mono crash (After around 6 hours ingame you sometimes get a crash) and add the undead as a playable faction, as well as other evil things too, there are so many more evils to make factions for I think this game will have at least 2 or 3 DLC's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009618806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1430153247}
review: Честно говоря игра ужасна, вроде  и графика не плохая, и идея хорошая, но до ужаса скучна, и после двух часов игры становится не интересна, учитывая её цену. Игра во многом похожа на Dangeon Keepper 2, былобы лучше если бы разработчики взяли её за основу улучшив только графику.  Начнем с того что очень не удобно выбирать существ одного типа, надо кликать в каждого отдельно, иногда случайно выбирая тех кого не нужно. очень частые выплаты за существ, бесы просто работают на зарплату монстрам когда их становится под предельное количество, и ничего построить не представляется возможности. Такое ощющение что существа только и делают что жрут и гребут деньги из нашей казны, тренировки и работа их вообще не интересует, что очень делает их похожими на некоторых людей.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961943532', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2110, 'last_played': 1444970646}
review:
Game Crashes!, No support for 2560x1080, Huge LACK of Content for a $40 game!.
It isn't right! people who recommended it are either Fans or Kalypso developers.

no support for people with 2560x1080 monitors and the game is unplayable since the camera gets stuck. (Even after the recent patch).
When swapping to 1920x1080 the edges of the screen do not block the mouse over and makes the game very difficult to play

The so called humor isn't funny in this game at all it feels childish and too much "try hard".
The game seems to be fairly unbalanced in my opinion.
It plays Sluggish and easily becomes repetitive.

for 45 euros, this game isn't worth it, probably the time invested into this 2,4 GB sized game it took them perhaps 4~6 months to make this game isn't a Tripple AAA game and shouldn't be priced as one either.
for 20 euro's this would be a fine game but in the current state with lack of support its not worth it at all.
-The options are extremely limited.
-The game is too easy there are no other difficulties
-The game lacks High amounts of content (wich will be sold as DLC probably)
-There are still bugs where you can get Connection issues (while in single player) which kick you from your current map and you'll have to start over.
-Before you purchase this please consider reading their forums even when they say in patch notes
"Added support for 21:9" is not added and connection issue still remains.

All in all it seems a Cheap rip and badly made rip off from Dungeon keeper there are hardly elements in this game that are unqiue and would stand out from any other clone.

I am very dissapointed and i regret wasting money onto this game.
My recommendation for a dungeon RTS " War for the overworld "
(yes its in beta but its a hell of a lot better then this.)
